ADVICE@ENCHANTMENTS@DESCRIPTION There is an enchantment which you may cast upon your units without economic repercussions from its upkeep. You can always cancel an enchantment later.
ADVICE@ENCHANTMENTS@INSTRUCTION Select to open Spells.

ADVICE@FIRSTEMPIRESKILL_REMINDER@DESCRIPTION You can now acquire your first empire skill.[br/][br/] Empire skills can provide you with some powerful bonuses and shape the progression of your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}. Your {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} will unlock new empire skills over time. You can then spend {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink} to acquire them.
ADVICE@FIRSTEMPIRESKILL_REMINDER@INSTRUCTION Left-click to check the Empire Skill tree

ADVICE@GOLDAMOUNT_REMINDER@INSTRUCTION Select to open your Throne City panel
ADVICE@GOLDAMOUNT_REMINDER@TITLE Running out of Gold
ADVICE@HEROCAP_REMINDER@DESCRIPTION It's time to recruit a new {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}![br/][br/] Heroes are powerful units, able to settle new <<m: {GLOBAL.OutpostConcept.Hyperlink}>> and lead your <<m:{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}>> in battle. They also provide useful bonuses to the city they are assigned to as a {GLOBAL.GovernorConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/] In order to expand your hero capacity and recruit your first hero, acquire new cities, or go over your hero capacity by spending {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink}.

ADVICE@LOWFOOD_REMINDER@DESCRIPTION {LowFoodCity.Name} is suffering from low {GLOBAL.FoodConcept.Hyperlink} income.[br/][br/] Food regulates the pace at which each {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} can get new {GLOBAL.PopulationConcept.Hyperlink} and so annex new <<m: {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>.{GLOBAL.PopulationUpkeepConcept.Hyperlink} requires food and may be the cause of such a shortage.[br/][br/] Some <<m: {GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m: {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> can increase the amount of food that a city produces per {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}.

ADVICE@LOWFOOD_REMINDER@TITLE {LowFoodCity.Name} has low food income
ADVICE@LOWGOLD_REMINDER@DESCRIPTION Your empire's {GLOBAL.GoldConcept.Hyperlink} income is low.[br/][br/] With a low gold income, you will soon not be able to sustain your empire's needs.[br/][br/]{GLOBAL.UnitUpkeepConcept.Hyperlink} can often be a common cause of low gold income. Try to expand your {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink} and build <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> or build <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>> in your <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> that can provide you with additional gold per {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}.

ADVICE@LOWMANA_REMINDER@DESCRIPTION Your empire's {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink} income is low.[br/][br/] With low mana income, you will soon not be able to sustain your empire's needs.[br/][br/]Units with {GLOBAL.UnitEnchantmentConcept.Hyperlink} can often be a common cause of low mana income. Try to expand your {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink} and build <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> or build <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>> that can provide you with additional mana per turn.

ADVICE@LOWSTABILITY_REMINDER@DESCRIPTION {LowStabCity.Name} has low {GLOBAL.CityStabilityConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/] Stability dictates how much control you have over a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}. The higher the stability, the better the bonus. With negative stability, also come troublesome events, like {GLOBAL.CityStabilityUnrest.Hyperlink} or {GLOBAL.CityStabilityRioting.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/] Each {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink} decreases the amount of stability by a small amount. Some <<m: {GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>, such as a tavern, increase stability.
ADVICE@LOWSTABILITY_REMINDER@INSTRUCTION Select to go to {LowStabCity.Name}
ADVICE@LOWSTABILITY_REMINDER@TITLE {LowStabCity.Name} has low stability

ADVICE@NEARBY_INFESTATION@DESCRIPTION There is an infestation closing in on your border. While for now it might only send raiding parities, once it overlaps your territory, the patrols will start burning these provinces down as well. The damage done by such infestations can be extensive, so take care. [br/] Infestations can be slowed down by destroying their patrol stacks, but to ultimately deal with it you must destroy the Infestation Spawner.
ADVICE@NEARBY_INFESTATION@INSTRUCTION Select to go to the Infestation
ADVICE@NEARBY_INFESTATION@TITLE Dangerous Infestation

As a Free City gains a higher Allegiance to you, you will form pacts that benefit your empire.[br/][br/]Give a {GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept.Hyperlink} to {VarHouse.Name} to start negotiations.

Additionally, when your Ruler is dead, your {GLOBAL.ResearchConcept.Hyperlink} progress will be halted.[br/][br/] If your {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink} is taken while your Ruler is dead, you will be defeated.[br/][br/] Your Ruler will stay in the void for 3 <<m: {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>, before being brought back to life in your Throne City.

An Outpost needs {amount2} <<m: {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> in order to be settled.

While channeling:[bulletlist][bullet/]Your {GLOBAL.AstralConcept.Hyperlink} <<m:{GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}>> cost -{discount}% {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink}, <<m: {GLOBAL.WorldMapCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>, and <<m: {GLOBAL.CombatCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Each turn in combat, a random enemy takes {amount} mixed Fire, Lightning, and Frost, damage and gets {amount2} {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.SUNDERED_RESISTANCE.Hyperlink} and {amount3} {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.STATUS_VULNERABILITY.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Hostile armies will be spawned next to your <<m:{GLOBAL.AffinityProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> in an attempt to destroy them.

This will help in achieving {GLOBAL.MagicVictoryConcept.Hyperlink} and provide an additional +{resource} {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink}. {LOC.AFFINITYCONTENT@NODE_CONVERSION@CASUSBELLIWARNING}

Repeats {amount}-{amount2} times.[bullet/]Hostile armies will be spawned next to your <<m:{GLOBAL.AffinityProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> in an attempt to destroy them.
AFFINITYCONTENT@MATERIUM_FINISHER_SPELL@NAME Age of Materium
AFFINITYCONTENT@MATERIUM_FINISHER_SPELL@PROP_DESCRIPTION Each turn, a friendly unit gains {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERED_DEFENSE.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERED_RESISTANCE.Hyperlink}. Repeats {amount}-{amount2} times.
AFFINITYCONTENT@MATERIUM_NODE_CONVERSION@DESCRIPTION Converts a {GLOBAL.RootNodeConcept.Hyperlink} to {GLOBAL.MateriumConcept.Hyperlink}. This will help in achieving {GLOBAL.MagicVictoryConcept.Hyperlink} and provide an additional +{resource} {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink}. {LOC.AFFINITYCONTENT@NODE_CONVERSION@CASUSBELLIWARNING}
AFFINITYCONTENT@MATERIUM_NODE_CONVERSION@NAME Convert Root Node to [matter/] Materium
AFFINITYCONTENT@NATURE_FINISHER_SPELL@DESCRIPTION Channel the Age of Nature to reach the {GLOBAL.MagicVictoryConcept.Hyperlink}. While channeling:[bulletlist][bullet/]Your {GLOBAL.NatureConcept.Hyperlink} <<m:{GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}>> cost -{discount}% {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink}, <<m: {GLOBAL.WorldMapCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>, and <<m: {GLOBAL.CombatCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Every {amount} turns in combat, a Tier {tierMin}-{tierMax} nature unit is summoned on your side.[bullet/]Hostile armies will be spawned next to your <<m:{GLOBAL.AffinityProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> in an attempt to destroy them.
AFFINITYCONTENT@NATURE_FINISHER_SPELL@NAME Age of Nature
AFFINITYCONTENT@NATURE_FINISHER_SPELL@PROP_DESCRIPTION Every {amount} turns, a Tier {tierMin}-{tierMax} nature unit is summoned on your side.
AFFINITYCONTENT@NATURE_NODE_CONVERSION@DESCRIPTION Converts a {GLOBAL.RootNodeConcept.Hyperlink} to {GLOBAL.NatureConcept.Hyperlink}. This will help in achieving {GLOBAL.MagicVictoryConcept.Hyperlink} and provide an additional +{resource} {GLOBAL.FoodConcept.Hyperlink}. {LOC.AFFINITYCONTENT@NODE_CONVERSION@CASUSBELLIWARNING}
AFFINITYCONTENT@NATURE_NODE_CONVERSION@NAME Convert Root Node to [nature/] Nature
AFFINITYCONTENT@NODE_CONVERSION@CASUSBELLIWARNING Converting a Root Node will give other Rulers a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}.
AFFINITYCONTENT@ORDER_FINISHER_SPELL@DESCRIPTION Channel the Age of Order to reach the {GLOBAL.MagicVictoryConcept.Hyperlink}. While channeling:[bulletlist][bullet/]Your {GLOBAL.OrderConcept.Hyperlink} <<m:{GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}>> cost -{discount}% {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink}, <<m: {GLOBAL.WorldMapCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>, and <<m: {GLOBAL.CombatCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Each turn in combat, a random ally gains {amount} random positive status effects and loses all negative status effects.[bullet/]Hostile armies will be spawned next to your <<m:{GLOBAL.AffinityProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> in an attempt to destroy them.
AFFINITYCONTENT@ORDER_FINISHER_SPELL@NAME Age of Order

CAMPAIGN@LORDS@CUSTOM_TITLE_1@GENDER ^m
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@FRIKKA@BIO Frikka is an ancient Godir in the guise of a Halfling, with a penchant for cunning and frivolity. Her sharp mind and quicker wit are testament to the time spent learning from the Archons before their withdrawal. Ever a fickle being, her motivations are as changeable as the winds. Mischief and mayhem are interchangeable with seemingly selfless acts of kindness that leave those who deal with her reeling with confusion and reaching for an understanding that is simply unattainable![br/][br/]The Gleeful Miscreants are the aptly named race of rat-like folk that worship Frikka as master and muse. They delight in the mischief she is so talented in sowing and will, at her behest, occasionally pretend to capture her in order to lure in hapless would-be rescuers. Like Frikka herself, their looks often serve to deceive those who gaze upon them and see only helpless vermin.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_1@NAME Nimue^F
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@HERO_TITLE_1@TITLE Siren Goddess
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@HERO_TITLE_1@TITLE@GENDER ^f
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_00@FIRST_NAME Ham^M
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_00@LAST_NAME Binger^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_00@TITLE Grand Steward
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_00@TITLE@GENDER ^m
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_01@FIRST_NAME Frikka^F
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_02@LAST_NAME Dynosis^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_03@FIRST_NAME Otto^M
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_03@LAST_NAME the Discarded^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_04@FIRST_NAME Decimus^M
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_04@LAST_NAME the Unwavering^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_05@FIRST_NAME Meandor^M
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_05@LAST_NAME of House Inioch^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_06@FIRST_NAME Arachna^F
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_07@FIRST_NAME Yaka^M
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_08@FIRST_NAME Sundren^F
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_08@LAST_NAME Of House Inioch^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_09@FIRST_NAME Melenis^F
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_09@LAST_NAME the Lifeless^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_10@FIRST_NAME Ydgaard^M
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_10@LAST_NAME Worldbender^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_11@FIRST_NAME Turiel^M
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_11@LAST_NAME Tolarim^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_12@FIRST_NAME Khir^M
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_12@LAST_NAME Uranon^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_13@FIRST_NAME Cinren^M
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_13@LAST_NAME Toliath^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_14@FIRST_NAME Lithyl^F
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_14@LAST_NAME Nightweaver^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_15@FIRST_NAME Shira^F
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_15@LAST_NAME Snowblood^z
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@MELENIS@BIO The cruelest Dark Elf assassins revere this Godir, Dancer of Death, Melenis. Once the lithe mistress to Prince Meandor, she died and rose a deadly creature of undeath. Vanquished in that form, she revived anew as queen to Dark Elf assassins. Some say her mad dance between life and death leaves her fixated upon vengeance. Her bitter life taught her that all succumb to death and only fools dare hope.[br/][br/]These sinister Undead Lichbringers seek to master the ghastly secrets of their deadly mistress, Melenis. They tread a trail of stolen lives, steeped in tragedy. They know of no atrocity that will stay their hand from the relentless pursuit of life and death and unlife and undeath, through cultic means and forbidden lore.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_0@NAME Wholesome Halflings
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_13@NAME Grave Underlings
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_14@NAME Onmar
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_15@NAME Blackfurred Forgelings
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_16@NAME Ashborn Hedonists
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_17@NAME Forgotten Ones
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_18@NAME Arctic Felines
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_1@NAME Chosen Children
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_2@NAME Gleeful Miscreants
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_3@Name Drowned Recreants
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_4@Name Atoning Toadmen
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_5@NAME Dark Elves
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_6@NAME Reclusive Spiderlings
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_7@NAME Firebrand Predators
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_8@NAME Mended Torchbearers
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_9@NAME Undead Lichbringers
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_ARACHNA@BIO A spinner of exquisite crafting, she sings a luring melody from the hidden place, feeling the vibrations in the strings of her many tangled web. The weaver Arachna spins intrigue, ensnaring lost souls that wander into darkness to hide their shame. Her dark servants move about the world, while she lurks deep in the nest of shadows.[br/][br/]Arachna discovered that some Goblins were so distasteful that her beloved spiders refused to consume them. With that, her Dark Spiderlings were born. These symbiotic fiends love lurking unnoticed in the recesses of the world. They breed their arachnids, which have now grown to such enormous proportions that they ride them into combat.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_CINREN@BIO An attractive elf who nevertheless evokes an aura of haughty superiority, Cinren wears a perpetual sneer of lecherous intent. It is said that he has devoted much of his existence to the magical honing of carnal delights, often careening down dark and morally ambiguous pathways in order to reach undiscovered realms of pleasure.[br/][br/]The group of elves known as the Ashborn Hedonists follow Cinren Toliath and revere his godlike pursuit of pleasure. Powerful practitioners of magic in their own right, they seek to bring all under the sway of their master in order to provide more fodder towards his lecherous machinations.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_DISCARDEDAI@BIO Once, Otto was Nimue's eighth favorite, and for a short while everything was good. Being abandoned by his Goddess initiated his ascension to Godirhood, although he fears what these powers may do to him. Now he leads the people who call themselves Recreants, wearing the shame of Nimue's abandonment as a banner. Whether Godirhood is a blessing or a curse to the created Otto… only time will tell.[br/][br/]The Drowned Recreants were once named Nimue's Chosen Children and a friend to beast and man alike. They were loved by their Goddess, and they loved her in return. She, however, eventually grew disappointed with their flaws and discarded them, drowning many in her wrath. Now, those who remain call themselves the Drowned Recreants and are trying to start a civilization of their own, though many still fear the wrath of their former Goddess.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_ELEANOR@BIO Once a proud and powerful Elven Empress beside her husband Inioch, Eleanor perished giving birth to her son, Prince Meandor. Her soul wandered to {GLOBAL.AuldwealdLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, where a tomb was created to honor her, protecting her from the ills the origin world of the Elves had to endure.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_INIOCH@BIO Once the uncontested sovereign of the Valley of Wonders, Inioch refused to yield to the divine contracts that anointed his divine right to rule. Turning against all that was holy, he plumbed the depths of death. Now, he is little but a fragmented soul, unable to reach the Well of Creation and what lies beyond.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_KHIR@BIO The name Khir Uranon has often been spoken in dreaded whisper. Those that know his name know him to be a demonic manipulator, whose mastery of the forge is fueled by a callous disregard for the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SoulsLoreConcept]souls[/hyperlink] he infuses his creations with.[br/][br/]The Blackfurred Forgelings are known for their prodigious strength and merciless cruelty, both aspects forged in the fires of their masters' ancient crucibles. Here, they help him utilize the souls of those that fall before them to power demonic artifacts.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_LITHYL@BIO Rumors surround the origins of enigmatic Lithyl Nightweaver, the half-masked wizard who seemed to appear from the Astral Void itself. Shortly after her arrival on Magehaven she joined the Shad'rai on their quest for power over others. Charming and conniving, she seems to be one of many mad Godir, haunted by her Torment of Shadows. But Lithyl specifically stands out for her talent of appearing and disappearing at opportune times.[br/][br/]Not all who wander the Astral Sea are Godir. Many mortals find themselves lost in its depths, forgotten, with no divine power to save them. One Godir has taken it upon herself to save these lost souls. Lithyl Nightweaver reaches out an eldritch hand to pull the Forgotten Ones from the void, no matter how haunted and scarred it left them. Whatever her ulterior motives may be, Lithyl has won her people's undying devotion.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_LOYALISTAI@BIO Decimus was hand-picked by Nimue as a Ruler of her then latest created race, and proudly named Nimue's tenth favorite. He wore this honor with pride and responsibility, until his creator Goddess grew disappointed with him and his people for reasons unknown to any but herself. It was this guilt that led him to pursue a life of righteousness for him and his people, and it was this weight of responsibility that started him on his path to ascension. [br/][br/]The Atoning Toadmen were created by Nimue and once rose above many others, but must now answer for their sins. What sins and how, they are not sure, but they must atone nonetheless, and lead others on the same path of righteousness before their former Goddess, Nimue, can love them again.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_MEANDOR@BIO A harbinger of intrigue, Meandor is the first Prince of the ancient tradition of Dark Elves. He plots against allies and enemies alike. He once experienced death and found it unsatisfying. He now respects his sister Julia, but won't hesitate to stab a dagger through her plans. His followers see him as a symbol of vengeance, but he prefers to shirk ideologies. He revels in remaining a wild card in the realm of diplomatic games. Yet, he, too, is haunted by his own demons.[br/][br/]Dark Elves lurk in the deep shadows, plotting vengeance upon humanity and the fair races that tolerate them. They will never forget how men stole their lands. Dark Elves enslave weaker races and train them in cruelty, using them to achieve their nefarious purposes. They are masters of stealth, known to favor a well placed blade in the back over a fair fight.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_NIMUE@BIO Her mind is a torrent of unpredictable chaos. She wills it and her children rise from the surge, breathing her very lifeblood. Like the tide beating against the changing coastline, so too is Nimue among the Godir. Her power is undeniable, yet her moods swirl like waves in a tide pool. Her children all accept that, inevitably, all will find themselves drowned in a watery grave.[br/][br/]Obsequious and ever condescending, Nimue's Chosen Children know that their time as her favored creations is limited, and if they're not careful, they will all end up drowned in the depths. Fortunately, these clever amphibians have an affinity for water, and know ways of quietly slipping beneath the surface when her storms start churning up the muck.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_SARIDAS@BIO Saridas was once a Dark Elven advisor to Prince Meandor. Later, he married Queen Julia, thus becoming king of the High Elves on Athla. He suffered dearly from the loss of his only son, Thannis, and almost threw his empire into an all-out war. His quest for vengeance only stopped due to his own daughter, Sundren. Of course, the life of a king is never safe... and in the years following the Third Age, Saridas found his demise after the seals of Athla were broken. His soul traveled to {GLOBAL.AuldwealdLoreConcept.Hyperlink} where he was reunited with his son. Now, he is forced to stay on this realm until a Godir breaks the curse that affects it.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_SHIRA@BIO Shira was born the heir of her people. During her coronation, the Shad'rai invaded her realm, killed her family and cast her into the Astral Void. Shira would have been Lost if not for the aid of Meandor, who guided her to Magehaven, where she joined the Covenant and learned to channel her grief into primal prowess. After a heroic return and a fierce battle against the usurping Shad'rai Godir, she retook her homeland.[br/][br/]Arctic Felines are a proud people who adjusted to the icy tundra of Cantarra, their homeworld. After the return of their long-lost Queen, they followed her through the depths of the Astral Sea and back to avenge their fallen royal family and thwart the plans of the Shad'rai.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_SUNDREN@BIO Curious and clever, Sundren was the second-born child, daughter of Queen Julia and her royal consort. She founded the Torchbearers as one of the few leaders ever to unite High Elves with their Dark-Elf kindred... But after the assassination of her brother, and later the death of her father, Sundren finds her noble heart growing dark with a lust for vengeance.[br/][br/]Mended Torchbearers are the kindred and followers of Sundred and her dream of a life filled with a deeply heroic meaning. Many kindred were once jaded by age and propriety, while others thirsted for bloody revenge. Sundren gave them all a much more thrilling reason to live.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_THANNIS@BIO Many mourn the loss of the High Elven prodigy, Thannis, the first High Elf born on Athla after the mending of the Dark and Wood Elves. His unjustified death caused empires to clash and threw Athla into an all-out war, only brought to an end by the heroic actions of his rebellious sister, Sundren. His soul wandered to {GLOBAL.AuldwealdLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, the origin world of all Elves, where he remains, not necessarily voluntarily.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@RACE_YAKA@BIO Stare into the flames long enough and a single name will come to your lips. A god of fire. Only a god of fire can live within the raging inferno, able to master its unpredictable flow of destruction. He is quick to punish those that do not give him rightful reverence, for only creatures that can withstand waves of unrelenting heat are worthy to serve the great Godir, Yaka.[br/][br/]Remembering a time when felines were worshiped as god-kin, the Firebrand Predators serve Yaka with a zeal that he has not seen for generations. Yaka dotes upon his Tigran followers, for he remembers how his past servants abandoned him. Together they seek to build an unquenchable inferno.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@TURIEL@BIO A mighty Orc whose honor-bound convictions match his prodigious strength, Turiel was the first Wizard King to ascend to Godirhood. He appears as a mighty and masked Orc, a bastion of stoic ferocity clad in indomitable armor and wielding brutal weaponry. Ever oath-bound to the Archon in guarding Grexolis, he holds honor and duty in highest esteem.[br/][br/]Turiel leads the mighty Onmar, fierce Ascended Orcs who aid him in a duty shared and who have, in return, been blessed by the Archon. Their minds are guarded against the insidious whispers of the banished souls they hold eternal vigil over.
CAMPAIGN@LORDS@YDGAARD@BIO Like the Void Stone that replaced his heart through a macabre covenant for power, Ydgaard's desires run to the cold and shiny. A grizzled and mighty Dwarf whose greed is as impressive as his beard, he covets wealth and resources above all. The great jewel that adorns his left eye socket in place of an eyeball (also part of the aforementioned pact) is a stark reflection of how he sees the world. [br/][br/]Ydgaard rules over a race of mole-like beings known as the Grave Underlings. It is surmised that their form was chosen due in part to their poor eyesight, that they may never covet their master's wealth. Likewise, their natural predilection to excavation of the planet's riches allow them to ever increase the size of Ydgaard's own hoard.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_00@BRIEFING_01@DESCRIPTION It was the time when the raw forces of magic returned to Athla. The seal that had protected the world was shattered, the cosmic currents thereby unleashed shaped the land, changing what was whilst returning what once may have been. In the wake of this new genesis, the great empires of the Third Age fell into decline, bringing on an era of re-exploration and expansion.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_00@BRIEFING_02@DESCRIPTION Alas, the time for peaceful discovery was brief, for the ancient wizards of the Second Age broke free from their eldritch prisons in the depths of the Astral Sea. Their strength regained, they set out to rule over the surviving peoples as god-kings, or Godir.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_00@BRIEFING_03@DESCRIPTION There was little divine about them. Yaka, Nimue, Karissa—a pantheon of pretender gods. They were scarred, corrupted, haunted by millennia of torment—and ready to unleash their newfound powers against whoever dared stand in their way.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_00@BRIEFING_04@DESCRIPTION Yet the Wizard Kings were not unchallenged. Mortal champions rose to the defense of their people, rebuilding their realms and learning to channel the currents of magic.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_00@BRIEFING_05@DESCRIPTION This is the story of one such champion. While traveling through the Valley of Wonders in search of a new home, tragedy befell <<o:HeroFirstName>> tribe, its elder slain by a magical being. After inheriting both the elder’s throne and his powerful Tome of Magic, the young champion had to rise up and protect <<o:HeroFirstName>> people from the dangers that awaited them.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_00@DEBRIEFING_01@DESCRIPTION By repelling the invasion of Yaka, the spark of divinity was ignited, and a new Godir ascended to the cosmic Pantheon. Beyond the veil of mortality, the Pantheon represented an entirely different world. For while the Godir could walk the realms as gods, they had to abide by rules when dealing with their own kin within the Astral Sea.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_00@DEBRIEFING_02@DESCRIPTION In Magehaven, a world near the center of the Astral Sea, the Godir of the Pantheon had established their forum of counsel. It was a place warded by an ancient spell. Stripped of their abilities to harm one another, even the fiercest enemies could meet up in Magehaven. Here the Godir constructed their World Gates, through which they embarked on their journeys of exploration and expansion that defined the Fourth Age of Wonders.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_00@DESCRIPTION As a mortal champion, build up a new home for your wandering tribe in the mythical Valley of Wonders. Prepare yourself for the clash with the returning Wizard Kings of old and rise in power to claim a greater destiny.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_00@NAME Valley of Wonders
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_00@SUB_HEADER As an {GLOBAL.AscendedChampLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, build up a new home for your wandering tribe in the mythical {GLOBAL.ValleyofWondersLoreConcept.Hyperlink} on {GLOBAL.AthlaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. Prepare yourself for the clash with the returning <<m:{GLOBAL.WizardKingLoreConcept.Hyperlink}>> of old and rise in power to claim a greater destiny.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@BRIEFING_01@DESCRIPTION The Astral Sea connects all and everything. To most, it is merely a way to travel between worlds, yet some call the Astral Sea itself their home. Of the many beings who reside within, the curious Maer are the most gentle. They swim through the magical currents with ease and use their voices to guide lost souls to safety. This is the story of one such Maer called Elya, whose curiosity led her to misery.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@BRIEFING_01@TITLE The Maer
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@BRIEFING_02@DESCRIPTION This particular young Maer was intrigued by the worlds that connect to the Astral Sea. She was specifically attracted to a realm called the Enchanted Archipelago, for its tides resembled her natural habitat, yet felt so different. But it did not take long before Elya's visit turned into a nightmare, when she was captured by a capricious Godir called Nimue who sought to study her for her beauty and power.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@BRIEFING_02@TITLE Capture
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@BRIEFING_03@DESCRIPTION The self-proclaimed "Goddess" Nimue used Elya in her efforts to create her ultimate race of followers… but her results never lived up to her ever-shifting demands. Elya was forced to watch Nimue drown her own creations over and over again, only to begin anew once more. The horrified Elya, shackled and sequestered, could only sing a desperate song, carried by the currents over the Astral Sea.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@BRIEFING_03@TITLE A Desperate Song
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@BRIEFING_04@DESCRIPTION Elya's song reached Magehaven, where the Covenant, a virtuous alliance of Godir, heard her plea. The Covenant sought to uphold the ancient agreements of peace and stability, and were thus concerned by the song about Nimue. Had the Siren Goddess gone mad with power, or was another force at play? One zealous Godir of the Covenant volunteered to investigate the Enchanted Archipelago and liberate it from Nimue's drowning embrace.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@BRIEFING_04@TITLE The Savior
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@DEBRIEFING_01@DESCRIPTION Thus was the Siren Goddess defeated and the Enchanted Archipelago freed from her obsessive grasp. And Elya, the curious Maer who euphorically experienced freedom once more… I am her. It was I who witnessed both the terror and grace of the Godir. It is for this reason that I sing the stories of this Age of Godir and of the good and the evil that reside within the ever-flowing Astral Sea.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@DEBRIEFING_01@TITLE The Goddess, Defeated
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@DEBRIEFING_02@DESCRIPTION Yet my freedom begets responsibility. I could no longer ignore the murder and destruction of the powerless and innocent. My time as prisoner taught me about the plans of Nimue and her allies, the Godir alliance who call themselves the Shad'rai. This is why I had to inform the Covenant about the scheming Shad'rai and their ambitions—which were far greater than what the Covenant imagined.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@DEBRIEFING_02@TITLE Dark Plans
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@DESCRIPTION Become an ambassador of the Covenant and venture to the Enchanted Archipelago, where a once Banished Wizard is abusing the currents of Creation. Investigate the goals of the Shad'rai alliance and free the realm from the Siren Goddess.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@NAME Enchanted Archipelago
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_01@SUB_HEADER Become an ambassador of the {GLOBAL.CovenantFactionLoreConcept.Hyperlink} and venture to the Enchanted Archipelago on {GLOBAL.TidolonLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, where a once banished {GLOBAL.WizardKingLoreConcept.Hyperlink} is abusing the currents of Creation. Investigate the goals of the {GLOBAL.ShadraiFactionLoreConcept.Hyperlink} alliance and free the realm from the Siren Goddess.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@BRIEFING_01@DESCRIPTION Ages ago, when the Astral Sea was still young, the Archons created a magical artifact. Forged in the fires of an Elder Dragon, the Gildercoil served as an arcane compass, guiding the Archons through the currents between realms. According to legend, it still contains the echoes of their arcane journeys, and can lead those who hold it to forgotten places of sealed knowledge and magic.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@BRIEFING_01@TITLE Visions of Sand
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@BRIEFING_02@DESCRIPTION With its mysterious promise of power, the Gildercoil fanned the greed of many rulers, until a daring Godir betrayed the Archons and stole the Gildercoil from their Celestial Reliquary. Ever since then, all traces of the compass have been lost, as have those of the cunning thief who disappeared into the mists of time.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@BRIEFING_02@TITLE The False God
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@BRIEFING_03@DESCRIPTION Or so it seemed for many a lifetime... Lithyl Nightweaver was the first of the Shad'rai to find clues of the Gildercoil's whereabouts—myths, leading to runic omens, leading to riddles. The Shad'rai were persistent in their search, for too well did the Archon artifact fit into their unfolding plans. And they were rewarded.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@BRIEFING_03@NAME Crimson Caldera
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@BRIEFING_04@DESCRIPTION In the infernal world of Obbadoth, there exists a realm known as the Crimson Caldera, where war is eternal. Here the Gildercoil lay hidden. Yet the Shad'rai sought no open conflict with Obbadoth's demonic princes. As they weighed their options, an ambitious Godir from their ranks volunteered to venture there alone, well aware of the prestige and power that could be gained within their order.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@DEBRIEFING_01@DESCRIPTION Thus, by the hands of the Shad'rai, the wicked scheme of Frikka Dynosis had been revealed, and the Gildercoil was recovered. The Crimson Caldera had met its champion and even the princes of Obbadoth dared not interfere.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@DEBRIEFING_01@TITLE Chaos Mission Debriefing 01
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@DESCRIPTION As an agent of the Shad'rai, venture to a demonic realm of never-ending war to search for an ancient Archon artifact of power. Become the victor in an arena of mad violence and end the curse that brought doom upon so many aspiring kings and Godir.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@MAP@NAME Crimson Caldera
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_02@SUB_HEADER As an agent of the {GLOBAL.ShadraiFactionLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, venture to a demonic realm of never-ending war to search for an ancient [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ArchonsLoreConcept]Archon[/hyperlink] artifact of power. Become the victor in an arena of mad violence and end the curse of {GLOBAL.ObbadothLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, which brought doom upon so many aspiring kings and {GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept.Hyperlink}.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_03@TITLE The Shad'rai Plot: Smelter Mountains (Ertra Anov)
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@BRIEFING_01@DESCRIPTION After seizing the Gildercoil, the Shad'rai suddenly disappeared. This concerned most Godir, the members of the Covenant in particular, who were actively opposed to the Shad'rai and their schemes. However, none knew how to follow the Shad'rai, or what their destination was. The Covenant convened in Magehaven to debate.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@BRIEFING_01@TITLE Concern amongst the Covenant
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@BRIEFING_02@DESCRIPTION The Athlan ruler Sundren proposed to seek out Prince Meandor, her uncle. Meandor was a powerful Wizard of Death and the heir of the fallen House Inioch. He was the first Athlan to discover Magehaven and had guided many banished wizards there, including the Shad'rai, saving them from eternal torment in the darkness that lay between the realms. If anyone could track down the Shad'rai wizards, it was Meandor.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@BRIEFING_02@TITLE Prince of Shadows
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@BRIEFING_03@DESCRIPTION However, for reasons unknown or unfortunate, Meandor had elected to exile himself to Auldweald, the ancient home world of the Elves, where he established a realm for himself. Since then, concerning reports had reached Magehaven. The shadow of death had washed over the vibrant forests, its cities haunted by lingering souls and roaming spirits who were unable to finish their journeys to the Well of Creation.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@BRIEFING_03@TITLE Eternal Court
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@BRIEFING_04@DESCRIPTION Many Elves had since fled the realm, reporting that Meandor was responsible for its fall. He had vowed to restore his beloved lost Elven Court to its old glory. Dark magic followed him and his apparitions as he turned the realm itself against anyone who dared enter his waking dream of the past. The Covenant saw no choice but to send a fearless Godir to reclaim this Eternal Court from the renegade Wizard of Shadows.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@BRIEFING_04@TITLE A Ghostly Curse
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@DEBRIEFING_01@DESCRIPTION A fearless Godir of the Covenant broke Meandor's curse and freed the souls trapped within the Eternal Court. After his recovery in Magehaven, Meandor explained he had uncovered the plans of the Shad'rai and their search for the Gildercoil. The Covenant's concerns about the Shad'rai were justified, for the Gildercoil was not just a compass… It was a powerful Archon artifact, capable of leading those wielding it to powers even legends dared not mention.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@DEBRIEFING_02@DESCRIPTION The Shad'rai sought to release the power locked away by the Archons. They had invited Meandor to join their cause, but after his refusal, the dark cabal had ensnared him in the nightmares of his past. Meandor was furious that he had allowed himself to be manipulated. He thus decided to aid the Covenant and used his strong connection to the Astral Sea to locate the Shad'rai. But before the other Godir could follow, he issued a warning.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@DEBRIEFING_03@DESCRIPTION After spending an age clinging to the past, Meandor concluded that the flow of the Astral Sea could not be compelled or defied. He sensed anticipation within the currents: forces from the dawn of time would imminently resurface. The Shad'rai may have been unscrupulous in their search for this power but, deep down, all Godir lust for it. Meandor bitterly declared that a Godir has but one choice: Follow the pulls of the tide... or seek oblivion, as he did.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@DESCRIPTION Join the Covenant once more to investigate the haunted forests of the Auldweald, origin world of the Elves. Confront the mad Wizard who has cast the realm into the shadows of undeath and free the trapped spirits within.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@NAME The Eternal Court
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@QUEST_CONQUER_ARACHNA@OBJECTIVE {INT_0}/{INT_1} Spellweaver Defeated
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@QUEST_DEFEAT_INIOCH@OBJECTIVE {INT_0}/{INT_1} Fallen Emperor Defeated
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@QUEST_DEFEAT_SARIDAS {INT_0}/{INT_1} Spirit of Saridas Defeated
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@QUEST_FIND_ARACHNA@OBJECTIVE {INT_0}/{INT_1} Spellweaver Found
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@QUEST_FIND_INIOCH@OBJECTIVE {INT_0}/{INT_1} Fallen Emperor Found
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@QUEST_FIND_SARIDAS {INT_0}/{INT_1} Entity Found
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@QUEST_FREE_ELEANOR@OBJECTIVE {INT_0}/{INT_1} Tomb Explored
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@QUEST_FREE_ELEANOR_AFFINITY@OBJECTIVE {INT_0}/{INT_1} Lost Mother Freed
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@SUB_HEADER Join the {GLOBAL.CovenantFactionLoreConcept.Hyperlink} once more to investigate the haunted forests of {GLOBAL.AuldwealdLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, origin world of the elves. Confront the mad {GLOBAL.WizardKingLoreConcept.Hyperlink} who has cast the realm into the shadows of undeath, and free the trapped {GLOBAL.SoulsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} within.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_05@TOMB_ELEANOR@NAME Tomb of the Lost Mother
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_06@BRIEFING_01@DESCRIPTION "Glory to all Godir and glory to the Shad'rai!" The rousing hymn of the Shad'rai was heard far and wide as they gathered to use the Gildercoil and embark from Magehaven to challenge the Archons themselves. For too long had archaic Archon dogmas controlled the cosmos and determined what should exist and what shouldn't. It was time to ring in a new age and break the chains that fettered the true potential of the Pantheon.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_06@BRIEFING_01@TITLE Grexolis
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_06@BRIEFING_02@DESCRIPTION Grexolis was the long-sought-after target of the Shad'rai. It was a world whose mere existence had been concealed by the Archons in great effort, as it contained the forbidden magic of ancient times. The Gildercoil not only guided the Shad'rai to Grexolis—it was the very key to opening the World Vault itself. Coming to Grexolis meant to seek celestial judgment. But the Shad'rai were prepared.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_06@DEBRIEFING_01@DESCRIPTION The battle had been fierce, but at last the Shad'rai overwhelmed the Covenant and Turiel, guardian of Grexolis. Their victory, however, became tainted with confusion when Lithyl Nightweaver revealed her true identity. And then, she broke the World Vault. Grexolis burst open in a swirl of raw magic, an arcane tide surging through the Astral Sea. In the blink of an eye, entire worlds came to be anew while a myriad of forgotten thoughts invaded the minds of the present Godir.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_06@DEBRIEFING_02@DESCRIPTION As the turmoil slowly subsided, the Shad'rai convened on the empty shell of Grexolis to reflect on their achievement. They had caught a glimpse of something great, a veil lifted on ancient times and its primal gods. Forgotten were all worries about the Archons and their distant war with the Shadow. For the realms of the altered cosmos glimmered like beacons of magic mystery—as if they were beckoning Magehaven's Godir to rise in this Fourth Age of Wonders.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_06@DESCRIPTION As the spearhead of a Shad'rai alliance, invade the fractured world Grexolis hidden in the mists of the Astral Sea. Face the custodian, whom the Archons left on this world to guard the ancient magic which lies buried here.
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_06@NAME Grexolis
CAMPAIGN@MISSION_06@SUB_HEADER As the spearhead of a {GLOBAL.ShadraiFactionLoreConcept.Hyperlink} alliance, invade the fractured world {GLOBAL.GrexolisLoreConcept.Hyperlink} hidden in the mists of the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. Face the custodian, which the {GLOBAL.ArchonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} left on this world to guard the ancient magic which lies buried here.

CAMPAIGN@SHADOW_REALM@TOMB_ELEANOR@LORE [lorefontsize][lorefont]A necropolis crafted in honor of Eleanor of House Inioch, a regal Athlan Empress who perished during childbirth whose soul returned to her ancient homeworld. Wizard King Meandor visited this Tomb often when he settled here. Some even whisper it is the source of his madness.[lorefontsize/][lorefont/]

COMBAT_TUTORIAL@ACCURACY@DESCRIPTION This unit has a ranged ability selected. Ranged abilities have an Accuracy rating, which is the chance of the ability hitting the intended target.
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@ACCURACY@DESCRIPTION_SECONDARY If an ability misses, it will either strike another target or do nothing at all. Some abilities can also graze, meaning that the ability affected the target but with reduced strength.
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@ACCURACY@TITLE Accuracy
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@ACTION_POINTS@DESCRIPTION You have selected a unit. It has 3 Action Points to spend on moving and using abilities.
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@ACTION_POINTS@DESCRIPTION_SECONDARY Different abilities have different [actionpoint/] action point costs, and some trigger once per action point available. Using an ability will almost always end a unit's turn![br/][br/]As you plan movement, you can see the number of [fullaction/] action points you will have available at your destination.
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@ACTION_POINTS@TITLE Action Points
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@BATTLE_MAGE_UNITS@DESCRIPTION This is a Battle Mage Unit, which excels at dealing magical damage and applying status effects. It is vulnerable to melee attacks and should be kept in the back line.

COMBAT_TUTORIAL@CASUALTIES@DESCRIPTION This unit has suffered Casualties. Casualties occur when a unit takes damage, which also causes the unit to deal less damage with its attacks.
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@CASUALTIES@DESCRIPTION_SECONDARY Units that are represented by a single figure, such as heroes and giants, are immune to casualties.
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@CASUALTIES@TITLE Casualties

COMBAT_TUTORIAL@LOW_MORALE@DESCRIPTION_SECONDARY If a unit's morale drops too low, it will start {GLOBAL.RoutingConcept.Hyperlink} and flee the battlefield.

COMBAT_TUTORIAL@SCOUT_UNIT@TITLE [unitScout/]Scout Units
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@SHIELD_UNIT@DESCRIPTION This is a Shield Unit, a front line melee fighter. When entering Defense Mode, it grants a bonus to adjacent allies, protecting them against physical attacks.
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@SHIELD_UNIT@TITLE [unitShield/]Shield Units
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@SHOCK_UNITS@DESCRIPTION This is a Shock Unit, a powerful melee fighter specializing in high-damage Charges. Its attacks can cancel Defense Mode, which makes it strong against Shield Units and Support Units.
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@SHOCK_UNITS@TITLE [unitShock/]Shock Units
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@SKIRMISHER_UNIT@DESCRIPTION This is a Skirmisher Unit, which is flexible and uses both ranged and melee attacks. With its high speed and Slippery ability, it's the perfect unit for hit-and-run attacks.

COMBAT_TUTORIAL@ZONE_OF_CONTORL@DESCRIPTION Your unit is in an enemy's Zone of Control. When a unit moves into an enemy's zone of control, it becomes temporarily pinned and cannot move for the rest of the turn.
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@ZONE_OF_CONTORL@DESCRIPTION_SECONDARY Moving out of a zone of control can trigger an opportunity attack.[br/][br/]While in an enemy zone of control, many ranged and magical abilities will be unavailable.
COMBAT_TUTORIAL@ZONE_OF_CONTORL@TITLE Zone Of Control

If the attack does not land, it misses or grazes the target.[bulletlist][bullet/]Grazes deal half damage.[bullet/]Misses deal no damage.[bullet/]Misses can hit random adjacent units next to the target.[/bulletlist]

CONCEPT@MOUNT@DESCRIPTION Mounts can be equipped by <<m:{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.HERO.Hyperlink}>> in the relevant slot.[br/]They generally grant {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.FAST_MOVEMENT.Hyperlink} and a small increase in <<m:{GLOBAL.HitPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/]Certain powerful weapons cannot be wielded while mounted.[br/]The mount that the {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.HERO.Hyperlink} starts with depends on their race and any form traits that race may have.

CONCEPT@MOUNT@NAME Hero Mount
CONCEPT@MOVE_POINTS@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]Move Points represent how far a unit can move within a {GLOBAL.TurnConcept}.[bullet/]On the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}, normal terrain costs {amount1} Move Points to traverse.[bullet/]In {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}, each hex costs {moveCost} Move Points.[/bulletlist]

CONCEPT@OBSCURED@NAME Obscured
CONCEPT@ONE_OF_CONTROL@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]A unit's Zone of Control is the three hexes in front of it.[bullet/]The Zone of Control blocks enemy movement and determines where the unit can perform a {GLOBAL.RetaliationConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Going into {GLOBAL.DefenseModeConcept.Hyperlink} extends the Zone of Control to all adjacent hexes.[/bulletlist]
CONCEPT@OPPERTUNITY_ATTACK@DESCRIPTION Opportunity Attacks are a special type of {GLOBAL.RetaliationConcept.Hyperlink} that are triggered when an enemy unit leaves the {GLOBAL.ZoneOfControlConcept.Hyperlink}.
CONCEPT@OPPERTUNITY_ATTACK@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.OpportunityAttackConcept]Opportunity Attack[/hyperlink]
CONCEPT@OPPERTUNITY_ATTACK@NAME Opportunity Attack

CONCEPT@RESISTANCE@NAME Resistance
CONCEPT@RETALIATION@DESCRIPTION A Retaliation Attack is an attack triggered by another [hyperlink,GLOBAL.UnitConcept]Unit's[/hyperlink] attacks or movement[bulletlist][bullet/]Melee units can Retaliate once per {GLOBAL.TurnConcept} (by default).[bullet/]Attacking an enemy unit within the {GLOBAL.ZoneOfControlConcept.Hyperlink} triggers a Retaliation.[bullet/]An enemy unit moving out of the {GLOBAL.ZoneOfControlConcept.Hyperlink} triggers an {GLOBAL.OpportunityAttackConcept.Hyperlink}.[/bulletlist]

CONCEPT@TEMPORARY_HITPOINTS@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]Temporary Hit Points are given to a {GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink} when it is healed in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]When a Unit takes damage, Temporary Hit Points are lost first.[bullet/]When combat ends, all Temporary Hit Points are removed.[/bulletlist]

CONCEPT@TEMPORARY_HITPOINTS@NAME [temphp/] Temporary Hit Point
CONCEPT@UNIT_MORALE@DESCRIPTION {GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink} Morale represents willingness to battle.[br/][bulletlist][bullet/]High Morale increases {GLOBAL.CriticalHitConcept.Hyperlink} chance.[bullet/]Low Morale increases {GLOBAL.FumbleConcept.Hyperlink} chance in battle and Desertion chance on the World Map.[bullet/]Very Low Morale further increases {GLOBAL.FumbleConcept.Hyperlink} chance and can lead to {GLOBAL.RoutingConcept.Hyperlink} <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> in battle and Desertion chance on the World Map .[/bulletlist][br/][br/]Morale States:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.HighMoraleConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.NeutralMoraleConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.LowMoraleConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.VeryLowMoraleConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.RoutingConcept.Hyperlink}.[/bulletlist]
CONCEPT@UNIT_MORALE@HYPERLINK [happiness/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept]Morale[/hyperlink]
CONCEPT@UNIT_MORALE@NAME Morale
CONCEPT@UNIT_TIER@DESCRIPTION {GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink} Tier represents it's relative strength in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}.[bulletlist][bullet/]Higher tier <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> have a higher per turn {GLOBAL.UnitUpkeepConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Tier 3+ Units gain {GLOBAL.StatusResistanceConcept.Hyperlink} which increases for higher Tiers.[bullet/]Unit Tiers range from 1 to 5.[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}>> are treated as Tier 5 for relevant skills and abilities.[/bulletlist]

CORE_SIEGEPROJECTS@CONSTRUCT_CATAPULTS@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]At the start of the battle, gain {amount} <<m:{GLOBAL.UNITS.CATAPULT_UNIT.Hyperlink}>> on the attacker's side until the end of battle.[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.UNITS.CATAPULT_UNIT.Hyperlink}>> are immobile {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.SIEGECRAFT_UNIT.Hyperlink} <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> with long range, area of effect attacks that are great for destroying obstacles, but are inaccurate against <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]Only one type of Siegecraft unit can be brought into {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}. If multiple <<m:{GLOBAL.SiegeProjectConcept.Hyperlink}>> would bring them, only the strongest of them will appear.[/bulletlist]

CULTURE_DARK@CULL_THE_WEAK@NAME Cull the Weak
CULTURE_DARK@DARK@BIO They pursue power and often turn to dark and forbidden magic, caring little about the well-being of their people.
CULTURE_DARK@DARK@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]Cities can negate {GLOBAL.CityStabilityConcept.Hyperlink} income penalties.[bullet/]Unique <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>> granting {GLOBAL.KnowledgeConcept.Hyperlink} and extra income from <<m:{GLOBAL.PrisonConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.CryptConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Units specialize in inflicting negative status effects and exploiting them with {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.CULL_THE_WEAK.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]{alignmentmodifier} {GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept.Hyperlink}.[/bulletlist]
CULTURE_DARK@DARK@LORE [br/][helpcolor]A dictatorial civilization where the strong and ruthless dominate the weak. They use forbidden magics to maintain control and weaken their enemies.[/helpcolor]

CULTURE_FEUDAL@FEUDAL@BIO They hold honor and valor in high regard and fight to uphold their laws wherever they go.
CULTURE_FEUDAL@FEUDAL@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]Structures with {GLOBAL.FoodConcept.Hyperlink} income.[bullet/]Units benefit from close formations with {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.STAND_TOGETHER.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.FeudalLordConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist]
CULTURE_FEUDAL@FEUDAL@LORE [br/][helpcolor]A hierarchic society wherein lords, ladies, and knights reign over peasants. All stand together in battle when their fertile realm is threatened.[/helpcolor]
CULTURE_FEUDAL@FEUDAL@NAME Feudal
CULTURE_FEUDAL@FEUDAL@TOME_DESCRIPTION This research is available to rulers with the {GLOBAL.FeudalConcept.Hyperlink} culture. They specialize in battle formations and governance.
CULTURE_FEUDAL@FEUDAL_TRAINING@DESCRIPTION Unit gains +{FEUDAL_TRAINING>ResolvedProportion}% more {GLOBAL.ExperienceConcept} from battle and gets promoted to a Defender unit upon reaching Champion rank.

CULTURE_FEUDAL@HERO_SKILL_4@DESCRIPTION While army leader, after winning combat, units in the army regain:[bulletlist][bullet/]{hprestore} <<m:{GLOBAL.HitPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]{mprestore} <<m:{GLOBAL.MovePointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist][br/]This triggers once per {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}[br/][br/]Only one Hero can be this Lord at any time.

CULTURE_FEUDAL@HERO_SKILL_4@UNIT_EFFECT_DESCRIPTION This unit restores {hprestore} <<m:{GLOBAL.HitPointConcept.Hyperlink}>> and {mprestore} <<m:{GLOBAL.MovePointConcept.Hyperlink}>> after winning combat once per {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}.

CULTURE_FEUDAL_RESEARCH@SKILL_10@NAME Hold the Line
CULTURE_FEUDAL_RESEARCH@SKILL_1@DESCRIPTION Grants non-Feudal units:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.STAND_TOGETHER.Hyperlink}, which increases damage dealt when they stand near each other.

CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@HERO_TITLE_01 Guildmaster
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@HERO_TITLE_01@GENDER ^m
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@INDUSTRIOUS@BIO They have respect for smiths and other artisans, preferring a strong wall over a decorated palace.
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@INDUSTRIOUS@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]Structures with {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink} income.[bullet/]Through {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERING.Hyperlink}, units get sturdier as they get hit in battle.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.ScoutProspectingConcept.Hyperlink}.[/bulletlist]
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@INDUSTRIOUS@LORE [br/][helpcolor]Master builders who value grand cities and strong armor, preferring a defensive attitude over an aggressive one.[/helpcolor]
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@INDUSTRIOUS@NAME Industrious
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@INDUSTRIOUS@TOME_DESCRIPTION This research is available to rulers with the {GLOBAL.IndustriousConcept.Hyperlink} culture. They specialize in defenses and exploiting natural resources.
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@INSPIRING_DEFENSE@DESCRIPTION Unit enters {GLOBAL.DefenseModeConcept}, then it and adjacent friendly units gain {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERED_DEFENSE.Hyperlink}.
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@INSPIRING_DEFENSE@NAME Inspiring Defense
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@OVERDRAW@DESCRIPTION Deals damage, cancels {GLOBAL.DefenseModeConcept.Hyperlink}, and removes {GLOBAL.RetaliationConcept.Hyperlink}, unless the target has {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.CHARGE_RESISTANCE.Hyperlink}.
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@OVERDRAW@NAME Overdraw Crossbow

CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@REGENERATING_ARMOR@NAME Regenerating Armor
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@RUNE_OF_RETALIATION@DESCRIPTION Reflects {RUNE_OF_RETALIATION>ResolvedDamageReflected}% of damage sustained from {GLOBAL.MeleeConcept.Hyperlink} attacks back onto attackers.
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@RUNE_OF_RETALIATION@NAME Rune of Retaliation
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@STRENGTH_FROM_STEEL@DESCRIPTION Target friendly unit loses all stacks of {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERED_DEFENSE.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERED_RESISTANCE.Hyperlink}. For each stack lost:[bulletlist][bullet/]Heals +{STRENGTH_OF_STEEL_HEAL>NumHitpointsToRestore} <<m:{GLOBAL.TemporaryHitPointConcept}>>.[bullet/]Gains {stacks} {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.STRENGTHENED.Hyperlink}.[/bulletlist]
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@STRENGTH_FROM_STEEL@NAME Strength From Steel
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@TAUNT@DESCRIPTION Target enemy unit is inflicted with a base {TAUNTED_RESISTANCE>ResolvedStrength}% chance of becoming {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.TAUNTED.Hyperlink} for {TAUNTED_LINK_EFFECT>Duration} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept}>>. The unit that used the skill enters {GLOBAL.DefenseModeConcept.Hyperlink}.
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@TAUNT@NAME Taunt
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@TRANSFER_ARMOR@DESCRIPTION Target friendly unit gains {amount} {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERED_DEFENSE.Hyperlink}.
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS@TRANSFER_ARMOR@NAME Grant Defense

CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS_RESEARCH@SKILL_5@PROPERTY_DESCRIPTION Unit has:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERING.Hyperlink}.
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS_RESEARCH@SKILL_7@DESCRIPTION All friendly units lose all stacks of {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERED_DEFENSE.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERED_RESISTANCE.Hyperlink}. For each stack lost they gain:[bulletlist][bullet/] {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.STRENGTHENED.Hyperlink}[bullet/] {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.FORTUNE.Hyperlink}[/bulletlist]
CULTURE_INDUSTRIOUS_RESEARCH@SKILL_7@NAME Steelfury Chant
CULTURE_MYSTIC@ARCANE_BOMBARDMENT@DESCRIPTION Target enemy units in a {radius}-hex radius:[bulletlist][bullet/]Lose all positive status effects.[bullet/]Sustain damage. Double damage to {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.MAGIC_ORIGIN.Hyperlink} units.[/bulletlist]
CULTURE_MYSTIC@ARCANE_BOMBARDMENT@NAME Star Purge
CULTURE_MYSTIC@ATTUNED_CAST@DESCRIPTION Add {ATTUNED_CAST_OP>PointsToGive} <<m:{GLOBAL.CombatCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>> to this combat.
CULTURE_MYSTIC@ATTUNED_CAST@NAME Attuned Cast
CULTURE_MYSTIC@ATTUNEMENT_EMPOWER@DESCRIPTION When a spell is cast, this unit's base attack randomly gains +{amount} {GLOBAL.FireDamageConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.LightningDamageConcept.Hyperlink}, or {GLOBAL.FrostDamageConcept.Hyperlink} for {STAR_BLADES_STATUS_DESCRIPTION>NumTurns} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept}>>.[br/]Stacks up to {STAR_BLADES_STATUS_DESCRIPTION>MaxStacks} times.
CULTURE_MYSTIC@ATTUNEMENT_EMPOWER@NAME Attunement: Star Blades

CULTURE_SAVAGE@SAVAGE@BIO They believe one can only feel truly alive in the heat of battle and tend not to be hindered by ethical concerns.
