DEFAULT@LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_1@NAME Alfred^M
DEFAULT@LORDS@HERO_SURNAME_1@NAME Elderstone^z
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_ARCANETIGRANS@BIO "At the center of all good mysteries sits an unassuming cat, watching silently through wide jeweled eyes." Enam'ru Enkhanan sees all with her ever so slight, half-moon smile twitching in amusement at the arcane secrets the rest of her peers have yet to discover.[br/][br/]Arcane Tigrans are Enam'ru's shadowy, feline agents who flit through the dark places between worlds, absconding with arcane secrets for their mistress. Masters of magical channeling, they make formidable foes should they decide to step out of those shadows...
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_ASHENFAE@BIO Born blind, Taiena was not expected to lead the Ashen Fae. But through sheer perseverance and her keen other senses, she cultivated her talents as a pyromancer, and eventually became the first Emberkeeper to ascend to [hyperlink,GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept]Godirhood[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The Ashen Fae originated above ground, as one of the many types of surface-dwelling Elves. But when war forced the Elves to choose between fighting or perishing, one tribe fled underground. They worship fire, for it is their main source of light in the sunless depths.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_AULDWEALDELVES@BIO Sylvani was born and raised in the capital city of her Elven tribe. With her talent for magic and love for nature she inherited her title from her grandmother after she fell to undead forces.[br/][br/]The Auldweald Elves are one of the oldest Elven tribes on the World of their namesake. They carve their history in their own bodies, and in the trees around them. Thereby, both bark and skin share the same legends.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_AWAKENEDMOLEMEN@BIO An instinctive penchant for delving into the deep places of the world is often invaluable when seeking to uncover long buried secrets. This strange truth has long served Crahz well in her pursuit of power which, in turn, she oft seeks to wield as a bringer of high-minded ideals to those deemed less fortunate. She herself would say she digs into the darkness, to bring truth into the light.[br/][br/]Known far and wide as the Awakened Molemen, Crahz Diggora's faithful followers are, perhaps somewhat ironically, not prone to blind faith. In their mistress they see a beacon of justice driven by lofty wisdom and an obvious prowess in both magic and diplomacy.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_BLOODFANGORCS@BIO Brutality is Asgera Spinesplitter! She rallies her Orcs with a covenant of conquest, and nothing stands forever against her might.[br/][br/]Bloodfang Orcs are not known for their love of flower arranging or carving fruit into the shapes of tiny animals. They do enjoy the rhythm and visual poetry that results from repeatedly bashing a foe's skull against a bloody rock until it caves in with a beautiful scarlet display of fleshy fireworks.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_BLOODIEDHALFLINGS@BIO Sanguine was a zealous priestess of a peaceful tribe of Halflings, before a tragedy forced the tribe to cannibalism. This drove Sanguine to madness, claiming divine forces allowed these atrocities. She found [hyperlink,GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept]Godirhood[/hyperlink] through a terrifying blood ritual which cost many lives.[br/][br/]The Bloodied Halflings were once a peaceful tribe, but after a terrible earthquake trapped all survivors underground, they had to resort to cannibalism to survive. To cope, they adapted their religion around it.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_BRUTALRATKIN@BIO Rajag was a zealous worshiper of Yaka, believing him the creator of the Tigrans. Rajag was betrayed by his god, however, and found himself in the Void. His zeal led him to Magehaven, where he himself found ascension to Godirhood, vowing revenge on his former object of worship.[br/][br/]The Brutal Ratkin lived in a small society until the High Inquisitor Rajag found them, and promptly claimed dominion over them. They live in an equal measure of awe and fear of their new Ruler.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_COMMONWEALTHHUMANS@BIO Edward Portsmith defended the Commonwealth when reality was assaulted by Shadow Demons. He mastered powerful arcane magic to fight a war that turned the shadows away. He inspired men to fight for the common values held by the living. To this day, even as he faces the effects of time and mortality, he stands ready to defend those who will defend an Age of Wonders. [br/][br/]Legends abound as to the origins of humans. The most common story tells that the first men came in ships, driven from a garden, into the rich lands they were promised. Humans frequently tell stories that place themselves as the ones destined to reign. Though they seem unremarkable in comparison to other races, somehow these clever inventors continue to stick around.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_CORRUPTEDGOBLINS@BIO Gloom Hooknail, the Dark Lady, rewards cruelty. She is fickle and deliberately impulsive, keeping her servants in a state of constant fear while competing for her favor. She loves cruel assassins and rewards the most deplorable acts of depravity, for they amuse her.[br/][br]They creep deep in the dark, which they love and despise. Corrupted Goblins see the fair and laughing souls and let hate and envy fill them. They may not be strong in might, but their minds are devious and filled with a cruelty that horrifies.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_DEEPDWARVES@BIO When the stars light up the night's sky, it is said they are sparks from Fangir's Astral anvil. Once a talented Dwarven artificer, Fangir traveled to the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} and emerged with expanding interests. Where first he controlled rock and earth, he now aims to mold the {GLOBAL.AstralFlowsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} themselves.[br/][br/]Originating from Athlan Dwarves, the Moonrock Dwarves are great builders and runesmiths. When they followed Fangir into the Astral Sea to hunt for riches, they emerged with new insights and aspirations. Why dig and fight for one realm, when the stars themselves are there to be mined?
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_DEEPDWELLERS@BIO Blint listens. The earth trembles and he hears its murmurs. Patiently he waits below, hoarding his resources, until his means are sufficient to overwhelm the fools who waste their efforts on works of rock and stone to fortify themselves.[br/][br/]Blint's Mole-folk, dubbed by many as the Deep Dwellers, are known for outstanding levels of patience and cunning. They possess the knowledge and instinctive ability to both raise glorious structures as well as tear them down in the most efficient manner possible.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_DESTINEDHUMANS@BIO When he was a young prince, Alfred saw the deaths of his parents at the hands of an invading [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WizardKingLoreConcept]Wizard[/hyperlink]. In order to protect his people, he united the splintered factions of {GLOBAL.AthlaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} under one banner and started the search for a new home.[br/][br/]After the return of the Wizard Kings, the many human factions of Athla were unable to rise against the invasion. It took a great hero—a young prince who knew tremendous loss, to unite them under the banner of the Destined Humans.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_ENTHRALLEDORCS@BIO Love and hate burn as blinding embers in Karissa’s lusty savage eyes. She claims the impulse that drives life to the brink of violence. Strength begets strength. Ruthlessly, she will crush any weakness and they praise her for it. She is the true flame burning in the bosom of every mortal being.[br/][br/]Trusting in axe and spear, Enthralled Orcs crush their enemies. Every tradition is focused upon the sole purpose of domination and destruction. They enslave weaker beings to do the disparaging tasks like farming and gathering resources, but the best treasures are plundered from the soft.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_ERUDITEORCS@BIO Only one day after being named High Chancellor of his people, Noctus was poisoned. His feats of necromancy allowed him to not only return from the {GLOBAL.AstralVoidLoreConcept.Hyperlink} as a {GLOBAL.WizardKingLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, but also to bring back the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SoulsLoreConcept]souls[/hyperlink] of his forefathers, who taught him the secrets of death and eternity... and exacted revenge on those who wronged him.[br/][br/]The Erudite Orcs share an almost obsessive interest in history and death. Always searching for a way to extend their massive libraries, they thread the needle between archaeology and grave robbing as they sometimes bring back the dead themselves to verify their research.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_FIENDRODENTS@BIO Kruul embodies the prowess of his kin, despising any lies propagated against his people. He especially hates the one regarding their origins that suggests they were the result of a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept]Godir's[/hyperlink] experimentation crossbreeding rodents and humans, and that in a moment of bloodlust they ate their own creator. Any hint of that story will drive him into a murderous frenzy.[br/][br/]The Fiendish Rodents strive to embody their master's best qualities. As such, they are driven by an insatiable bloodlust and almost gleeful addiction to malevolence and pain.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_FIRSTELVES@BIO After the {GLOBAL.DragonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} breathed out the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]worlds[/hyperlink], and the {GLOBAL.ArchonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} fixed them to stars, they called the first ones to lead those who will put down the storm, quench the fires and quicken the seas. They call for the Wild Guardian, Zaethyl. [br/][br/]The immortal First Elves live refined lives cultivated by millennia of patient thought and arcane mastery. Entrusted with arcane mysteries and guardians of creation magic, they form worlds rife with life. Sometimes perceived as intolerant elites, they have little patience for short-term mortal concerns.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_FROZENTOADS@BIO Anura was the court magician of her people. When her queen did not heed the warning of a harsh upcoming winter, many of her people perished. Anura, desperate to save her people, called upon powerful dark magics to adapt them to the cold.[br/][br/]Once, the Frozen Toads loved to bask in the sun. After Anura cast her spell, they could not stand the warmth anymore. Now all they crave is an eternal frost.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_GNARLEDFROSTLINGS@BIO Her icy filigree sparkles, catching iridescent sheets of boreal ghost-light. Think not to captivate this one, for her heart is frigid. Artica haunts the snowy drifts of winter, leaving no footprints. Goddess to her Frostling subjects, they alone tolerate her frigid isolation.[br/][br/]Specialized people who adore the ice and snow, Frostlings thrive in inhospitable glacial realms. Their frigid adaptation allows them to raid the rich lands that border the frozen wastes, spreading their cold unfeeling ice as a blizzard.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_HUMANDEVOTEES@BIO Some claim she was long ago blessed by the moon, a myth informed by her ivory hair and alabaster skin. Sola rose from humble beginnings to protect and guide her people, who now follow her with fervent devotion. Though she is driven by a sense of goodness and honor, her enemies find that her merciful nature is oft tempered by a layer of unyielding and unforgiving steel.[br/][br/]Originally peopled by a mountain tribe that Sola protected through hardship with mystical powers, her Devotees have since grown in number as well as ability. Today, they do zealous battle in her name, bringing the light of her wisdom or the swift smite of her vengeance to those in need of either.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_HUMANPALADINS@BIO Meshara grew up as the daughter of a knight and a priest. Her people say divine righteousness runs through her blood. Yet, she tries to stay humble—or as humble as one can be, when one is named the Prophetess of her entire people.[br/][br/]The {GLOBAL.ArchonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} are said to be the most legendary protectors of the worlds, and the Human Paladins believe themselves to be a close second. Led by their Prophetess, they aim to bring justice to all living beings on the realms they decide to save.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_MOUNTAINDWARVES@BIO Dwarves labor to impress their Master Artificer. Tugrum Hammerhall shows only that he is never quite appeased. Therefore, stubborn Dwarven men with their stubborn Dwarven wills contest his disapproving brow. One wonders when they will notice that he is secretly quite proud.[br/][br/]The strength of the mountains embodies the Mountain Dwarves. They thrive in the crevices, cliffsides, and among jagged precipices where they can work the hard rock breaking the soft level lands.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_MYSTICTOADS@BIO When the sharp mind of an Amphibian is driven by a divine calling, it can reach quite erudite heights. When, as in the case of Dafal, it ascends to roaming the seas to bring justice, it becomes a force to be reckoned with indeed.[br/][br/]The followers of Dafal Dea are as zealous as they are naturally amphibious. Long conversations about philosophy and [hyperlink,GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept]Godirhood[/hyperlink] can often be heard drifting through the sea fog, to the accompaniment of excited croaks, when one of their vessels is close by.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_NEKRON@BIO Driven by hunger, Nekron brings death to everyone and anyone impartially. He prefers to rule cities of undead, freed from disturbing qualities like free thought and disobedience. Control your emotions, for Nekron is attracted to suffering.[br/][br/]The Cruel Deathbringers were once something one could call Human. Now, they are little more than soulless husks who follow the bidding of their Arch Lich.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_PREORDERTIGRANKNIGHT@BIO After the Commonwealth on {GLOBAL.AthlaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} crumbled under the arrival of the banished [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WizardKingLoreConcept]Wizards[/hyperlink], one lion stood fast in the Astral storm. Aric Rex fights to restore his beloved Commonwealth to its former glory. His armor represents the Emperors of his past.[br/][br/]Even though the Commonwealth of the Third Age has fallen, Aric's faithful followers fight to uphold its values.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_RATTYMUNCHKIN@BIO Many fear the unending hunger of Rakshagi, the Grand Devourer, who was said to have perished of hunger, and now aims to get a taste of every living being in the universe. In the meantime, however, she feasts upon her followers as she pleases.[br/][br/]The Ratty Munchkin revere their Grand Devourer with equal amounts of adoration and fear. They do all they can to please their mistress. After all, it takes very little for her to decide that they are more useful as an afternoon snack.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_SHADOWBORNELVES@BIO The best villains consider themselves heroes. While a simple servant of Meandor, Werlac organized a zealous cult to bring back the banished [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WizardKingLoreConcept]Wizard Kings[/hyperlink], without concern for the cataclysms it unleashed. When he found his reward unsatisfying, he started his search for other ancient powers to revere.[br/][br/]The Shadowborn Elves are wandering cultists, adept at unveiling secrets in the most weird spaces between [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]worlds[/hyperlink]. They follow their cult leader through the shadows of the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept]Astral Sea[/hyperlink] with the ease of pirates on a vast mysterious ocean, looking for a befitting higher power to worship and unleash upon the worlds.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_STARSAILINGFAE@BIO Once, Vaneyra was a First Elf who traveled the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} to prepare and protect the realms long before Humans even existed. But where other First Elves looked forward to landing on a solid realm again, Vaneyra enjoyed the traveling itself the most. The Astral Sea pulled her, called her... and one day she answered the call.[br/][br/]As Vaneyra's followers spent more and more time in the Astral Sea, they found it molded them into something new, something... more. They think of themselves as blessed by unending magics, and aim to return this blessing to all worlds within the Astral Sea.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_UNDERGROUNDDISCIPLES@BIO Xetevaca was named by the excavators who found her after she was cast into the dark depths as a newborn. Her charm and popularity was deemed dangerous by her ruling empress, resulting in the banishment of Xetevaca and her loyal followers. She emerged from the {GLOBAL.AstralVoidLoreConcept.Hyperlink} as a {GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]The Underground Disciples originated as a small community within a vast empire, but their trust in Xetevaca caused them to take a leap of faith into the Astral Void itself. Those who survived emerged with her and now follow her in search of a new home.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_VALIANTTOADS@BIO Raina was a powerful Human queen, who cared more for grandeur than for her subjects. One day an especially scorned and magically adept subject turned the Queen into a toad. Only a life of moderation can break the curse, but since Raina and her people have been toads for generations, this has proven to be an unsurmountable task.[br/][br/]The Cursed Toadlings originated as Raina's most faithful followers. After the first shock of the curse had diminished, they accepted their new existence as semi-aquatic humanoids with valor.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_VOIDSEEKERS@BIO Accrion was a legendary but cruel wizard among his people. Not long after what his emperor called "a series of horrid experiments," Accrion was sentenced to death by beheading. Little did his people know, Accrion was already closely acquainted with the {GLOBAL.AstralVoidLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, and losing his head turned out to be a mere inconvenience.[br/][br/]Voidseekers are the subjects of Accrion, the Voidseer, whose mind travels the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. They are his test subjects and followers, whose knowledge about everything Astral transcend many others.
DEFAULT@LORDS@RACE_WHOLESOMEHALFLINGS@BIO Ham Binger is a legendary Halfling whose curiosity endowed him with a form of immortality that is unique among his people. Notorious for escaping impossible situations, his people know that when Ham disappears, it’s time to make oneself scarce.[br/][br/]Wholesome Halflings pursue a life of simple joys and unsophisticated celebration. They thrive in communities that harbor cooperation, raising livestock and farming verdant hills.
DEFAULT_VICTORY@EVENT_ALLIEDEVERYONE@DESCRIPTION_PLAYER {Player.Name} will win the game in {Turns}[turn/] if all of their alliances remain intact until that time. If you do not want the game to end, break your alliance with {Player.Name} now.
DEFAULT_VICTORY@EVENT_ALLIEDEVERYONE@DESCRIPTION_YOU You will win the game in {Turns}[turn/] if all of the other Rulers remain allies until that time. If you don't want the game to end, break one of your alliances now.
DEFAULT_VICTORY@EVENT_ALLIEDEVERYONE@PLAYER {Player.Name} allied with all other Rulers and will achieve victory.
DEFAULT_VICTORY@EVENT_ALLIEDEVERYONE@YOU You are allied with all other Rulers and will achieve victory.
DEFAULT_VICTORY@OBJECTIVE@MAINTAIN_ALLIANCE Victory in {INT_turns}[turn/]. {STR_leaderName} is allied with all Rulers.
DEFAULT_VICTORY@OBJECTIVE@MAINTAIN_ALLIANCE_YOU Victory in {INT_turns}[turn/]. You are allied with all Rulers.
DEFAULT_VICTORY@OBJECTIVE@RIVALS_REMAINING Defeat the remaining Rulers: {INT_Count} / {INT_Total}
DEFAULT_VICTORY@RESULT@DEFEAT {OtherPlayer.Name} achieved Military Victory
DEFAULT_VICTORY@RESULT@VICTORY Military
DEFAULT_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@DESCRIPTION To achieve the Military Victory, an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} needs to defeat all other [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DSAllianceConcept]Non-Allied[/hyperlink] empires. To defeat an empire, its {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} needs to be [hyperlink,GLOBAL.RulerVoidConcept]Forced into the Astral Void[/hyperlink] and its {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink} must be captured. If a Ruler is forced into the Astral Void, they will respawn at their Throne City unless it is captured by another empire.
DEFAULT_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NAME Military Victory
DEFINITIONS_SIEGES@SIEGE_UNIT_PROPERTY@NAME Ongoing Siege
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@ALREADYRUNNING This action is already running.
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@COOLDOWN This action is on a cooldown and can be actioned within {Cooldown} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@FIXEDDIPLOMACY You cannot perform this action because your diplomatic relations with the other Ruler are fixed.
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@LEADERINVOID You cannot perform this action while your Ruler is in the Astral Void.
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@LEADERINVOIDEITHER You cannot perform this action while either Ruler is in the Astral Void.
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@NOCASUSBELLI You don't have any <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>> that can be used for this action.
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@NOMUTUALLYKNOWNPLAYERS There are no available Rulers that you both have met.
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@NOTWHILEATWAR You cannot perform this action while you are at war with the other ruler.
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@OPPONENTINVOID You cannot perform this action while the other ruler is in the Astral Void.
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@TOOEXPENSIVE Cannot afford this action.
DIPLOMACY@ACTION@UPKEEPTOOEXPENSIVE Cannot afford the upkeep of this action.
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT@EVIL_ACT Evil [evilact/] character action.
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT@GOOD_ACT Good [goodact/] character action.
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_DESCRIPTION@HIGH_EFFECT_EVIL This {GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink} starts {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.AWAKENED.Hyperlink}.
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_EFFECT@NEUTRAL A neutral alignment has no substantial effect on other <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> and [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Free Cities[/hyperlink]. Once the alignment increases or decreases to a different level, relations will be impacted.
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_EFFECT@PEACEKEEPER_L1 [bulletlist][bullet/]+{IntRelation}[goodRelation/] relation with [minorcity/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Free Cities[/hyperlink] and <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> that have [reputation4/]Neutral or better alignment.[bullet/]Random events that occur have a +{IntKarmaBuff} chance to be positive.[bulletlist/]
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_EFFECT@WARMONGER_L1 [bulletlist][bullet/]-{IntRelation}[badRelation/] relation with [minorcity/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Free Cities[/hyperlink] and <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> that have [reputation4/]Neutral or better alignment.[bullet/]Random events that occur have a +{IntKarmaDebuff} chance to be negative.[bulletlist/]
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_HYPERLINK@NEUTRAL [reputation4/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentNeutral]Neutral[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_HYPERLINK@PEACEKEEPER_L1 [reputation6/] [hyperlink,Global.AlignmentGood1]Good[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_HYPERLINK@PEACEKEEPER_L2 [reputation7/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentGood2]Very Good[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_HYPERLINK@PEACEKEEPER_L3 [reputation8/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentGood3]Pure Good[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_HYPERLINK@WARMONGER_L1 [reputation2/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentEvil1]Evil[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_HYPERLINK@WARMONGER_L2 [reputation1/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentEvil2]Very Evil[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_HYPERLINK@WARMONGER_L3 [reputation0/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentEvil3]Pure Evil[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_NAME@NEUTRAL [reputation4/] Neutral
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_NAME@PEACEKEEPER_L1 [reputation6/] Good
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_NAME@PEACEKEEPER_L2 [reputation7/] Very Good
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_NAME@PEACEKEEPER_L3 [reputation8/] Pure Good
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_NAME@WARMONGER_L1 [reputation2/] Evil
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_NAME@WARMONGER_L2 [reputation1/] Very Evil
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_NAME@WARMONGER_L3 [reputation0/] Pure Evil
DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_NOEFFECT@TITLE No Effect on {GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept.Hyperlink}
DIPLOMACY@ANSWER_CALLTOWAR@BUTTON_CANCEL Decide later
DIPLOMACY@ANSWER_CALLTOWAR@DEFENSIVEPACT Declining will break your {DiplomaticState.Hyperlink} with {Ally.Lord.FirstName}! This is considered an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act ({AllignmentPenalty}[evilact/])!
DIPLOMACY@ANSWER_CALLTOWAR@DEFENSIVEPACT_NOTDEFENSIVEWAR You share a {GLOBAL.DefensivePactConcept.Hyperlink} with {Ally.Lord.FirstName}, but they are not fighting a defensive war, so the pact will not be broken and there are no additional penalties if you decline.
DIPLOMACY@ANSWER_CALLTOWAR@DESCRIPTION {Ally.Name} is calling for your aid in <<o:{Ally.Name}>> war against {Target.Name}. Accepting <<o:{Ally.Name}>> call gives you +{CBBonus}[casusBelli/] to use against {Target.Lord.FirstName} directly. Declining will give {Ally.Lord.FirstName} {CBPenalty}[casusBelli/] against you, making your relations with <<P:{Ally.Name}>> suffer. {Ally.Lord.FirstName} expects a response within {ResponseTime}[turn/].
DIPLOMACY@ANSWER_CALLTOWAR@TITLE Call to war against {Target.Lord.FirstName}
DIPLOMACY@BUILDONCLAIMED@CONFIRMATION_DESCRIPTION This [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept]province[/hyperlink] has already been [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ClaimConcept]claimed[/hyperlink]. Building here causes other [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PlayerConcept]Rulers[/hyperlink] to gain a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} ({CasusBelliValue}[casusBelli/] or {DistantCasusBelliValue}[casusBelli/] for distant claims) against you, making it easier for them to declare {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} on you.[br/][minorCity/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Free Cities[/hyperlink] will receive a relations penalty for ignoring their [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ClaimConcept]claims[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The following [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PlayerConcept]Rulers[/hyperlink] and [minorCity/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Free Cities[/hyperlink] have [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ClaimConcept]claimed[/hyperlink] this [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept]province[/hyperlink]:
DIPLOMACY@BUILDONCLAIMED@CONFIRMATION_DESCRIPTION_POST Are you sure you want to build here?
DIPLOMACY@BUILDONCLAIMED@CONFIRMATION_TITLE Do you want to build in this claimed province?
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@BUTTON_AGAINST Call a Ruler into war against {Target.Lord.FirstName}
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@BUTTON_AGAINST_TOOLTIP Call a {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} into your war against {Target.Lord.FirstName}. If they accept, they will receive a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} against {Target.Name} to justify their cause. This will be equal to your own Grievance + {CBBonus}[casusBelli/].
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@BUTTON_ANSWER Answer Call to War from {Player.Lord.FirstName}
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@BUTTON_ANSWER_AGAINST Answer Call to War against {Target.Lord.FirstName}
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@BUTTON_ANSWER_TOOLTIP Answer Call to War from {Player.Name} against {Target.Name}. Accepting their call will give you additional <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>>, while declining will damage your relations.
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@BUTTON_INTO Call {Player.Lord.FirstName} to War
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@BUTTON_INTO_TOOLTIP Send a request to {Player.Lord.FirstName} to join you in a war you are fighting. If <<p:{Player.Name}>> accepts, <<p:{Player.Name}>> will receive a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} against the target {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} to justify <<o:{Player.Name}>> cause. This will be equal to your own Grievance + {CBBonus}[casusBelli/].
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@CONFIRMATION {Player.Name} will respond to your call within {Turns}[turn/]. <<Cp:{Player.Name}>> will receive {CBTotal}[casusBelli/] if <<p:{Player.Name}>> accepts and joins you in your war against {Target.Name}. However, you will gain {CBPenalty}[casusBelli/] on {Player.Lord.FirstName} if <<p:{Player.Name}>> declines your call.
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@DESCRIPTION <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> may call each other into {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} with a Ruler who they themselves are already at war with.[br/][br/]The Rulers must share at least a {GLOBAL.MutualConsulateConcept.Hyperlink} to send a call to war. The receiving Ruler may choose to accept or decline the call. Accepting gives them a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} bonus, whereas declining will result in considerable [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]relations[/hyperlink] penalties.
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CallToWarConcept]Call to War[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@ITEM Call {Player.Lord.FirstName} to war against {Target.Lord.FirstName}
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@ITEM_ANSWER Answer call to war from {Player.Lord.FirstName} against {Target.Lord.FirstName}
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@ITEM_TOOLTIP Call {Player.Name} into your war against {Target.Name}. They will receive {CBTotal}[casusBelli/] against {Target.Name} to justify their cause.
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@ITEM_TOOLTIP_FAIL_COOLDOWN {Player.Lord.FirstName} recently declined your call to war and cannot be called to war again for {Cooldown}<<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@ITEM_TOOLTIP_FAIL_COOLDOWNWAR {Player.Lord.FirstName} and {Target.Lord.FirstName} were recently in a war and cannot be called to war against each other. Wait {Cooldown}<<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> to make a call to war.
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@ITEM_TOOLTIP_FAIL_TRUCE {Player.Lord.FirstName} and {Target.Lord.FirstName} share a {GLOBAL.TruceConcept.Hyperlink} and cannot be called to war against each other. The truce still lasts {Cooldown}<<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMACY@CALLTOWAR@TITLE Call to war
DIPLOMACY@CANTBREAKTREATY@TITLE Treaties last indefinitely but can be broken manually or by declaring {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}. Some diplomatic treaties rely on a specific diplomatic state or another treaty. When a treaty ends, any other treaty made in the same trade deal also expires.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@AGAINST_OTHER_SHORT Your <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept}>>:
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@AGAINST_YOU_SHORT Their <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept}>>:
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@CANT_AFFORD_OTHER They cannot afford to pay off this {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}!
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@CANT_AFFORD_SELF You cannot afford to pay off this {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}!
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@CANT_TRADE This {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} cannot be traded.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@COOLDOWN It is too soon for them to buy another {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}, try in {Cooldown}<<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@COOLDOWN_SELL It is too soon for them to sell another {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}. Try in {Cooldown}<<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@DESCRIPTION [casusBelli/] Grievances determine your {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Hyperlink} against other <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>>. They are your reason for going to war.[br/][br/]Obtained primarily by:[bulletlist][bullet/]Seeing a trespasser.[bullet/]Having another Ruler build on a {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink} you've claimed.[bullet/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.FabricatedCasusBelliConcept]Fabricating a [casusBelli/] Grievance[/hyperlink].[bullet/]Being attacked.[/bulletlist][br/][br/][casusBelli/] Grievances can be exchanged for <<m:{GLOBAL.ResourceConcept.Hyperlink}>> with the Ruler they're held against.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@DESCRIPTION_LEVEL_-1 A war would be unjustified and so our alignment and relations with other Rulers and cities will suffer deeply.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@DESCRIPTION_LEVEL_0 Starting a war with no justification will damage our alignment and relations with other Rulers and cities.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@DESCRIPTION_LEVEL_1 War is possible, but our alignment and relations would still suffer.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@DESCRIPTION_LEVEL_2 Our vassal cities will support our war, but other parties maintain a neutral stance.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@DESCRIPTION_LEVEL_3 The people demand war! Our vassals and other Rulers will support our decision.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@HYPERLINK [casusBelli/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept]Grievance[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TITLE [casusBelli/] Grievance
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TITLE_LEVEL_0 None
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TITLE_LEVEL_1 Minor
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TITLE_LEVEL_2 Moderate
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TITLE_LEVEL_3 Major
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TITLE_LEVEL_N1 Unjust
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TITLE_LEVEL_N2 Very unjust
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TITLE_LEVEL_N3 Completely unjust
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TRADE_BUY Pay for your transgression
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TRADE_DESCRIPTION_OTHER Do you want to pay off this {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Name}?
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TRADE_DESCRIPTION_SELF Do you want to sell this {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Name}?
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TRADE_FORGIVE Forgive transgression
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TRADE_FORGIVE_FABRICATED Cannot forgive a Fabricated {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TRADE_FORGIVE_TOOLTIP Forgiving the opposing Ruler for their transgression will remove the {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}. This counts as an act of good [goodact/] and will also give a relations bonus.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TRADE_SELL Sell Grievance
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@TRADE_TOOLTIP The {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} and its effects on your relations will be removed for the given price.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@USAGEBLOCKED [fireCol]Due to ongoing effects, you cannot currently make use of your <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/fireCol]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION War Justification
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_DESCRIPTION War Justification is the balance of <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept}>> between two <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> and is used to determine the impact of declaring {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]When starting a {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept.Hyperlink} may be affected.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink} income may be affected.[bullet/]Non-allied rulers can receive <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept}>>.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept.Hyperlink} with other Rulers as well as [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityRelationConcept]relations[/hyperlink] with ([hyperlink,GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageConcept]Vassal[/hyperlink])[hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Cities[/hyperlink] may be affected.[/bulletlist][br/][br/]The following War Justification levels can be reached:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvl3Concept.Hyperlink} ({LVL3Min}+[casusBelli/])[bullet/]{GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvl2Concept.Hyperlink} ({LVL2Max}[casusBelli/] to {LVL2Min}[casusBelli/])[bullet/]{GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvl1Concept.Hyperlink} ({LVL1Max}[casusBelli/] to {LVL1Min}[casusBelli/])[bullet/]{GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvl0Concept.Hyperlink} ({LVL0Min}[casusBelli/])[bullet/]{GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvlN1Concept.Hyperlink} ({LVL-1Max}[casusBelli/] to {LVL-1Min}[casusBelli/])[bullet/]{GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvlN2Concept.Hyperlink} ({LVL-2Max}[casusBelli/] to {LVL-2Min}[casusBelli/])[bullet/]{GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvlN3Concept.Hyperlink} ({LVL-3Min}[casusBelli/])[/bulletlist]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept]War Justification[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_0_DESCRIPTION With no {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept} (0[casusBelli/]), declaring {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} becomes more damaging to your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Unjustified wars are considered an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act, affect all of your relations negatively and impact your {ResourcePenalty} income by {ResourcePenaltyValue} cumulatively while the war lasts.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_0_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvl0Concept]None[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_0_TITLE War Justification: None
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_1_DESCRIPTION Having only minor {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept} ({Max}[casusBelli/] to {Min}[casusBelli/]), means that declaring {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} is justified but still frowned upon by other <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]Wars are still considered an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act and your {GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept.Hyperlink} with other Rulers will suffer a penalty.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_1_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvl1Concept]Minor[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_1_TITLE War Justification: Minor
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_2_DESCRIPTION With Moderate {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept} ({Max}[casusBelli/] to {Min}[casusBelli/]), declaring {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} is now supported by your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageConcept]Vassal[/hyperlink] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Cities[/hyperlink] as they gain a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityRelationConcept]Relations[/hyperlink] bonus and your {ResourceBonus} income increases by {ResourceBonusValue} cumulatively while the war lasts.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_2_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvl2Concept]Moderate[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_2_TITLE War Justification: Moderate
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_3_DESCRIPTION With Major {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept} ({Max}+[casusBelli/]), declaring {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} is fully justified. Your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageConcept]Vassal[/hyperlink] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Cities[/hyperlink] gain a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityRelationConcept]Relations[/hyperlink] bonus and your {ResourceBonus} income increases by {ResourceBonusValue} cumulatively while the war lasts.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_3_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvl3Concept]Major[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_3_TITLE War Justification: Major
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_N1_DESCRIPTION With negative {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept} ({Max}[casusBelli/] to {Min}[casusBelli/]), declaring {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} becomes even more damaging to your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}![br/][br/]Unjustified wars are considered an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act, affect all of your relations negatively and impact your {ResourcePenalty} income by {ResourcePenaltyValue} cumulatively while the war lasts.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_N1_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvlN1Concept]Unjust[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_N1_TITLE War Justification: Unjust
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_N2_DESCRIPTION With negative {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept} ({Max}[casusBelli/] to {Min}[casusBelli/]), declaring {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} becomes even more damaging to your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}![br/][br/]Unjustified wars are considered an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act, affect all of your relations negatively and impact your {ResourcePenalty} income by {ResourcePenaltyValue} cumulatively while the war lasts.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_N2_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvlN2Concept]Very unjust[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_N2_TITLE War Justification: Very unjust
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_N3_DESCRIPTION With completely negative {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept} ({Min}[casusBelli/]), declaring {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} can severely damage your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}![br/][br/]Unjustified wars are considered an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act, affect all of your relations negatively and impact your {ResourcePenalty} income by {ResourcePenaltyValue} cumulatively while the war lasts.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_N3_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WarJustificationLvlN3Concept]Completely unjust[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WAR_JUSTIFICATION_LEVEL_N3_TITLE War Justification: Completely unjust
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI@WONTSELL [fireCol]{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} can't be traded[/fireCol]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI_FABRICATED@DESCRIPTION A fabricated {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} is a Grievance about an event that did not actually happen but can still be used as a cause for {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]<<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept}>> can only have one fabricated grievance against another Ruler and can use these to declare War or {GLOBAL.DenounceConcept.Hyperlink} them. Fabricated Grievances can be sold to the opposing Ruler but cannot be forgiven.[br/][br/]Grievances can be fabricated through <<m:{GLOBAL.PronouncementsConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI_FABRICATED@HYPERLINK [casusBelli/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.FabricatedCasusBelliConcept]Fabricated Grievance[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@CASUSBELLI_FABRICATED@TITLE [casusBelli/] Fabricated Grievance
DIPLOMACY@CONFIRM_DECLAREWAR@REFERENCED In order to declare war on {Vassal.Name}, you must instead declare war on their overlord {STR_leaderName}.
DIPLOMACY@CONFIRM_DECLAREWAR_CB@DESCRIPTION You declare war on {STR_leaderName}. Depending on your {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Hyperlink} balance, relations with other Rulers and cities may be affected along with your {GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink} income.
DIPLOMACY@CONFIRM_DECLAREWAR_CB@TITLE Declare war?
DIPLOMACY@CONFIRM_DECLAREWAR_NOCB@DESCRIPTION You declare war on {STR_leaderName}. Without any {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}, your {GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink} income and relations with other (non-allied) Rulers and cities will suffer heavily.
DIPLOMACY@CONFIRM_DECLAREWAR_NOCB@TITLE Declare war without any {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Name}?
DIPLOMACY@CONFIRM_DENOUNCEPLAYER@DESCRIPTION A denouncement is a verbal warning about a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} that affects the targeted Ruler and their relations with other AI Rulers that you both have met.[br/][br/]A Ruler may only be denounced once for each unique Grievance a Ruler has against them.[br/][br/]Denouncing a Ruler using <<m:{GLOBAL.FabricatedCasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>> will cause them to have a grievance against you![br/][br/]Denouncements can be made through <<m:{GLOBAL.PronouncementsConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMACY@DECLAREWAREFFECT@CASUSBELLI Grievances awarded to non-Allied Rulers
DIPLOMACY@DECLAREWAREFFECT@CASUSBELLI_GOODVSEVIL Grievances awarded to non-Allied Good Alignment Rulers
DIPLOMACY@DECLAREWAREFFECT@EVICTARMIES Armies will be moved out of enemy territory
DIPLOMACY@DECLAREWAREFFECT@FREECITYRELATION Relations with non-Vassal Cities
DIPLOMACY@DECLAREWAREFFECT@GAINPLAYERRELATION Relations with other Rulers
DIPLOMACY@DECLAREWAREFFECT@LOSEPLAYERRELATION Relations with non-Allied Rulers
DIPLOMACY@DECLAREWAREFFECT@VASSALALLEGIACE Allegiance of Vassal Cities
DIPLOMACY@DECLAREWAREFFECT@VASSALRELATION Relations with Vassal Cities
DIPLOMACY@DENOUNCE@COST Cost to denounce:

DIPLOMACY@DIPLOMATIC_STATE@ALLIANCE Alliance

DIPLOMACY@DIPLOMATIC_STATE@NEUTRAL_DESCRIPTION Peace is the default state of relations. Better terms are achieved through {GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept.Hyperlink}, or {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} can be declared.
DIPLOMACY@DIPLOMATIC_STATE@NEUTRAL_HYPERLINK [rs_neutral/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DSNeutralConcept]Peace[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@DIPLOMATIC_STATE@WAR War
DIPLOMACY@DIPLOMATIC_STATE_DESC@ALLIANCE The strongest bond two <<m:{GLOBAL.PlayerConcept.Hyperlink}>> can share. While in an alliance, allied victories are possible when enabled, and <<m:{GLOBAL.PlayerConcept.Hyperlink}>> are automatically [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CallToWarConcept]called[/hyperlink] for aid in <<m:{GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMACY@DIPLOMATIC_STATE_DESC@NEUTRAL While in a Peace state, the Rulers' relationship can change positively or negatively. The path to war lies open, but more peaceful options can also be pursued, such as treaties, and eventually, by means of the Wizard's Bond, creating an alliance.
DIPLOMACY@DIPLOMATIC_STATE_DESC@WAR While at war, Rulers can attack each other, claim provinces and cast spells at will.
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION@SELECTCASUSBELLI Select a Grievance
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION@SELECTPLAYER Select a Ruler
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION@TASKDURATION Task Duration: {Duration}[turn/]
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_COMPLIMENT@DESCRIPTION Compliment the other Ruler. This will improve your relations with them by {RelationValue}[goodRelation/].
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_COMPLIMENT@NAME Compliment
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@DESCRIPTION Declare your Friendship with another {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} publicly.[br/][br/]A modifier that slowly increases towards {RelationValue}[goodRelation/] will be added to your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]relations[/hyperlink] with the Ruler. Any <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>> gained against that Ruler will be reduced by {Reduction}%. When two Rulers declare Friendship with each other, each active diplomatic treaty they have increases the maximum relations bonus by {RelationBonus}[goodRelation/], up to {MaxRelationBonus}[goodRelation/] in total.[br/][br/]Maintaining a declaration costs {cost} upkeep per {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}, which increases by {costScale} for each additional declaration.[br/][br/]Declarations can be made and ended through <<m:{GLOBAL.PronouncementsConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@EVENT_OTHER Other Rulers declared a friendship
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@EVENT_RECEIVER A Friendship with you was declared
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@EVENT_SELF You declared a Friendship
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclFriendshipConcept]Declaration of Friendship[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@INFOPANEL {HouseALord.Name} has declared a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclFriendshipConcept]Friendship[/hyperlink] with {HouseBLord.Name}. Over time their relations may improve and grow into an {GLOBAL.DSAllianceConcept.Hyperlink}. Declaring a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclFriendshipConcept]Friendship[/hyperlink] with {HouseBLord.FirstName} can strengthen your relations with {HouseALord.FirstName}, while a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclRivalryConcept]Rivalry[/hyperlink] can turn {HouseALord.FirstName} against you.
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@NAME Declaration of Friendship
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@DESCRIPTION Declare a Rivalry with another {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} publicly.[br/][br/]A modifier that slowly decreases towards {RelationValue}[badRelation/] will be added to your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]relations[/hyperlink] with the Ruler. Any <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>> gained against that Ruler will be increased by {Increase}%. However, making treaties becomes impossible and any existing treaties will be broken.[br/][br/]Maintaining a declaration costs {cost} upkeep per {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}, which increases by {costScale} for each additional declaration.[br/][br/]Declarations can be made and ended through <<m:{GLOBAL.PronouncementsConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@EVENT_OTHER Other Rulers declared a rivalry
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@EVENT_RECEIVER A Rivalry was declared on you
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@EVENT_SELF You declared a Rivalry
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclRivalryConcept]Declaration of Rivalry[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@INFOPANEL {HouseALord.Name} has declared a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclRivalryConcept]Rivalry[/hyperlink] with {HouseBLord.Name}. Over time their relations may deteriorate and lead to {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}. Declaring a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclRivalryConcept]Rivalry[/hyperlink] with {HouseBLord.FirstName} can strengthen your relations with the {HouseALord.FirstName}, while a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclFriendshipConcept]Friendship[/hyperlink] can turn {HouseALord.FirstName} against you.
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@NAME Declaration of Rivalry
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_DETERIORATETHIRDPARTY@NAME Sabotage Relations
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_END_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@DESCRIPTION Ends your declaration of friendship. This also breaks the opposing Ruler's declaration of friendship if they have one, and any gains in relations from the declaration will be lost.
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_END_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@EVENT_OTHER Other Rulers ended their friendship
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_END_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@EVENT_RECEIVER A Friendship with you was ended

DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_END_DECLARATIONOFFRIENDSHIP@NAME End Declaration of Friendship
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_END_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@DESCRIPTION End your rivalry with this Ruler. Any losses in relations will be regained and treaties will become available again if they have not declared you to be their rival.
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_END_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@EVENT_OTHER Other Rulers ended their rivalry
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_END_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@EVENT_RECEIVER A Rivalry with you ended
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_END_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@EVENT_SELF You ended your Rivalry
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_END_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@INFOPANEL {HouseALord.Name}'s [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclRivalryConcept]Rivalry[/hyperlink] with {HouseBLord.Name} has ended. This may improve their relations.
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_END_DECLARATIONOFRIVALRY@NAME End Declaration of Rivalry
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_FABRICATECASUSBELLI@DESCRIPTION [hyperlink,GLOBAL.FabricatedCasusBelliConcept]Fabricates[/hyperlink] a minor [casusBelli/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept]Grievance[/hyperlink] against the opponent. This will enable you to start a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept]justified[/hyperlink] {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} as normal, but it cannot be forgiven and will have a negative impact on your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]relations[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Trying to [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DenounceConcept]denounce[/hyperlink] an opposing Ruler using a Fabricated {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} will cause them to have a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept]Grievance[/hyperlink] against you!
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_FABRICATECASUSBELLI@NAME Fabricate Grievance
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_IMPROVETHIRDPARTY@NAME Support Relations
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_INSULT@DESCRIPTION Insult the other Ruler. This will grant them a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} ({Points}[casusBelli/]) against you.
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_INSULT@NAME Insult
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_TEXT@FRIENDSHIP You made a compliment
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_TEXT@INSULTED You made an insult
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_TEXT@WAS_FRIENDED You were complimented
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_TEXT@WAS_FRIENDED_EXT Another Ruler was complimented
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_TEXT@WAS_INSULTED You were insulted
DIPLOMACY@DISCUSSION_TEXT@WAS_INSULTED_EXT Another Ruler was insulted
DIPLOMACY@EFFECT_REMOVECASUSBELLI@RESULT {INT_numCasusBelli}[casusBelli/] <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>> removed!
DIPLOMACY@ENTERCLAIMED@CONFIRMATION_DESCRIPTION This [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept]Province[/hyperlink] has already been [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ClaimConcept]claimed[/hyperlink]. Capturing it causes other [hyperlink,GLOBAL.LeaderConcept]Rulers[/hyperlink] to gain a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} ({CasusBelliValue}[casusBelli/] or {DistantCasusBelliValue}[casusBelli/] for distant claims) against you, making it easier for them to declare {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} on you. [minorCity/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Free Cities[/hyperlink] will receive a relations penalty for ignoring their [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ClaimConcept]claims[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The following [hyperlink,GLOBAL.LeaderConcept]Rulers[/hyperlink] and [minorCity/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Free Cities[/hyperlink] have [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ClaimConcept]claimed[/hyperlink] this [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept]province[/hyperlink]:
DIPLOMACY@ENTERCLAIMED@CONFIRMATION_DESCRIPTION_POST Are you sure you want to enter this structure?
DIPLOMACY@ENTERCLAIMED@CONFIRMATION_TITLE Do you want to enter this claimed structure?
DIPLOMACY@FABRICATED@NAME Fabricated
DIPLOMACY@FIRSTMEET@NEGATIVE Give threatening welcome [badRelation/]
DIPLOMACY@FIRSTMEET@NEGATIVE_TOOLTIP Insult the other {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} — who needs them anyway?! Your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]relations[/hyperlink] with them will suffer {INT_value}[badRelation/] and they may eventually be lured into {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}.
DIPLOMACY@FIRSTMEET@NEUTRAL Start negotiating
DIPLOMACY@FIRSTMEET@POSITIVE Send welcome gift {Cost}
DIPLOMACY@FIRSTMEET@POSITIVE_TOOLTIP Greet the other {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} with a gift. They might make a formidable [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DSAllianceConcept]ally[/hyperlink] in the future. You gift {Cost} and your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]relations[/hyperlink] with this Ruler improve by {Relation}[goodRelation/].
DIPLOMACY@FIRSTMEET@SHOW_LOCATION Show first contact location
DIPLOMACY@HOSTILEACTION@FIXED_HEADER Cannot Perform Hostile Action
DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_DIPLOMATIC_STATE@COOPERATION Pact of Cooperation

DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_DIPLOMATIC_STATE@INTEGRATION_DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]City ownership is given to the {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} forging this pact.[bullet/]Ceases to exist as a diplomatic entity.[bullet/]The {GLOBAL.FreeCityLordConcept.Hyperlink} becomes a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink} of the {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} forging this pact.[bullet/]Any <<m:{GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept.Hyperlink}>> will be released.[/bulletlist]

DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_DIPLOMATIC_STATE@LOYALTY_DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]The {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} shares its vision.[bullet/]The {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} allows building on claimed provinces.[bullet/]Contributes {commandPoints}[recruitmentPoints/] to the {GLOBAL.RequestMilitaryAidConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Will [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ReinforcementRuleConcept]reinforce[/hyperlink] in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} against <<m:{GLOBAL.MarauderConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> the {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} is at {GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept.Hyperlink} with.[/bulletlist]

DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_DIPLOMATIC_STATE@NEUTRAL_DESCRIPTION The default {GLOBAL.PvEDiplStateConcept.Hyperlink}. The {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} and the {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} have not yet [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]negotiated[/hyperlink] any better terms. This can be done using a {GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept.Hyperlink}.
DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_DIPLOMATIC_STATE@VASSALAGE Pact of Vassalage
DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_DIPLOMATIC_STATE@VASSALAGE_DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]The {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} shares its income and <<m:{GLOBAL.MagicMaterialConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Other <<m: {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}>> may no longer [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]negotiate[/hyperlink] better <<m: {GLOBAL.PvEDiplStateConcept.Hyperlink}>> with the {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]The{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} will join their overlord in any <<m:{GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}>> they are fighting and can assist in combat.[bullet/]Switches to the {GLOBAL.VassalagePhaseConcept.Hyperlink}, during which further {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} can be earned to improve the benefits of vassalage. Eventually the {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} may be [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PactOfIntegrationConcept]integrated[/hyperlink] into the empire of its overlord.[/bulletlist]

DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_DIPLOMATIC_STATE@WAR War
DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_INFLUENCE@DESCRIPTION Allegiance represents the commitment of a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} to an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Allegiance is primarily gained by giving a {GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept} to the {GLOBAL.FreeCityLordConcept.Hyperlink} which starts <<m:{GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept.Hyperlink}>>. Increasing allegiance will result in better <<m: {GLOBAL.PvEDiplStateConcept.Hyperlink}>> with the city, eventually leading to a {GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.PactOfIntegrationConcept.Hyperlink}.

DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_INFLUENCE@MIN Min Allegiance: [allegiance/]{MinPoints}

DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_INFLUENCE@TITLE [allegiance/] Allegiance
DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_INFLUENCE_BOOST@DESCRIPTION Boosts negotiations by adding half of the required allegiance to reach the next diplomatic state. The cost of this action increases with the amount of allegiance gained. This action can only be executed once while in the current diplomatic state.[br/][br/]You gain: {Influence}[br/]Cost: {Cost}
DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_INFLUENCE_BOOST@TEXT Boost [allegiance/] Allegiance

DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_WAR_CHANCE@DESCRIPTION Because of your {GLOBAL.IndependentCityRelationConcept.Hyperlink} with the {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}, there is a chance of the City declaring {GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept.Hyperlink} on you at the start of every {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]You will not suffer any penalties for this, but the City may start sending armies to attack you when war is declared.

DIPLOMACY@PLAYERINTERACTION@FOOTER_DIPLOMACYEVENT_POSITIVE {HouseBLord.Name} compliments you on your actions and improves your relations by {RelationBonus}[goodRelation/].

DIPLOMACY@PLAYERINTERACTION@FOOTER_RESPONSE_CALLTOWAR_REPLY_DECLINED You have declined {HouseBLord.FirstName}'s call to war against {Target.Name}.

This worsens your relations by {RelationValue}[badRelation/] while the situation lasts.
DIPLOMACY@PLAYERINTERACTION@FOOTER_RESPONSE_DECLARATION_MUTUALFRIENDSHIP_DEFAULT {HouseBLord.FirstName} is pleased that you share a common [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclFriendshipConcept]Friendship[/hyperlink] with {Target.Lord.FirstName}. This improves your relations by {RelationValue}[goodRelation/] while the situation lasts.
DIPLOMACY@PLAYERINTERACTION@FOOTER_RESPONSE_DECLARATION_MUTUALRIVALRY_DEFAULT {HouseBLord.FirstName} is pleased that you share a common [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclRivalryConcept]Rivalry[/hyperlink] with {Target.Lord.FirstName}. This improves your relations by {RelationValue}[goodRelation/] while the situation lasts.
DIPLOMACY@PLAYERINTERACTION@FOOTER_RESPONSE_DECLARATION_PLAYERFRIENDSHIP_DEFAULT You have issued a {GLOBAL.DeclFriendshipConcept.Hyperlink} to {HouseBLord.FirstName}. In time, this could help improve your relations.
DIPLOMACY@PLAYERINTERACTION@FOOTER_RESPONSE_DECLARATION_PLAYERRIVALRY_DEFAULT You have issued a {GLOBAL.DeclRivalryConcept.Hyperlink} to {HouseBLord.FirstName}. In time, this may lead to war!
DIPLOMACY@PLAYERINTERACTION@FOOTER_RESPONSE_DECLARATION_RIVALOFFRIEND_DEFAULT {HouseBLord.Name} calls you out on your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclRivalryConcept]Declared Rivalry[/hyperlink] with their [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DeclFriendshipConcept]Friend[/hyperlink] {Target.Lord.FirstName}. This worsens your relations by {RelationValue}[badRelation/] while the situation lasts.
DIPLOMACY@PLAYERINTERACTION@FOOTER_RESPONSE_DENOUNCE_DEFAULT You denounced {HouseBLord.Name}. This will have a damaging effect on the relations {HouseBLord.Name} has with all AI Rulers that know both you and {HouseBLord.Name}.

DIPLOMACY@PLAYEROPINION@GRUDGE Grudge due to <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>>
DIPLOMACY@PLAYEROPINION@GRUDGE_REMAIN Grudge due to expired <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>>
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@DESCRIPTION The threat level represents how threatened other <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> feel.[br/][br/]This level is influenced by many factors that look at how well each Ruler is doing: for example if they have large <<m:{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}>>, many <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>, or are supported by many [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DSAllianceConcept]allies[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The threat level is expressed as a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]relations[/hyperlink] modifier.
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@FACTORS We've found out the following contributing factors.
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AIPressureConcept]Threat Level[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_-1 Uneasy
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_-1_DESCRIPTION The {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} feels threatened by your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}, which affects your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]relations[/hyperlink] with them by {RelationValue}[badRelation/] and also makes trading with them more costly.
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_-2 Vigilant
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_-3 Wary
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_-4 Threatened
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_0 Indifferent
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_0_DESCRIPTION The {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} feels indifferent about your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} which may still change over time.
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_1 At ease
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_1_DESCRIPTION The {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} feels confident toward your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}, which affects your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]Relations[/hyperlink] with them by {RelationValue}[goodRelation/].
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_2 Confident
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@LEVEL_3 Trusting
DIPLOMACY@PRESSURE@TITLE Threat Level
DIPLOMACY@PRONOUNCEMENTS@ACTIVEINFO Active pronouncement actions that target this Ruler are still running. Their effects are applied once the actions finish.
DIPLOMACY@PRONOUNCEMENTS@DESCRIPTION A statement or declaration that <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> can make towards other Rulers to enhance their [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]Relations[/hyperlink]. Includes [hyperlink,GLOBAL.FabricatedCasusBelliConcept]fabricating[/hyperlink] <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>>, making declarations, [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CallToWarConcept]Calling Rulers to War[/hyperlink] and more.
DIPLOMACY@PRONOUNCEMENTS@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PronouncementsConcept]Pronouncement[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@PRONOUNCEMENTS@TITLE Pronouncements
DIPLOMACY@PRONOUNCEMENTS@TOOLTIP Opens the pronouncement sub-options. These enable you to make statements or declarations which will affect your relationship with the opposing Ruler.
DIPLOMACY@PVE_NEGOTIATION_PHASE@DESCRIPTION During the negotiation phase all <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}>> may [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]negotiate[/hyperlink] with a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} for higher {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} and better diplomatic states. Once an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} has secured enough {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} for a {GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageConcept.Hyperlink}, this [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CompetitorConcept]competition[/hyperlink] ends and the \"winning\" {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} enters the {GLOBAL.VassalagePhaseConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]These are the <<m: {GLOBAL.PvEDiplStateConcept.Hyperlink}>> of the Negotiation Phase:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.IndependentCityNeutralConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PactOfCooperationConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PactOfLoyaltyConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageConcept.Hyperlink}[/bulletlist]
DIPLOMACY@PVE_NEGOTIATION_PHASE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationPhaseConcept]Negotiation Phase[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@PVE_NEGOTIATION_PHASE@TITLE Negotiation Phase of Free Cities
DIPLOMACY@PVE_VASSALAGE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PvEVassalConcept]Vassal[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@PVE_VASSALAGE@TITLE City Vassalage
DIPLOMACY@PVE_VASSALAGE_PHASE@DESCRIPTION During the vassalage phase, only the overlord {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} may [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]negotiate[/hyperlink] with a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}. Other <<m: {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}>> can only declare {GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept.Hyperlink} on the {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} by declaring war on the Free City overlord.[br/][br/]These are the <<m: {GLOBAL.PvEDiplStateConcept.Hyperlink}>> of the Vassalage Phase:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageLvl-3Concept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageLvl-2Concept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageLvl-1Concept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageLvl0Concept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageLvl1Concept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageLvl2Concept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageLvl3Concept.Hyperlink}[/bulletlist][br/][br/]Once {GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageLvl2Concept.Hyperlink} is reached, the {GLOBAL.PactOfIntegrationConcept.Hyperlink} becomes available, allowing an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} to fully absorb the {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}.
DIPLOMACY@PVE_VASSALAGE_PHASE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.VassalagePhaseConcept]Vassalage Phase[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@PVE_VASSALAGE_PHASE@TITLE Vassalage Phase of Free Cities
DIPLOMACY@PVE_VASSLAGE@DESCRIPTION Free Cities can be vassalized by Rulers through [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]Negotiations[/hyperlink] or by converting an owned or conquered {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} into a vassal city. Vassal cities will aid Rulers in any <<m:{GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}>> they are fighting and will supply them with income. Vassal cities may eventually also be [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PactOfIntegrationConcept]integrated[/hyperlink] into the Ruler's empire.
DIPLOMACY@RELATION_NAME@FRIENDLY Friendly
DIPLOMACY@RELATION_NAME@HOSTILE Hostile
DIPLOMACY@RELATION_NAME@INDIFFERENCE Indifferent
DIPLOMACY@RELATION_NAME@RESPECTFUL Respectful
DIPLOMACY@RELATION_NAME@SUSPICIOUS Suspicious
DIPLOMACY@RELATION_NAME@TRUSTING Trusting
DIPLOMACY@RELATION_NAME@WARY Cautious
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@CANNOTHAVE Cannot have
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@CASUSBELLI Number of Grievance Points
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@CASUSBELLI_TRADEABLE Number of tradeable Grievance Points
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@CITIES Cities belonging to {Name}
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@DISTANCE Distance
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@DISTANCE_SECTORS Distance between closest Provinces
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@EITHERHAS Either must have
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@EMPIRESIZE Provinces Owned by {Name}
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@LEADERINTHEVOID Ruler is in the Void
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@LEADERINTHEVOID_INV Ruler is NOT in the Void
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@LIVINGRULERS Number of living Rulers
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@MILITARYSTRENGTH Military Strength
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@MILITARYSTRENGTH_REL Relative Military Strength
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@MUSTHAVE Must have
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@MUSTNOTHAVE Must NOT have
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@MUSTNOTSHARE Must NOT share
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@MUSTSHARE Must share
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@NEITHERHAS Neither can have
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@NOTDURINGVICTORY {Player.Lord.FirstName} will not consider this trade while either of you is about to achieve a Victory Condition.
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@ORBETTER or better
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@ORLOWER or lower
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@REQUIREALL Requires all
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@REQUIREONE Requires one
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@REQUIRES Requires
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@RULERS Number of Rulers
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@RULERSMET Percentage of Rulers met
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@RULERSRECENTLYMET Rulers recently met
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TELEPORTERS Teleporters owned by {Name}
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TELEPORTERS_COMBINED Combined owned teleporters
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@THEYMUSTHAVE They must have
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@THEYMUSTNOTHAVE They must NOT have
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TOOLOW_RELATION {Player.Lord.FirstName} does not like you enough to consider this. Gain at least {MinRelation} {GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept.Hyperlink}
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TOOSOON_BROKENTREATY {Player.Lord.FirstName} will not consider this, because a {GLOBAL.TreatyConcept.Hyperlink} was recently broken. Try in {Difference} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TOOSOON_DIPLOMATICSTATE It is too soon for {Player.Lord.FirstName} to consider this. Try in {Difference} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TOO_FEW_PLAYERS {Player.Lord.FirstName} will not consider, this because there are too few <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> alive.
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TOO_MANY_ALLIANCES {Player.Lord.FirstName} will not consider this because there are too many Alliances.
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TOO_MANY_CITIES_TO_SURRENDER {Player.Lord.FirstName} will not consider this, because they have many <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/]Occupying their cities or [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SiegeConcept]Sieging[/hyperlink] their {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink} may convince them otherwise.
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TOO_STRONG_TO_SURRENDER {Player.Lord.FirstName} will not consider this, because they are too strong to surrender.[br/]Defeating their <<m:{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}>> or [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SiegeConcept]Sieging[/hyperlink] their {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink} may convince them otherwise.
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TURN Current {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}:
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TURNSDIPLOMATICSTATECHANGE <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> since Last Diplomatic State Change:
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TURNSLASTBROKENTREATY <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> since a treaty was broken:
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TURNSLASTPRONOUNCEMENT <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> since Last Pronouncement:
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TURNSLASTSECTORTRADE <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> since Last {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink} Trade:
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TURNSLASTWAR <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> since Last {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}:
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TURNSMEET <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> since met:
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TURNSSINCETREATYSTART <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> since treaty started:
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@TURNSTREATYCHANGE <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> since last {GLOBAL.TreatyConcept.Hyperlink} change:
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@VASSAL_EITHER Either Ruler is a Vassal
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@VASSAL_EITHER_INV Neither Ruler is a Vassal
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@VASSAL_OTHER Opponent is a Vassal
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@VASSAL_OTHER_INV Opponent is NOT a Vassal
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@VASSAL_SELF Is a Vassal
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@VASSAL_SELF_INV Is NOT a Vassal
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@VICTORYCONDITION_ANY Any Ruler is about to achieve a Victory Condition
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@VICTORYCONDITION_ANY_INV No Ruler is about to achieve a Victory Condition
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@VICTORYCONDITION_EITHER Either Ruler is about to achieve a Victory Condition
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@VICTORYCONDITION_EITHER_INV Neither Ruler is about to achieve a Victory Condition
DIPLOMACY@REQUIREMENT@WARDURATION {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} Duration
DIPLOMACY@SECTORCLAIMIGNORED@DESCRIPTION {HouseBLord.Name} has captured one of your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ClaimConcept]claimed[/hyperlink] <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>. Because of your claims, you now have a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} ({CasusBelliPoints}[casusBelli/] points) against {HouseBLord.Name}.
DIPLOMACY@SECTORCLAIMIGNORED@TITLE Your claimed province has been captured
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@BREAK_DIPLOMATIC_TREATY_DESCRIPTION The following treaties will be broken:
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@BREAK_TREATY Break Treaty
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@BREAK_TREATY_DESCRIPTION Break the treaty and any other treaties made in the same deal:
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@BREAK_TREATY_WARNING [fireCol]Breaking treaties will give the opposing Ruler a {CasusBelliValue}{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} against you and is considered an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act.[/fireCol]
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@EQUIPMENT_DESCRIPTION The equipment will be transferred to the arsenal of the other {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}.
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@GIFT_OPTION_TOOLTIP Send a gift to the opposing Ruler to improve your relations with them.
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@HISTORY_UNAVAILABLE Trade details unavailable. This trade happened too long ago and its records have been lost.
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@INTERESTEDIN Interested in
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@RELEASE_HERO_CRYPT_DESCRIPTION Transfer the remains of {HeroData.Name} from the Crypt of {Captor.Name} to the Crypt of {Owner.Name}. {HeroData.FirstName} can then be resurrected by {Owner.Lord.FirstName}.[br/][br/]Returning the remains as a gift will yield a {Relation}[goodRelation/] Relations Bonus.[br/]{Captor.Lord.FirstName} will keep all of {HeroData.FirstName}'s equipment.
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@RELEASE_HERO_DESCRIPTION Return {HeroData.Name} from the Prison of {Captor.Name} back to {Owner.Name}. {HeroData.FirstName} will return at the Throne City of {Owner.Lord.FirstName}.[br/][br/]Returning {HeroData.Name} as a gift will yield a {Relation}[goodRelation/] Relations Bonus.[br/]{Captor.Lord.FirstName} will keep all of {HeroData.FirstName}'s equipment.
DIPLOMACY@TRADE@VALUE Trade Value
DIPLOMACY@TREATY@ALLOWCLAIMEDSECTORS Good Neighbors Pact
DIPLOMACY@TREATY@DESCRIPTION An agreement between two <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}>> where resources may be exchanged or diplomatic permissions are granted.[br/][br/]A {GLOBAL.MutualConsulateConcept.Hyperlink} needs to be established for more advanced Treaties and to achieve an {GLOBAL.DSAllianceConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Treaties last indefinitely but may be broken manually or through declaring {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}. Breaking treaties is considered an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act and will give the opposing {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}.
DIPLOMACY@TREATY@NAME Treaty
DIPLOMACY@TREATY@OPENBORDERS Opened Borders
DIPLOMACY@TREATY@SHAREVISION Shares Vision
DIPLOMACY@TREATY@TREATIES_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TreatyConcept]Treaties[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@TREATY@TREATY_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TreatyConcept]Treaty[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@TREATY@TRUCE Truce
DIPLOMACY@TREATY@TRUCE_DESCRIPTION Both <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> vow not to attack each other while the truce lasts. {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} may still be declared, but counts as an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act.
DIPLOMACY@TREATY@TRUCE_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TruceConcept]Truce[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@TRESPASSING@DESCRIPTION Armies are considered to be trespassing when they are seen moving through the <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>> of another {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} or {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} without having an [hyperlink,GLOBAL.OpenBordersConcept]open borders agreement[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Trespassing will give other Rulers a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} and damages the relation with free cities.
DIPLOMACY@TRESPASSING@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TrespassingConcept]Trespassing[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMACY@TRESPASSING@TITLE Trespassing
DIPLOMACY@WAREFFECT@TITLE Declaring war now means
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@ACCEPTEDCALLTOWAR@TITLE {STR_leaderName} became an enemy through a call to war
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@ANTIWARMONGER@TITLE {STR_leaderName} is evil and should be eradicated
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@ATTACKEDALLIEDFACTION@TITLE {STR_leaderName} attacked our allied factions
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@ATTACKEDTRESPASSER@TITLE {STR_leaderName} attacked a non-hostile army

DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@BROKETREATY@TITLE {STR_leaderName} broke a {GLOBAL.TreatyConcept.Hyperlink}
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@BUILTNEARBYFORWARDBASE@TITLE {STR_leaderName} built a nearby {GLOBAL.OutpostConcept.Hyperlink}
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@CAPTUREDHOUSE@TITLE {STR_leaderName} has captured our friendly {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@CAPTUREDNEARBYLANDMARK@TITLE {STR_leaderName} captured a nearby Ancient Wonder
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@CONVERTEDROOTNODE@TITLE {STR_leaderName} has a {GLOBAL.AffinityProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@DECLAREDUNJUSTIFIEDWAR@TITLE {STR_leaderName} started an unjustified war
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@DECLAREDWARONALLIEDFACTION@TITLE {STR_leaderName} started a war with our vassalized {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}

DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@DECLINEDTRADE@TITLE {STR_leaderName} declined our trade
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@DEFEATEDALLIEDPLAYER@TITLE {STR_leaderName} defeated our ally
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@EXPANSION_01@TITLE {STR_leaderName} is trying to take over the world
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@EXPANSION_02@TITLE {STR_leaderName} is trying to take over the world
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@EXPANSION_03@TITLE {STR_leaderName} is taking over the world

DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@FABRICATED_02@TITLE {STR_leaderName} is rumored to have committed serious atrocities
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@FABRICATED_03@TITLE {STR_leaderName} is committing crimes against other Rulers and threatening our empire

DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@GATHERINGMAGICMATERIALS@TITLE {STR_leaderName} is gathering many Magic Materials
DIPLOMACY_CASUS_BELLI@INSULT@TITLE {STR_leaderName} has insulted my empire

DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_FEW_ALLIANCES_SELF They are in need of an ally
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_FEW_CONSULATES_OTHER You are in need of a friend
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_FEW_CONSULATES_SELF They are in need of better relations
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_MANY_ALLIANCES_OTHER You are supported by allies
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_MANY_ALLIANCES_SELF They are supported by allies
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_MANY_CONSULATES_OTHER You are supported by wizard bonds.
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_MANY_CONSULATES_SELF They already have enough friends
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_MANY_HOUSE_WARS_OTHER You are fighting [minorcity/] Free Cities
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_MANY_HOUSE_WARS_SELF They are fighting [minorcity/] Free Cities
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_MANY_VASSALS_OTHER You are supported by many vassals
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_MANY_WARS_OTHER You are involved in wars
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@TOO_MANY_WARS_SELF They are fighting too many wars
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@VICTORY_COUNTDOWN You are the verge of achieving victory
DIPLOMACY_MODIFIERS@PRESSURE@WAR_JUSTIFICATION You have ample {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Hyperlink} and could fight them

DIPLOMACY_PERSONALITY@DISLIKE@DESCRIPTION Dislikes are part of how an AI Ruler perceives other Rulers and determines which Actions or statuses of another Ruler they will dislike. Relations with Rulers that trigger these dislikes will incur a relation penalty.

DIPLOMACY_PERSONALITY@DISLIKE@NAME Dislike
DIPLOMACY_PERSONALITY@PREFERENCE@DESCRIPTION Preferences are part of how an AI Ruler perceives other Rulers and determine which Actions or statuses they like or dislike other Rulers to pursue.[br/][br/]Relations with Rulers that conform to these preferences will receive a relation bonus, while Relations with Rulers that trigger Dislikes will incur a relation penalty.
