DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@ALLOWCLAIMEDSECTORS@AI_DESC Let's fortify our positions. Allowing me to build near your borders will make the both of us stronger.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@ALLOWCLAIMEDSECTORS@DESCRIPTION Both <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> are allowed to build on each other's [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ClaimConcept]claimed[/hyperlink] <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>> without triggering <<m:{GLOBAL.CasualtyConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@ALLOWCLAIMEDSECTORS@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AllowClaimedSectorsConcept]Province-Claiming Pact[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@ALLOWCLAIMEDSECTORS@NAME Province-Claiming Pact
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@ALLOWCLAIMEDSECTORSFORTURNS@DESCRIPTION Both Rulers are allowed to build on each other's claimed provinces for a fixed duration.[br/][br/]Effects:[bulletList][bullet/]{RelationValue}[goodRelation/] Relations[bullet/]Rulers can capture and build on claimed provinces without incurring a penalty.[/bulletList]
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_ALLIANCE@AI_DESC This alliance no longer seems favorable to me. This is where we part ways.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_ALLIANCE@DESCRIPTION Break your alliance and revert back to a peace state.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_ALLIANCE@NAME Break Alliance
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_ALLOWCLAIMEDSECTORS@DESCRIPTION Neither Ruler is allowed to build on each other's claimed provinces.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_ALLOWCLAIMEDSECTORS@NAME Break Province-Claiming Pact
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_CONSULATE@DESCRIPTION The wizard's bond as well as any treaties and states that depend on it will be broken.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_CONSULATE@NAME Break Wizard's Bond
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_DEFENSIVEPACT@DESCRIPTION The defensive pact is broken. Rulers will no longer automatically be called into defensive wars and no longer aid each other in battle against common enemies.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_DEFENSIVEPACT@NAME Break Defensive Pact
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_OPENBORDERS@DESCRIPTION Neither Ruler will be allowed to move their armies through each other's domain.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_OPENBORDERS@NAME Close Borders
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_SHAREVISION@DESCRIPTION Vision sharing between the two Rulers will end.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_SHAREVISION@NAME Break Share Vision
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_TELEPORTERPACT@DESCRIPTION Neither Ruler will be allowed to use the teleporters of the other.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_TELEPORTERPACT@NAME Break Teleporter Pact
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_VASSALAGE@DESCRIPTION End the vassalage. This releases the vassal but maintains the alliance without incurring any penalties.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@BREAK_VASSALAGE@NAME End Vassalage
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@CONSULATE@AI_DESC A wizard's bond will improve our relations and expand our diplomatic options.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@CONSULATE@DESCRIPTION Both <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> agree to a wizard's bond to improve {GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept.Hyperlink} and access new <<m:{GLOBAL.TreatyConcept.Hyperlink}>> and Diplomatic States.[br/][br/]Effects:[bulletList][bullet/]The {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink} of each Ruler will be revealed.[bullet/]Rulers can [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CallToWarConcept]call each other to war[/hyperlink].[/bulletList][br/][br/]Leads to:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.DefensivePactConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.OpenBordersConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.AllowClaimedSectorsConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.TeleporterPactConcept.Hyperlink}[/bulletlist]
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@CONSULATE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.MutualConsulateConcept]Wizard's Bond[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@CONSULATE@NAME Wizard's Bond
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@DEFENSIVEPACT@AI_DESC A defensive pact will ensure no other Ruler dares defy us.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@DEFENSIVEPACT@DESCRIPTION A Diplomatic State in which the <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> vow to come to each other's aid in defensive wars.[br/][br/]When war is declared on either Ruler, they will automatically send a {GLOBAL.CallToWarConcept.Hyperlink} to the other, asking them to aid them in the war. Answering this call to war will give the Ruler additional <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>> to use directly. Rulers may still refuse to accept this call but will break the defensive pact if they do.[br/][br/]Leads to:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.DSAllianceConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.ShareVisionConcept.Hyperlink}[/bulletlist]
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@DEFENSIVEPACT@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DefensivePactConcept]Defensive Pact[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@DEFENSIVEPACT@NAME Defensive Pact
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPENBORDERS@AI_DESC Let us open our borders to each other. This would greatly improve our mobility.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPENBORDERS@DESCRIPTION Both <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept}>> open their borders to each other. This allows <<m:{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}>> to move through <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>> of the opposing Ruler without [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TrespassingConcept]trespassing[/hyperlink].
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPENBORDERS@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.OpenBordersConcept]Open Borders[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPENBORDERS@NAME Open Borders
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPENBORDERSFORTURNS@DESCRIPTION Both Rulers open their borders to each other for a fixed duration.[br/][br/]Effects:[bulletList][bullet/]{RelationValue}[goodRelation/] Relations.[bullet/]Rulers may move their armies freely through each other's domain.[/bulletList]
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_ALLIANCE@AI_DESC I propose we forge an alliance so that we may come to each other's aid in times of war.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_ALLIANCE@DESCRIPTION Propose an alliance with the other Ruler. These are the strongest possible relations one can have. Both Rulers need to agree to a {GLOBAL.DefensivePactConcept.Hyperlink} first.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_ALLIANCE@NAME Propose Alliance
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_NEUTRAL@AI_DESC Let us forget about the past and move into a new future!
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_NEUTRAL@DESCRIPTION Both Rulers agree to end the war and declare a truce, where they promise to cease all hostile action.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_NEUTRAL@NAME Make Peace
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_OVERLORD@AI_DESC Surrender to me and survive as my loyal vassal. Together, the world will be ours.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_OVERLORD@DESCRIPTION Become overlord over the other Ruler. {LOC.DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_VASSALAGE@DESCRIPTION_GENERIC}
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_OVERLORD@NAME You become overlord
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_VASSALAGE@AI_DESC I surrender my empire to you. Let us forge an alliance and work together with me as your vassal.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_VASSALAGE@DESCRIPTION Become a vassal of the other Ruler. {LOC.DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_VASSALAGE@DESCRIPTION_GENERIC}
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_VASSALAGE@DESCRIPTION_GENERIC This effectively creates a fixed alliance with the other Ruler which only the overlord can break. The deal only works if neither Ruler is already a vassal. The overlord will gain additional resources per turn based on the income of their vassal.[br/][br/]The vassal will automatically be drawn into any wars their overlord is fighting and will end any wars the overlord is not involved in.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_VASSALAGE@NAME You become a vassal
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR@AI_DESC This relationship is over. I'll be coming for you!
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR@DESCRIPTION Declare war on the other Ruler. This will change your diplomatic state to war and you suffer alignment and relation penalties with other Rulers and cities.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR@NAME Declare war without justification
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_CB@NAME Declare justified war
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_DISABLED@DESCRIPTION You cannot declare war on the other Ruler while either of you is the vassal of another Ruler. Overlords can enter into wars and their vassals will join them.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_MAJOR_CB@AI_DESC Your actions cannot be forgiven. I will have my revenge!
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_MAJOR_CB@DESCRIPTION Declare war on the other Ruler with major {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Hyperlink}. Your diplomatic state will change to war and other Rulers and vassal cities will support you.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_MAJOR_CB@NAME Declare war with major {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Hyperlink} (51+ [CasusBelli/])
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_MINOR_CB@AI_DESC You have wronged me too many times. You are next on my list!
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_MINOR_CB@DESCRIPTION Declare war on the other Ruler with minor {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Hyperlink}.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_MINOR_CB@NAME Declare war with minor {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Hyperlink} (1-25[CasusBelli/])
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_NORMAL_CB@AI_DESC You didn't think I would simply forget, did you?
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_NORMAL_CB@DESCRIPTION Declare war on the other Ruler with moderate {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Hyperlink}. Your diplomatic state will change to war and your relations may suffer.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@OPTION_WAR_NORMAL_CB@NAME Declare war with moderate {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Hyperlink} (26-50[CasusBelli/])
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@SHAREINTELLIGENCE@AI_DESC Sharing our intel will provide us with mutual protection!
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@SHAREINTELLIGENCE@DESCRIPTION The Rulers form a mutual intelligence sharing pact.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@SHAREINTELLIGENCE@NAME Research Pact
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@SHAREINTELLIGENCEFORTURNS@DESCRIPTION The Rulers form a mutual intelligence sharing pact for a fixed duration.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@SHAREINTELLIGENCEFORTURNS@NAME Intelligence Sharing Pact
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@SHAREVISION@AI_DESC Let us share our vision so we can better assist each other!
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@SHAREVISION@DESCRIPTION Both <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> share their [hyperlink,GLOBAL.VisionRangeConcept]Vision[/hyperlink] with each other and will reveal explored areas to each other.
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@SHAREVISION@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ShareVisionConcept]Share Vision[/hyperlink]
DIPLOMATICSTATES_DEFINITIONS@SHAREVISION@NAME Share Vision

EVENTS_MODIFIERS@ALLUNITS_EVENTHOUSE_MORALE_DECREASE@MINOR All units controlled by {EventHouse} receive Decreased {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink} (Minor).
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@ALLUNITS_MORALE_DECREASE@MAJOR All units controlled by you gain Decreased {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink} (Major).
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@ALLUNITS_MORALE_DECREASE@MINOR All units controlled by you receive Decreased {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink} (Minor).
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@ALLUNITS_MORALE_INCREASE@MAJOR All units controlled by you gain Increased {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink} (Major).
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@ALLUNITS_MORALE_INCREASE@MINOR All units controlled by you gain Increased {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink} (Minor).
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@ALLUNITS_OTHER_MORALE_DECREASE@MAJOR All units controlled by {Lord} receive Decreased {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink} (Major).
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@MORALE_DECREASE@MAJOR Lowered Morale (Major)
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@MORALE_DECREASE@MINOR Lowered Morale (Minor)
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@MORALE_INCREASE@MAJOR Increased Morale (Major)
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@MORALE_INCREASE@MINOR Increased Morale (Minor)
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@STACK_EXP_GAIN@LEVEL The army gains enough [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ExperienceConcept]experience[/hyperlink] for all units within it to rank up.
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@STACK_MORALE_DECREASE@MAJOR All units in the current army receive Decreased {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink} (Major).
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@STACK_MORALE_DECREASE@MINOR All units in the current army receive Decreased {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink} (Minor).
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@STACK_MORALE_INCREASE@MAJOR All units in the current army gain Increased {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink} (Major).
EVENTS_MODIFIERS@STACK_MORALE_INCREASE@MINOR All units in the current army gain Increased Morale (Minor).

EXPANSION_VICTORY@EVENT_BEACONS_UNLOCKED@PLAYER {Player.Name} has control over enough of the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink} to unlock the {GLOBAL.STRUCTURE_UPGRADES.BEACONOFUNITY.Hyperlink} improvement! They are on their way to achieving the {VictoryConditionName}!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@EVENT_BEACONS_UNLOCKED@YOU You have control over enough of the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink} to unlock the {GLOBAL.STRUCTURE_UPGRADES.BEACONOFUNITY.Hyperlink} improvement! Building these <<m:{GLOBAL.SpecialImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> will put you on the path to achieving the {VictoryConditionName}!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@EVENT_BEACON_BUILT@PLAYER {Player.Name} has built a {GLOBAL.STRUCTURE_UPGRADES.BEACONOFUNITY.Hyperlink} and is working towards the {VictoryConditionName}!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@EVENT_BEACON_BUILT@YOU You have built a {GLOBAL.STRUCTURE_UPGRADES.BEACONOFUNITY.Hyperlink} and are progressing towards the {VictoryConditionName}!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@EVENT_FINAL_STAGE_ENTER@PLAYER {Player.Name} has lit the Beacons of Unity and is on their way to win the game through {VictoryConditionName}![br/][br/]The {VictoryConditionName} can be canceled by occupying one of the three provinces containing a {GLOBAL.STRUCTURE_UPGRADES.BEACONOFUNITY.Hyperlink}.
EXPANSION_VICTORY@EVENT_FINAL_STAGE_ENTER@YOU You have lit the Beacons of Unity and are approaching the {VictoryConditionName}![br/][br/]Maintain control over all three Beacons of Unity for long enough to achieve victory!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@EVENT_FINAL_STAGE_LEAVE@PLAYER {Player.Name}'s Beacons of Unity have been extinguished, and their attempt to achieve the {VictoryConditionName} has been thwarted!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@EVENT_FINAL_STAGE_LEAVE@YOU Your Beacons of Unity have been extinguished, and the victory timer for the {VictoryConditionName} has been canceled!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_ATTACKERS_SPAWNED@YOU Partisans are attacking
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_BEACONS_UNLOCKED@PLAYER {Player.Name} has unlocked the Beacons of Unity
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_BEACONS_UNLOCKED@YOU You have unlocked the Beacons of Unity
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_BEACON_BUILT@PLAYER {Player.Name} has built a Beacon of Unity!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_BEACON_BUILT@YOU You have built a Beacon of Unity!

EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_BEACON_LOST@YOU Beacon of Unity Lost
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_BEACON_OCCUPIED@YOU Beacon of Unity Occupied
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_FINAL_STAGE_ENTER@PLAYER {Player.Name} has lit the Beacons of Unity!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_FINAL_STAGE_ENTER@YOU You have lit the Beacons of Unity!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_FINAL_STAGE_LEAVE@PLAYER {Player.Name}'s Beacons of Unity have been extinguished!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_FINAL_STAGE_LEAVE@YOU Your Beacons of Unity have been extinguished!
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_VICTORY_IMMINENT@PLAYER {Player.Name} will achieve Expansion Victory in 5 turns
EXPANSION_VICTORY@NOTIFY_VICTORY_IMMINENT@YOU Expansion Victory in 5 turns
EXPANSION_VICTORY@OBJECTIVE@AWAIT_COUNTDOWN Defend the Beacons of Unity: {INT_Count} / {INT_Total} [turn/]
EXPANSION_VICTORY@OBJECTIVE@BUILD Build the Beacons of Unity: {INT_Count} / {INT_Total}
EXPANSION_VICTORY@OBJECTIVE@LOSING Destroy {STR_WinningPlayer}'s Beacons of Unity {INT_Turns} [turn/]
EXPANSION_VICTORY@OBJECTIVE@OCCUPY Occupy provinces: {INT_Count} / {INT_Total}
EXPANSION_VICTORY@OBJECTIVE@REGAIN_CONTROL Regain control of the Beacons of Unity
EXPANSION_VICTORY@OBJECTIVE@START_OPERATION Light the Beacons of Unity
EXPANSION_VICTORY@OPERATION@ALREADY_ACTIVE The Beacons of Unity are already lit.
EXPANSION_VICTORY@OPERATION@ALREADY_ACTIVE_OTHER Another player has lit their Beacons of Unity.
EXPANSION_VICTORY@OPERATION@BUILD_BEACONS To light the Beacons of Unity, you first need to build all three beacons.
EXPANSION_VICTORY@OPERATION@OCCUPY_SECTORS You must occupy more provinces before you can light the Beacons of Unity.
EXPANSION_VICTORY@RESULT@DEFEAT {OtherPlayer.Name} achieved Expansion Victory
EXPANSION_VICTORY@RESULT@VICTORY Expansion
EXPANSION_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@DESCRIPTION When an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} grows large enough, either by itself {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink} or by [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageConcept]Vassalizing[/hyperlink] <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>>, it can strive for the expansion victory. To do so, it will need to build three <<m:{GLOBAL.STRUCTURE_UPGRADES.BEACONOFUNITY.Hyperlink}>> and light them. If the empire and its [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DSAllianceConcept]Allies[/hyperlink] can defend and hold onto their beacons for long enough, they will be victorious.
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_ANCIENT_TREE@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]{manabonus} {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink} and {knowledgebonus} {GLOBAL.KnowledgeConcept.Hyperlink} per {GLOBAL.ForesterConcept.Hyperlink} in {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Adds {GLOBAL.UNITS.ENTWINED_THRALL_UNIT.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.UNITS.ENTWINED_PROTECTOR_UNIT.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.UNITS.ENTWINED_SCOURGE_UNIT.Hyperlink} to the Rally of Lieges.[/bulletlist][br/]This Structure can only be entered and fought in by 1 {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} led by a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}!
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_ANCIENT_TREE@LORE [lorefontsize][lorefont]Scripture describes how the First Elves visited all [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]Worlds[/hyperlink] to seed them with life. This magnificent tree stands as a testament to that age. It is said the souls of these First Ones still reside within it, sometimes manifesting themselves as the Entwined, eternally bound to protect its growth.[lorefontsize/][lorefont/]
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_ANCIENT_TREE@NAME World Tree
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_ANCIENT_WELLSPRING@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]{stabilitybonus} {GLOBAL.CityStabilityConcept.Hyperlink} per {GLOBAL.FisheryConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.FarmConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.ForesterConcept.Hyperlink} in {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Friendly <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> in {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink} are healed for {healamount} <<m:{GLOBAL.HitPointConcept.Hyperlink}>> at the end of each strategic {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Adds {GLOBAL.UNITS.SPRING_FAIRY.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.UNITS.SUMMER_FAIRY.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.UNITS.AUTUMN_FAIRY.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.UNITS.WINTER_FAIRY.Hyperlink} to the Rally of the Lieges.[/bulletlist][br/]This Structure can only be entered and fought in by 1 {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} led by a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}!
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_ANCIENT_WELLSPRING@LORE [lorefontsize][lorefont]This lush location is fed by a magical wellspring that flows directly from the fey realm. Mystical waters attract all manner of creatures, unaware that they are potential victims to tricks of the fairy folk. Though what a fairy considers mischief, can be potentially deadly to others! Even the most powerful beings should proceed with a measure of caution.[lorefontsize/][lorefont/]
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_ANCIENT_WELLSPRING@NAME Hidden Wellspring

EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_ARCHON_RUINS@LORE [lorefontsize][lorefont]The ruins of a massive stronghold dating back to an age when the first civilizations made a stand against rampant, gargantuan monsters and magical storms. Although battered, its weathered walls still offer a degree of protection to those within as well as those nearby during times of strife.[lorefontsize/][lorefont/]

EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_CRYSTAL_FOREST@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]{manabonus} {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink} per {GLOBAL.ConduitConcept.Hyperlink} in {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Adds the {GLOBAL.UNITS.ASTRAL_KEEPER_UNIT.Hyperlink} unit to the Rally of Lieges.[/bulletlist][br/]This Structure can only be entered and fought in by 1 {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} led by a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}!
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_CRYSTAL_FOREST@LORE Powerful [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralFlowsLoreConcept]Astral Currents[/hyperlink] converge at this location. Rather than forming an ordinary Mana Node, these energies have crystallized into a forest of shimmering trees. Intricate branches and deep, meandering root systems suggest an interconnectedness to much in the universe; <<c: {GLOBAL.SoulsLoreConcept.Hyperlink}>>, [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]Worlds[/hyperlink], even ages. Time and space have no meaning here.
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_CRYSTAL_FOREST@NAME Crystal Forest
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_ENCHANTED_CAVE@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]+{amount} {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink} per {GLOBAL.QuarryConcept.Hyperlink} in {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Adds the {GLOBAL.UNITS.STORMSCALE_SERPENT.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.UNITS.PLAGUE_SERPENT.Hyperlink} units to the Rally of Lieges.[/bulletlist][br/]This Structure can only be entered and fought in by 1 {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} led by a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}!
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_ENCHANTED_CAVE@LORE [lorefontsize][lorefont]An ancient cavern that heralds from the time of this world's creation, during an era when Dragons and Giants molded the very lands into physical form. Within these natural sanctuaries, the first creatures found shelter as the world outside violently settled into place. To this day, the cave itself remains a sanctuary for those that are able to find their way to it.[lorefontsize/][lorefont/]
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_ENCHANTED_CAVE@NAME Ancient Cave
EXPLORATIONSITES_STRATEGIC@STRUCTURE_FORBIDDEN_CRYPT@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]{manaincome} {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink}, {knowledgeincome} {GLOBAL.KnowledgeConcept.Hyperlink}, and {soulsincome} {GLOBAL.SoulConcept.Hyperlink} (if obtainable) for each {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink} in {GLOBAL.CryptConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Adds the {GLOBAL.UNITS.CORRUPT_SOUL.Hyperlink} unit to the Rally of Lieges.[/bulletlist][br/]This Structure can only be entered and fought in by 1 {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} led by a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}!

They have decided to look for a new {GLOBAL.KeeperConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]You are no longer the {GLOBAL.KeeperConcept.Hyperlink} of the {Race}.

FORM_TRAITS@01@DESCRIPTION {HitPen} harder to hit by ranged attacks.
FORM_TRAITS@01@LORE [helpcolor]Useful for approaching enemy ranged units.[/helpcolor]

FORM_TRAITS@02@LORE [helpcolor]Your units can take a little more damage.[/helpcolor]

FORM_TRAITS@03@DESCRIPTION Gains {amount} {GLOBAL.StatusResistanceConcept}.
FORM_TRAITS@03@LORE [helpcolor]Units are less likely to be affected by negative status effects.[/helpcolor]

FRONTEND_TUTORIAL@CULTURESELECT@DESCRIPTION In this step, you will pick your people’s culture, which defines your starting units and economy.
FRONTEND_TUTORIAL@CULTURESELECT@SECDESCRIPTION The icons ( [order/] [chaos/] [matter/] [nature/] [arcana/] [shadow/] ) next to the Culture names are called {GLOBAL.AffinitiesLoreConcept}, reflecting your people's attunement to the 6 cosmic forces. Your Affinity score has a big impact on your playstyle and gives a good indication of rival faction’s capabilities.
FRONTEND_TUTORIAL@CULTURESELECT@TITLE Faction Creation: Culture
FRONTEND_TUTORIAL@FACTIONSELECT@DESCRIPTION Here, you have the unique ability to create your empire and the people living in it.
FRONTEND_TUTORIAL@FACTIONSELECT@SECDESCRIPTION Whether they are Deep Dwarves, Mystic Elves, or Barbarian Halflings… They all make excellent followers.[br/][br/]As your Empire grows, you acquire new Tomes of Magic, allowing you to evolve your people into the direction you want... be it angelic beings, undead or other transcendent forms. This Age of Wonders will be yours!
FRONTEND_TUTORIAL@FACTIONSELECT@TITLE Godir and Factions
FRONTEND_TUTORIAL@FORMSELECT@DESCRIPTION In the following steps, you will create your people, followed by your Ruler.
FRONTEND_TUTORIAL@FORMSELECT@SECDESCRIPTION For your first Faction, we suggest you focus on theme instead of the numbers; role-play your favorite trope or go crazy with experimentation![br/][br/]In this first step, pick your people’s physical form. Forms have default traits which you can swap out if you like.

INFESTATION@STATE@INVASION [infestationInvasion/] Invasion. A raiding party will emerge in {INT_TurnMIN} to {INT_TurnMAX} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INFESTATION@STATE@PATROLLING [infestationPatrolling/] Patrolling. The infestation will patrol its domain for the next {INT_TurnMAX}+ <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INFESTATION@STATE@RECOVERING [infestationRecovering/] Recovering. The infestation will reinforce its patrolling armies in {INT_TurnMIN} to {INT_TurnMAX} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INFESTATION@STATE@SLEEPING [infestationDormant/] Sleeping. The infestation will become active in {INT_TurnMIN} to {INT_TurnMAX} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.

INTERFACE@CITY@CITY_FREE_POPULATION_NO_CITY To pick up this population resource, you will need at least one city.

INTERFACE@CITY@FORTIFICATION_DAMAGE [siegehealthdamage/] Fortification Damage
INTERFACE@CITY@FORTIFICATION_DAMAGE_DESCRIPTION Fortification Damage represents the speed at which a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink} progresses to breach the defenses of a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}[br/][br/]Fortification Damage is subtracted from {GLOBAL.FortificationHealthConcept.Hyperlink} of the {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} during a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink} until it is reduced to 0.[br/][br/]Fortification Damage in a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink} comes from:[bulletlist][bullet/]A base value of {base}[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.SiegeProjectConcept.Hyperlink}>> the besieger is undertaking.[bullet/]Besieging <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> with {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.SIEGE_BREAKER.Hyperlink} that are adjacent to the {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@CITY@FORTIFICATION_DAMAGE_HYPERLINK [siegehealthdamage/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.FortificationDamageConcept]Fortification Damage[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@CITY@FORTIFICATION_HEALTH [garrison/] Fortification Health
INTERFACE@CITY@FORTIFICATION_HEALTH_DESCRIPTION [garrison/] Fortification Health represents how long the duration of a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink} will be on a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}. The greater the [garrison/] Fortification Health, the longer the {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink} will take.[br/][br/]During a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink}, the besieger will try and reduce the City's [garrison/] Fortification Health to 0 by dealing {GLOBAL.FortificationDamageConcept.Hyperlink}[br/][br/]<<m:{GLOBAL.CityDefenseStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>> are the primary source of [garrison/] Fortification Health.
INTERFACE@CITY@FORTIFICATION_HEALTH_HYPERLINK [garrison/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.FortificationHealthConcept]Fortification Health[/hyperlink]

INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_AGENDA_DESCRIPTION The {GLOBAL.HighConcept.Hyperlink} Culture has an {GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept.Hyperlink} Agenda, which grants bonuses for the following alignment levels:[bulletlist][bullet/][reputation8/] Pure Good: {citystabilitybonus} {GLOBAL.CityStabilityConcept.Hyperlink} in all <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/][reputation4/] Neutral: {foodbonus} {GLOBAL.FoodConcept.Hyperlink} and {productionbonus} {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink} per {GLOBAL.CityStabilityConcept.Hyperlink} level above Neutral in all <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/][reputation0/] Pure Evil: <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> start {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} in an{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.AWAKENED.Hyperlink} state.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_AGENDA_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentAgendaConcept]Alignment Agenda[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@ALIGNMENT_DESCRIPTION Determines how <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>> and other <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}>> see you. Affected by {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} traits and various actions.[br/][br/]Affects relations with <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}>> with Neutral or better Alignment. In addition a [reputation6/] Good Alignment (or better) will increase the chance for positive random events to occur, while an [reputation2/] Evil Alignment (or worse) will make negative random events more likely.[br/][br/]{GLOBAL.HighConcept.Hyperlink} Culture has an {GLOBAL.AlignmentAgendaConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]{GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept.Hyperlink} for each Alignment level: [bulletlist][bullet/]{PureGoodMinValue}: [reputation8/]Pure Good: {PureGoodRelationValue} [goodRelation/][bullet/]{VeryGoodMaxValue} to {VeryGoodMinValue}: [reputation7/]Very Good: {VeryGoodRelationValue} [goodRelation/][bullet/]{GoodMaxValue} to {GoodMinValue}: [reputation6/]Good: {GoodRelationValue} [goodRelation/][bullet/]{NeutralMaxValue} to {NeutralMinValue}: [reputation4/]Neutral: No effects[bullet/]{EvilMaxValue} to {EvilMinValue}: [reputation2/]Evil: {EvilRelationValue} [badRelation/][bullet/]{VeryEvilMaxValue} to {VeryEvilMinValue}: [reputation1/]Very Evil: {VeryEvilRelationValue} [badRelation/][bullet/]{PureEvilMinValue}: [reputation0/]Pure Evil: {PureEvilRelationValue} [badRelation/]

INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@EMPIRE_RELATION Empire Relations
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@EMPIRE_RELATION_DESCRIPTION Represents the degree to which two <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}>> are on good terms with one another.[br/][br/]Good Empire Relations are required to [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TradeConcept]negotiate[/hyperlink] a {GLOBAL.MutualConsulateConcept.Hyperlink} and <<m:{GLOBAL.TreatyConcept.Hyperlink}>>, eventually good relations can lead to an {GLOBAL.DSAllianceConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Bad Empire Relations increase the chance of {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} being declared.[br/][br/]Empire Relations can be improved by:[bulletlist][bullet/]High {GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.PronouncementsConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]Gifts[bullet/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.TradeConcept]Trades[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@EMPIRE_RELATION_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]Empire Relations[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@FORGED_ALLIANCE_WITH You forged an alliance
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@FREE_CITIES Free Cities
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@HOUSE [minorcity/] Free City
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_DESCRIPTION [minorcity/]Free Cities are <<m: {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> that do not belong to an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}. They have a {GLOBAL.FreeCityLordConcept.Hyperlink} with whom it is possible to [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]negotiate[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]With a higher {GLOBAL.PvEDiplStateConcept.Hyperlink}, a [minorcity/] Free City offers:[bulletlist][bullet/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityTradeConcept]Trading[/hyperlink][bullet/]<<m: {GLOBAL.RecruitmentPointsConcept.Hyperlink}>> for the {GLOBAL.RequestMilitaryAidConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Shared Income[/bulletlist][br/][br/]When an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} reaches the highest {GLOBAL.PvEDiplStateConcept.Hyperlink} with a [minorcity/] Free City, the city may become part of that empire through a {GLOBAL.PactOfIntegrationConcept.Hyperlink}. Alternatively {GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept.Hyperlink} may be declared to acquire the [minorcity/] Free City through conquest.
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_HYPERLINK [minorcity/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Free City[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_LORD Free City Lord
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_LORD@DESCRIPTION A Free City Lord or Lady is the designated ruler of a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}. They represent their {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Name} in all diplomatic interactions with an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} and fight for their city as <<m: {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}>> on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]When the Free City Lord dies (and their Free City has not been conquered or integrated) they will be replaced by their heir, who will become the new Free City Lord after {IntDuration} <<m: {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_LORD@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.FreeCityLordConcept]Free City Lord[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@HOUSE_WARS [rs_war/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept]Wars[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INACTIVE_CITIES Inactive Cities
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_DIPL_STATE Free City Diplomatic State
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_DIPL_STATE_DESCRIPTION The diplomatic state with a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} is the formal expression of their {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink}. A newly met {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} will be on [rs_neutral/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityNeutralConcept]neutral terms[/hyperlink] with an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} (in some cases [rs_war/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept]War[/hyperlink] is declared instantly). By sending their {GLOBAL.FreeCityLordConcept.Hyperlink} a {GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept.Hyperlink}, the {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} of the {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} with that {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} will improve over time.[br/][br/]Higher {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} leads to better diplomatic states with more valuable benefits. This [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]negotiation process[/hyperlink] is divided into the {GLOBAL.NegotiationPhaseConcept.Hyperlink} and the {GLOBAL.VassalagePhaseConcept.Hyperlink}, which eventually leads to the {GLOBAL.PactOfIntegrationConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_DIPL_STATE_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PvEDiplStateConcept]Diplomatic State[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_NEGOTIATE [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]Negotiate:[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_NEUTRAL Neutral diplomatic state with a Free City
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_NEUTRAL_HYPERLINK [rs_neutral/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityNeutralConcept]Neutral[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_RELATION Free City relations
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_RELATION_DESCRIPTION Relations with a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} represent their opinion of a Ruler. The relation value can affect the amount of {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} gained during <<m:{GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept.Hyperlink}>> and with very low relations the free city may also declare {GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept.Hyperlink} when on the {GLOBAL.IndependentCityNeutralConcept.Hyperlink} diplomatic state.
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_RELATION_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityRelationConcept]Relations[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_TIER [minorcity/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Free City[/hyperlink] Tier
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_TRADE Free City Trade
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_TRADE_DESCRIPTION <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>> will offer several trade options to <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> that share at least a {GLOBAL.PactOfCooperationConcept.Hyperlink} with the City.[br/][br/]Trade options consist of resource exchanges as well as any <<m:{GLOBAL.MagicMaterialConcept.Hyperlink}>> located in the domain of the city.
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_TRADE_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityTradeConcept]Trade[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_WAR War with a Free City
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_WAR_DESCRIPTION A state of [rs_war/] War with a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} means that <<m:{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}>> can engage in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} and <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> can be attacked.[br/][br/]During war, Free Cities will occasionally send armies to attack their enemies.[br/][br/]Wars end through defeat on either side or by negotiating peace.
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INDEPENDENT_CITY_WAR_HYPERLINK [rs_war/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept]War[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@INTEGRATED Integrated
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@IS_NEUTRAL_WITH War has ended
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@NEGOTIATIONS Negotiation
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@NEGOTIATIONS_COLLECTED_DESCRIPTION There are two different types of negotiations:[bulletlist][bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.TradeConcept.Hyperlink}>> between <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept.Hyperlink}>> between Rulers and <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@NEGOTIATIONS_COLLECTED_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationsCollectedConcept]Negotiation[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@NEGOTIATIONS_DESCRIPTION Negotiations increase the {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} of a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} leading to better <<m: {GLOBAL.PvEDiplStateConcept.Hyperlink}>> with an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Negotiations happen automatically when a {GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept.Hyperlink} is assigned or the city is [hyperlink,GLOBAL.VassalagePhaseConcept]vassalized[/hyperlink].

INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@TRADE_DESCRIPTION Negotiations allow Rulers to exchange strategic resources, locations and contact information among other things, but it also allows them to manage their [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]relations[/hyperlink] and establish new <<m:{GLOBAL.TreatyConcept.Hyperlink}>> and diplomatic states.
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@TRADE_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TradeConcept]Negotiation[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@TRESPASS_WARNING If your army is seen while [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TrespassingConcept]Trespassing[/hyperlink], your opponent will have a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} against you. Trespassing counts as an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act. While trespassing, your units can be attacked without {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} being declared on you.[br/]Are you sure you want to enter the domain of {STR_domainOwnerName}?
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@TRESPASS_WARNING_INDEPENDENT If your army is seen while [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TrespassingConcept]Trespassing[/hyperlink], you will incur a relations penalty and your units can be attacked without {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} being declared on you.[br/]Are you sure you want to enter the domain of {STR_domainOwnerName}?
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@WAR [rs_war/] War
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@WAR_DESCRIPTION A state of [rs_war/] War with an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} or {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} means their <<m:{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}>> can engage in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} and <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> can be attacked.[br/][br/]Wars end through defeat on either side or peacefully when:[bulletlist][bullet/]Two Empires [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TradeConcept]negotiate[/hyperlink] a {GLOBAL.TruceConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]By negotiating [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityNeutralConcept]Peace[/hyperlink] with a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Name}.[/bulletlist][br/][br/]Defeat occurs when one side loses its {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY@WAR_HYPERLINK [rs_war/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WarConcept]War[/hyperlink]

INTERFACE@DIPLOMACY_DECLARATION_UPKEEP_EVENT@DESCRIPTION Your declarations will be maintained for as long as there are enough stockpiled <<m:{GLOBAL.ResourceConcept.Hyperlink}>> to pay the upkeep. Once the resources run out, all declarations will expire![br/][br/]Declarations can be canceled to free up resources. Ending unjustified wars with other Rulers will also remove the negative effects of wars on resource income.

INTERFACE@EVENTS@AFFINITY_CHECK_CONCEPT@DESCRIPTION When the empire of a player has reached a high enough {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} score, this can unlock special character actions in story events. Within those actions the player Ruler or one of their heroes attempts to channel the respective {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} to perform a challenging action.[br/][br/]Each {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} check has a strength X, which determines how the option behaves:[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet/]The option is hidden as long as the empire {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} is lower than X.[bullet/]50% base chance to succeed when the empire {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} is exactly X.[bullet/]This chance increases by {IntAffinityStepChance} for every Empire {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} Point above X.[/bulletlist]

INTERFACE@EVENTS@BATTLE_QUEST@DESCRIPTION Battle Quests ask you to defeat an {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} of {GLOBAL.MarauderConcept.Hyperlink} <<m: {GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}. They may only be resolved through {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} and will fail when another non-ally {GLOBAL.PlayerConcept.Hyperlink} defeats the quest army.
INTERFACE@EVENTS@BATTLE_QUEST@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.BattleQuestConcept]Battle Quest[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@EVENTS@BATTLE_QUEST@TITLE Battle Quest
INTERFACE@EVENTS@BEFRIEND_CITY_QUEST@DESCRIPTION Befriend City Quests ask you to reach a higher diplomatic state with a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}. This can be achieved by giving that Free City a {GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept.Hyperlink} and improving their {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} with you over time. If the Free City becomes [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PvEVassalConcept]vassalized[/hyperlink] or conquered by another {GLOBAL.PlayerConcept.Hyperlink}, the quest will fail.
INTERFACE@EVENTS@BEFRIEND_CITY_QUEST@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.BefriendCityQuestConcept]Befriend City Quest[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@EVENTS@BEFRIEND_CITY_QUEST@TITLE Befriend City Quest
INTERFACE@EVENTS@BUILD_IMPROVEMENT_QUEST@DESCRIPTION Build Improvement Quests ask you to construct a number of <<m: {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> of a certain type. You can build a Province Improvement whenever one of your <<m: {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> grows new {GLOBAL.PopulationConcept.Hyperlink}. When you dismantle a Province Improvement of the matching type this will subtract progress from the quest.
INTERFACE@EVENTS@BUILD_IMPROVEMENT_QUEST@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.BuildImprovementQuestConcept]Build Improvement Quest[/hyperlink]

INTERFACE@EVENTS@CONQUER_CITY_QUEST@DESCRIPTION Conquer City quests ask you to conquer a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}. This requires you to [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept]declare war[/hyperlink] on that Free City and may involve a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink} if there are any <<m: {GLOBAL.CityDefenseStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>. If the Free City becomes conquered by another {GLOBAL.PlayerConcept.Hyperlink} (even an ally) the quest will fail.

Beware of the roaming <<m: {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}>> inside the Infestation's {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink}! If the Infestation is destroyed by another non-ally {GLOBAL.PlayerConcept.Hyperlink} the quest will fail.

When engaging the quest army there will be narrative choices that may alter {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} in your favor or even completely avoid it for a price.

This can be either achieved by [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceAnnexationConcept]annexing[/hyperlink] a {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink} with a Magic Material Node in its {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink} or by acquiring the Magic Material through a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityTradeConcept]trade[/hyperlink] with a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} or {GLOBAL.PlayerConcept.Hyperlink}.

INTERFACE@EXCAVATION@DISABLE The {GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink} is currently excavating a province of Earthen terrain.[br/][br/]Click to stop excavating.
INTERFACE@EXCAVATION@ENABLE Excavation allows any {GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink} to dig out an area of [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceFeatureConcept]Earthen[/hyperlink] terrain in a {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}. Excavation can open up new paths, uncover buried [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PickupConcept]Treasure[/hyperlink] or even discover hidden <<m:{GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]The unit must be adjacent to an excavatable {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink} in order to excavate that province.
INTERFACE@EXCAVATION@INSTRUCTIONS Target a province to excavate
INTERFACE@EXCAVATION@OUT_OF_REACH Province is out of reach
INTERFACE@EXCAVATION@PRESS_TO_EXCAVATE Select the pin to start
INTERFACE@EXCAVATION@UNABLE_TO_LAUNCH Province cannot be excavated
INTERFACE@EXPANSION_VICTORY@DESCRIPTION To achieve an Expansion Victory, an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} needs to control enough provinces to unlock the <<m:{GLOBAL.STRUCTURE_UPGRADES.BEACONOFUNITY.Hyperlink}>>. After building three beacons in different cities, you can light the Beacons, during which hostile armies are spawned in an attempt to destroy them. If you can defend the Beacons for {amount} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>, you will be victorious.[br/][br/]Provinces count when they belong to your <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> directly, or when they belong to your <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>> with at least a {GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageLvl1Concept.Hyperlink}.

INTERFACE@HUD_GENERAL_INFO@MOVE_POINTS_DESCRIPTION Move Points represent how far a unit can move in one turn on the World Map and in combat.

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@AFFINITIES@DESCRIPTION The six affinities are the cosmic forces that shape and define all that exists. [hyperlink,GLOBAL.OrderConcept]Order[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ChaosConcept]Chaos[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NatureConcept]Nature[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ShadowConcept]Shadow[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,GLOBAL.MateriumConcept]Materium[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralConcept]Astral[/hyperlink] are the powers that encompass the cosmos, each vastly different in its domain, applications and nature. When channeling magic, the aspects of these cosmic forces will be invoked.[br/][br/]The {GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept.Hyperlink} are dedicated to studying the six affinities in order to harness their powers to the greatest effect. Their findings are inscribed in {GLOBAL.TomeLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, true testaments to the godly ambitions of their authors.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@AFFINITIES@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AffinitiesLoreConcept]Affinities[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@AFFINITIES@TITLE Magic Affinities
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ALFRED_ELDERSTONE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlfredElderstoneLoreConcept]{LOC.DEFAULT@LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_1@NAME} {LOC.DEFAULT@LORDS@HERO_SURNAME_1@NAME}[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ALFRED_ELDERSTONE@NAME {LOC.DEFAULT@LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_1@NAME} {LOC.DEFAULT@LORDS@HERO_SURNAME_1@NAME}
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ALLFATHER@DESCRIPTION The "Allfather" is one of the names given to a supreme being shrouded in mystery. Worshiped as a force of creation, they are known by many different identities throughout the cosmos. Some say they shaped the mythical [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TheWellLoreConcept]Well of Creation[/hyperlink] while others believe that the being and the Well form a holy duality that cannot be separated.[br/][br/]The {GLOBAL.ArchonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} have spread the faith of the "Allfather" to many [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]Worlds[/hyperlink], the being's manifestation morphing toward the perception of the various races. While the {GLOBAL.ArchonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} claim to be the "Allfather's" celestial servants, there are no trustworthy sources that would demonstrate the being's intentions or any will to interfere with the dealings of mortals.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ALLFATHER@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AllfatherLoreConcept]Allfather[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ALLFATHER@TITLE Allfather
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ARACHNA@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ArachnaLoreConcept]{LOC.CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_06@FIRST_NAME}[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ARCHONS@DESCRIPTION The Archons believe they were created by the {GLOBAL.AllfatherLoreConcept.Hyperlink} himself as the first sentient race, and tasked with advancing his works of creation. Through the ages, they have proudly called themselves the Allfather's divine guardians against evil, protecting new [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]Worlds[/hyperlink] from the dangers of the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. However, in recent ages they have withdrawn from many Worlds and only rarely seek contact with the non-celestial races.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ARCHONS@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ArchonsLoreConcept]Archons[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ARCHONS@TITLE Archons

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASC_CHAMPION@DESCRIPTION Ascended Champions are mortals who joined the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PantheonLoreConcept]Pantheon of Godir[/hyperlink] at {GLOBAL.MagehavenLoreConcept.Hyperlink} through their mastery of the arcane arts. They bear resemblance to their mortal origins and have a close connection with and understanding of the people they rule.

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASGERA@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AsgeraLoreConcept]{LOC.LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_18@NAME} {LOC.LORDS@HERO_SECONDNAME_18@NAME}[/hyperlink]

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_AFFINITY@TITLE Astral Affinity
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_FLOW@DESCRIPTION The Astral Flows are the magical currents within the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} that connect all worlds and living beings. Where these flows breach the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]material realm[/hyperlink] they consolidate their magic into Mana Nodes. Here, magic users can tap into the flow to power their spells. Powerful beings may enter the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} through these breaches to follow the Astral Flows to other [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]worlds[/hyperlink].
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_FLOW@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralFlowsLoreConcept]Astral Flows[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_FLOW@TITLE Astral Flows
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_SEA@DESCRIPTION The Astral Sea is the primal source of arcane powers, a vast aetherial ocean containing and connecting the {GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. This ocean ebbs and flows, pushes and pulls, seeps into the material world through Mana Nodes. It contains [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralDwellersLoreConcept]beings of pure magical energy[/hyperlink] such as the Node Serpent and is traversed by the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SoulsLoreConcept]souls of the dead[/hyperlink] on their final journey to {GLOBAL.TheWellLoreConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Powerful mages may follow the {GLOBAL.AstralFlowsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} to travel between worlds, but it is a dangerous journey where they may be lured away into the {GLOBAL.AstralVoidLoreConcept.Hyperlink} or become a victim of {GLOBAL.AstralMonstersLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. A much safer method involves the use of <<m: {GLOBAL.WorldGateLoreConcept.Hyperlink}>>, which however require great knowledge and skill to be created or used.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_SEA@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept]Astral Sea[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_SEA@TITLE Astral Sea
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_SEA_DWELLERS@DESCRIPTION Though alien to most visitors from the {GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} is not empty or dead. In between its {GLOBAL.AstralFlowsLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, an entire ecosystem thrives, where creatures and plants intertwine with the arcane energy as it ebbs and flows. Natural predators and [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralMonstersLoreConcept]Monsters[/hyperlink] roam the astral depths, while lone wanderers of the ancient {GLOBAL.MaerLoreConcept.Hyperlink} bear rare witness to a once great civilization.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_SEA_DWELLERS@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralDwellersLoreConcept]Astral Sea Dwellers[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_SEA_DWELLERS@TITLE Astral Sea Dwellers
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_SEA_MONSTERS@DESCRIPTION Astral Sea Monsters are denizens of the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. These mana-hungry creatures come in a variety of shapes, from the jellyfish like Astral Syphoner to the horrifically tragic {GLOBAL.LostWizardLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. They are all designed to thrive in the harsh environment of the Astral Sea, with many leeching life from any traveler caught unaware. However, not all Astral Sea creatures are malevolent, as the gentle {GLOBAL.MaerLoreConcept.Hyperlink} are prove.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_SEA_MONSTERS@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralMonstersLoreConcept]Astral Sea Monsters[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_SEA_MONSTERS@TITLE Astral Sea Monsters
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_VOID@DESCRIPTION Beyond the reach of the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} lies the Astral Void, a place where the {GLOBAL.AstralFlowsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} do not reach, a place of nothingness. A wizard may be banished and cast into the Void, where they drift around until they either manage to find a flow leading them back to a safe place or succumb to the {GLOBAL.ShadowTrialLoreConcept.Hyperlink} and perish as one of the <<m:{GLOBAL.LostWizardLoreConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_VOID@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralVoidLoreConcept]Astral Void[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_VOID@TITLE Astral Void
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_VORTEX@DESCRIPTION Sometimes the {GLOBAL.AstralFlowsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} converge into astral vortices, paradoxical culminations of magic energy that bend all meaning of time and space. When entered by beings powerful enough to withstand their shearing forces, they may be used to traverse large distances within the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. However, many prefer the use of the much safer—but also rarer—<<m:{GLOBAL.WorldGateLoreConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_VORTEX@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralVortexLoreConcept]Astral Vortex[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ASTRAL_VORTEX@TITLE Astral Vortex
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ATHLA@DESCRIPTION Athla is one of the oldest {GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept.Hyperlink} the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} with a potent convergence of {GLOBAL.AstralFlowsLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. It is the home to the {GLOBAL.ValleyofWondersLoreConcept.Hyperlink} and Inioch's court. Through the ages Athla has played a pivotal role in events that shaped the cosmos, be it as a realm to conquer, a scene of cosmic battles, or the origin of powerful beings. Many known {GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept.Hyperlink} originate from this world.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ATHLA@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AthlaLoreConcept]Athla[/hyperlink]

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@AULDWEALD@DESCRIPTION Auldweald is said to be the original homeworld of the First Elves, from where they first traveled to other [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]Worlds[/hyperlink] in the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. Many elven songs idolize its lush valleys and evergreen forests, and it is said that all elven {GLOBAL.SoulsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} long to return to this world.

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@DRAGONS@DESCRIPTION Dragons are among the first creatures that the {GLOBAL.AllfatherLoreConcept.Hyperlink} gifted with life. The first of these, known as the Elder Dragons, would utilize their vast intelligence and mastery of the elements to aid the Archons in shaping the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]Worlds[/hyperlink] within the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} as well as in crafting powerful artifacts. In all of this they would be forced to work alongside the {GLOBAL.GiantsLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, which led to much conflict.[br/][br/]Dragons come in three forms: the Elder Dragons who were born at the beginning of creation and their offspring, the more common dragons. Lastly, the far younger and less sophisticated Wyverns who were hatched in ages since that primordial time. Beyond that, dragons come in myriad types that are mostly associated with a different element and some have even been raised as undead versions of their previous selves.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@DRAGONS@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DragonsLoreConcept]Dragons[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@DRAGONS@TITLE Dragons
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ELYA@DESCRIPTION Elya is a young {GLOBAL.MaerLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, a mystical species of benevolent [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralMonstersLoreConcept]Astral Sea Creatures[/hyperlink]. Unlike many others of her people, Elya feels a strong connection to mortals and the {GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept.Hyperlink} the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. Her youth and curiosity bring her closer to {GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept.Hyperlink} - and danger - than any other of her kind would dare.

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@GIANTS@DESCRIPTION A relatively rare but imposing sight to behold, giants once roamed the primordial {GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept.Hyperlink} in greater numbers. In the early days of the cosmos, giants directed the flow of the land and shaped the continents upon each world. This purportedly piqued the ire of the {GLOBAL.DragonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} who had formed worlds in a certain way before the giants and were unimpressed with their later adjustments.[br/][br/]True giants tend to come in various forms, usually associated with an element that they have a certain amount of control over. A number of offshoot races of Giantkin and other subtypes have also come into being over the ages through various intermingling of races.

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@GODIR@DESCRIPTION The Wizards of the {GLOBAL.PantheonLoreConcept.Hyperlink} who gather at {GLOBAL.MagehavenLoreConcept.Hyperlink} are called Godir. From there they seek new knowledge and journey to new realms in the Astral Sea. Some of the Godir are newly <<m:{GLOBAL.AscendedChampLoreConcept.Hyperlink}>>– while others are ancient <<m:{GLOBAL.WizardKingLoreConcept.Hyperlink}>> seeking dominion over new realms and people through their dominion of the {GLOBAL.AffinitiesLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. Godir have achieved a form of immortality: if they are vanquished, they are cast into the {GLOBAL.AstralVoidLoreConcept.Hyperlink} and seek to rematerialize in Magehaven.

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@LOST_MAGE@DESCRIPTION A Lost Wizard was once a powerful wizard who, either by foolhardy choice or forced exile, found themselves in the {GLOBAL.AstralVoidLoreConcept.Hyperlink} and succumbed to the {GLOBAL.ShadowTrialLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. These power-hungry husks now glide with deadly purpose through the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} as one of the myriad [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralMonstersLoreConcept]Monsters[/hyperlink] that roam its depths, preying upon the unwary.[br/][br/]While it retains an affinity for magic and even clutches its [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TomeLoreConcept]Tome of Spells[/hyperlink] greedily, its physical form has twisted to match its [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept]environment[/hyperlink].

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@MAER@DESCRIPTION The Maer are a rare breed of sentient merfolk, residing deep within the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. Where mortals find travel through the Astral Sea tedious and dangerous, these beings move through it with ease and grace, singing along to songs no one else can hear.[br/][br/]The Maer are such a rare sight that many schooled mortals deem their existence a myth, a story of solace to explain the strange sounds heard during the travels through the Astral Sea. But these benevolent, solitary creatures of magic and song are as real as the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralMonstersLoreConcept]horrors[/hyperlink] that plague the currents.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@MAER@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.MaerLoreConcept]Maer[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@MAER@TITLE Maer
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@MAGEHAVEN@DESCRIPTION Magehaven is a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]World[/hyperlink] in the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink} where the {GLOBAL.PantheonLoreConcept.Hyperlink} of {GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept.Hyperlink} hold their most important forum of dispute and council. It is protected by an unbreakable spell which prevents any harm from being done to a living creature or [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SoulsLoreConcept]Soul[/hyperlink]. Therefore, even the fiercest enemies can meet there to negotiate their conflicts.[br/][br/]Magehaven is located close to {GLOBAL.TheWellLoreConcept.Hyperlink} and bears remnants of the {GLOBAL.ArchonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} who once dwelt there. Among the many wonders of Magehaven are the Library of [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TomeLoreConcept]Ancient Tomes[/hyperlink] and the {GLOBAL.WorldGateLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, which act as magic portals through the Astral Sea.

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@OBBADOTH@DESCRIPTION Obbadoth is an infernal [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]World[/hyperlink] ruled by Demonic Princes, where fiends make the laws and sins are virtuous. Many realms of this world are affected by spells which enhance one's primal urges, which often leads to bloodshed, debauchery, and everything in between. Very few {GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept.Hyperlink} can withstand Obbadoth's infernal influence.

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@PANTHEON@DESCRIPTION With many [hyperlink,GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept]Wizard Kings[/hyperlink] seeing themselves as living gods, it is no surprise their gathering at {GLOBAL.MagehavenLoreConcept.Hyperlink} became known as the Pantheon. In this sanctuary the members of the Pantheon debate and scheme to alter the fate of the cosmos. The Pantheon consists of many factions and alliances, of which the {GLOBAL.CovenantFactionLoreConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.ShadraiFactionLoreConcept.Hyperlink} are most prominent.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@PANTHEON@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PantheonLoreConcept]Pantheon[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@PANTHEON@TITLE Pantheon
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@RAINA_THE_GOLDEN@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.RainaTheGoldenLoreConcept]{LOC.LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_19@NAME} {LOC.LORDS@HERO_SECONDNAME_19@NAME}[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@RAINA_THE_GOLDEN@NAME {LOC.LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_19@NAME} {LOC.LORDS@HERO_SECONDNAME_19@NAME}
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@ROOT_NODE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.RootNodeLoreConcept]Root Node[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SHADOW_AFFINITY@TITLE Shadow Affinity
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SHADOW_TRIAL@DESCRIPTION In the darkness of the {GLOBAL.AstralVoidLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, the banished Wizards are tormented by visions and maddening voices. Survivors describe vastly different experiences, as if the cosmos creates a reckoning for a Wizard's individual actions and beliefs. Those that succumb are doomed to drift forever as a <<m:{GLOBAL.LostWizardLoreConcept.Hyperlink}>>, mad husks of which little remains other than their lust for power.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SHADOW_TRIAL@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ShadowTrialLoreConcept]Torment of Shadows[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SHADOW_TRIAL@TITLE Torment of Shadows
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SHADRAI@DESCRIPTION A group of ambitious {GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept.Hyperlink} who formed a volatile cabal in order to claim power within the {GLOBAL.PantheonLoreConcept.Hyperlink} and the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. They believe no power should be hidden from anyone and are known for their schemes and invasions of realms they deem worthy of their domination. Their chaotic tendencies often put them in direct opposition to the {GLOBAL.CovenantFactionLoreConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SHADRAI@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ShadraiFactionLoreConcept]Shad'rai[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SHADRAI@TITLE Shad'rai
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SHIRA@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ShiraLoreConcept]{LOC.CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_15@FIRST_NAME} {LOC.CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_15@LAST_NAME}[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SHIRA@NAME {LOC.CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_15@FIRST_NAME} {LOC.CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_15@LAST_NAME}
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SOULS@DESCRIPTION Souls are the eternal Astral manifestations of all living beings. When someone dies, their soul is released to return to [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TheWellLoreConcept]the Well of Creation[/hyperlink]. This journey through the {GLOBAL.AstralFlowsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} is arduous and many {GLOBAL.AstralDwellersLoreConcept.Hyperlink} hunt these souls. Especially troubled souls may find themselves lost or captured during the journey.[br/][br/]With specific magics, souls can be captured for nefarious purposes. Some dark races use souls as a valuable currency that allows the summoning of undead beings.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SOULS@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SoulsLoreConcept]Souls[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SOULS@TITLE Souls
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SUNDREN@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SundrenLoreConcept]{LOC.CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_08@FIRST_NAME}[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SYLVANI_LAUREL@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SylvaniLaurelLoreConcept]{LOC.SKIN_ELF@HERO_FEMALE_FIRSTNAME_08@NAME} {LOC.CULTURE_HIGH@HERO_SECONDNAME_29@NAME}[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@SYLVANI_LAUREL@NAME {LOC.SKIN_ELF@HERO_FEMALE_FIRSTNAME_08@NAME} {LOC.CULTURE_HIGH@HERO_SECONDNAME_29@NAME}
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@THE_WELL@DESCRIPTION According to mythology, the {GLOBAL.AllfatherLoreConcept.Hyperlink} pulled the cosmos from the Well of Creation. All later creations of the {GLOBAL.AllfatherLoreConcept.Hyperlink} would date back to this one wonder. From {GLOBAL.MagehavenLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, located deep in the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, the Well can be seen as a looming bright omen, a slowly swirling white maelstrom from which the light of creation emerges in shifting directions. All <<c: {GLOBAL.SoulsLoreConcept.Hyperlink}>> of the dead are drawn to return to the Well on their final journey.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@THE_WELL@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TheWellLoreConcept]the Well[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@THE_WELL@TITLE The Well
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@TIDOLON@DESCRIPTION Tidolon is known for its vast oceans and relatively low density of land. Islands and small continents dot the massive sea of blue. Many aquatic beings thrive on this [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]World[/hyperlink], and it is said many lost treasures and whole empires are hidden beneath its surface.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@TIDOLON@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TidolonLoreConcept]Tidolon[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@TIDOLON@TITLE Tidolon
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@TOMES@DESCRIPTION Tomes of power hold certain fundamental truths and secrets of the cosmos, often associated with specific {GLOBAL.AffinitiesLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. These works are mystical manuscripts written by beings of power like {GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, to pass on their mastery of the subject within.[br/][br/]True mastery of a Tome can only be achieved through dedicated focus. Every stage of mastery will grant powers that can alter realms and even a Godir's subjects themselves.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@TOMES@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TomeLoreConcept]Tome[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@TOMES@TITLE Tomes of Knowledge
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@TUGRUM@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TugrumLoreConcept]{LOC.LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_5@NAME} {LOC.LORDS@HERO_SECONDNAME_5@NAME}[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@TUGRUM@NAME {LOC.LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_5@NAME} {LOC.LORDS@HERO_SECONDNAME_5@NAME}
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@TURIEL@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TurielLoreConcept]{LOC.CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_11@FIRST_NAME} {LOC.CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_11@LAST_NAME}[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@TURIEL@NAME {LOC.CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_11@FIRST_NAME} {LOC.CAMPAIGN@LORDS@LEADER_11@LAST_NAME}
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@URRATH@DESCRIPTION Urrath is the nemesis of the {GLOBAL.ArchonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} and widely believed to be the bringer of darkness and corruption to the cosmos. The most terrifying creatures known to exist, such as the {GLOBAL.AstralMonstersLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, are blamed on Urrath's influence, as is all evil running through the veins of mortal races.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@URRATH@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.UrrathLoreConcept]Urrath[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@URRATH@TITLE Urrath
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@VALLEY_WONDERS@DESCRIPTION The Valley of Wonders is a historic area on the Blessed Continent on the world of {GLOBAL.AthlaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. Once the home of the Elven Court of House Inioch, it has seen much turmoil since the first Athlan humans sacked the fabled court. It remains an area of great natural beauty and magical potency.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@VALLEY_WONDERS@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ValleyofWondersLoreConcept]Valley of Wonders[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@VALLEY_WONDERS@TITLE Valley of Wonders
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WERLAC@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WerlacLoreConcept]{LOC.LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_4@NAME} {LOC.LORDS@HERO_SECONDNAME_4@NAME}[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WERLAC@NAME {LOC.LORDS@HERO_FIRSTNAME_4@NAME} {LOC.LORDS@HERO_SECONDNAME_4@NAME}
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WIZARD_KING@DESCRIPTION Wizard Kings are ancient archmages who seek power across the realms of the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. Before joining the {GLOBAL.PantheonLoreConcept.Hyperlink} at {GLOBAL.MagehavenLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, the {GLOBAL.ShadowTrialLoreConcept.Hyperlink} left many mentally warped. Wizard Kings are no longer limited to their original mortal form, and can create people vastly different from themselves.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WIZARD_KING@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WizardKingLoreConcept]Wizard King[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WIZARD_KING@TITLE Wizard King
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WORLDS_WITHIN@DESCRIPTION The material worlds embedded within the {GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. They are the places where mortal races thrive and build their empires, and where the grand plots of the past and coming ages unfold.[br/][br/] According to ancient knowledge, the worlds were drawn from the {GLOBAL.TheWellLoreConcept.Hyperlink} by the {GLOBAL.AllfatherLoreConcept.Hyperlink}, after which {GLOBAL.DragonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} shaped them and {GLOBAL.GiantsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} refined them. Through the ages, the worlds and their distinguished realms have been altered and reshaped by various factions and forces, making each uniquely distinct in terms of the lay of the land, creatures and people living there, but also the abundance of magic and its representing {GLOBAL.AffinitiesLoreConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WORLDS_WITHIN@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]Worlds Within[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WORLDS_WITHIN@TITLE Worlds Within
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WORLD_GATE@DESCRIPTION To shortcut the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralFlowsLoreConcept]dangerous journey[/hyperlink] to other [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldsWithinLoreConcept]Worlds[/hyperlink], the {GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept.Hyperlink} have devised elaborate portal structures known as World Gates, which allow the user to travel to other worlds almost instantly. Great knowledge and skill is required to use such a portal. Otherwise, the Godir and their companions may be lost in the {GLOBAL.AstralVoidLoreConcept.Hyperlink} or stranded on an isolated world.
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WORLD_GATE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldGateLoreConcept]World Gate[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@WORLD_GATE@TITLE World Gate

INTERFACE@LORE_CONCEPT@XETEVACA@NAME {LOC.AFFINITY_MATERIUM@HERO_FEMALE_FIRSTNAME_07@NAME} {LOC.AFFINITY_MATERIUM@HERO_SECONDNAME_01@NAME}

INTERFACE@MAGIC@SPELLS Spell
INTERFACE@MAGIC@SPELLS_DESCRIPTION Magical rites and incantations used by <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>>. Obtained through {GLOBAL.ResearchConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Spells usually cost {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink} and <<m:{GLOBAL.WorldMapCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>> or <<m:{GLOBAL.CombatCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]Spells are divided in 2 main categories, depending on where they can be cast. Each category has their own collection of spell types:[bulletlist][bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.WorldMapSpellConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.CombatSpellConcept.Hyperlink}>>[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@MAGIC@SPELLS_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SpellConcept]Spell[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@MAGIC@SPELLS_TITLE SPELLS
INTERFACE@MAGIC@UNIT_ENCHANTMENT [caststrategic/] Unit Enchantment
INTERFACE@MAGIC@UNIT_ENCHANTMENT_HYPERLINK [caststrategic/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.UnitEnchantmentConcept]Unit Enchantment[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@MAGIC@UNIT_SUMMON Unit Summon
INTERFACE@MAGIC@UNIT_SUMMON_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.UnitSummonConcept]Unit Summon[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@MAGIC_VICTORY@DESCRIPTION To achieve the Magic Victory, an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} needs to annex three [hyperlink,GLOBAL.RootNodeConcept]Root Nodes[/hyperlink] into its {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink}. Root Nodes appear in the world once any Empire has reached {affinityrequirement} total {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} and an Empire can have a maximum of three Root Nodes in total.[br/][br/]Once annexed, Root Nodes can be converted into an Affinity Root Node of the highest Affinity in their Empire through a unique Affinity {GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Through research of the final {GLOBAL.TomeConcept.Hyperlink} of an Affinity, an ultimate Spell can be unlocked which can be used to start the final victory {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink} timer.[br/][br/]Channeling the ultimate Spell will start to spread the effects of the Root Nodes slowly across the world. At the end of each turn all unused <<m:{GLOBAL.WorldMapCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>> are put towards achieving victory. Once the required number of casting points is reached, they and their [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DSAllianceConcept]Allies[/hyperlink] are victorious.
INTERFACE@MAGIC_VICTORY_SHORTCUT@BUTTON_TEXT Go to Magic Victory

INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP@TURN_TIMER_LONG_HALFDAY 16 hours
