INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP@USE_COMBAT_RESTART Enable Combat Restart
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP@USE_COMBAT_RETRY Enable Combat Retry
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@AI_COMBAT Select how tactical battles against AI are handled.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@AI_COMBAT_ALWAYSASK Choose between Auto Combat or Manual Combat each battle.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@AI_COMBAT_AUTOCOMBAT Automatically select auto combat for each battle.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@AI_COMBAT_MANUALCOMBAT Automatically select Manual Combat for each battle.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@AI_DIFFICULTY Set the difficulty of all AI players
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@AI_PASSIVITY_AGGRESSIVE The AI is more likely to start wars and has a higher starting dislike of other players.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@AI_PASSIVITY_LOW The AI will interact slightly less, is less inclined to start wars, and has a lower starting dislike of other players.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@AI_PASSIVITY_PASSIVE The AI will still interact but on far fewer occasions, is far less inclined to start wars, and has a negligible starting dislike of other players.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@AI_PASSIVITY_STANDARD The AI occasionally sends messages and responds to the player's actions and is able to declare war when it wants.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@ALLIED_VICTORY When Allied Victory is enabled, a player winning the game will also result in victory for that player's allies.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@ARCTIC Set the frequency of the Arctic clime relative to the other climes
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@ASHLANDS Set the frequency of the Ashlands terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@ASTRAL_VOID Set the frequency of the Astral Void terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@BEDROCK Set the frequency of the Bedrock terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@CAVERNFLOOR Set the frequency of the Cavern Floor terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@CHASM Set the frequency of Chasms
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@CUSTOM_RULERS Enable/Disable AI picking custom Rulers.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@DESERT Set the frequency of the Desert clime relative to the other climes
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@DESOLATE Set the frequency of the Desolate clime relative to the other climes
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@DIFFICULTY Select the difficulty of the game. This determines the hostility of the world and AI strength.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@DRY Set the frequency of the Tropical clime relative to the other climes
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@EARTH Set the frequency of the Earth terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@EXPANSION_VICTORY Enable/Disable Expansion victory[br/]Expansion Victory is achieved by owning a set amount of provinces through your cities or vassals, building special beacons and defending them for a certain amount of turns. [br/][br/]The amount of provinces needed to trigger the countdown is relative to the map size.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@FERTILE_PLAINS Set the frequency of the Grassland terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@FOREST Set the frequency of the Forest terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@FROZEN_WASTE Set the frequency of the Frozen Waste terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@FUNGUS_FIELDS Set the frequency of the Fungus Fields terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@GAME_SPEED Define the pace of the game. This affects research speed, population growth and city structure cost.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@GAME_SPEED_DEFAULT No change to cost for research skills and population growth.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@GAME_SPEED_FAST Cost of research skills, population growth and city structures decreased by {INT_AMOUNT}%.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@GAME_SPEED_SLOW Cost of research skills, population growth and city structures increased by +{INT_AMOUNT}%.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@HERO_RESURGENCE Select what happens when a hero dies during a battle while their side is still victorious.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@HERO_RESURGENCE_ALWAYS Always resurrect the hero after winning.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@HERO_RESURGENCE_AUTOCOMBAT Only resurrect the hero after winning Auto Combat.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@HERO_RESURGENCE_NEVER Never automatically resurrect a hero.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@HIGHLANDS Set the frequency of the Highlands clime relative to the other climes
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@HUMAN_COMBAT Select how tactical combat against other human players are handled.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@LANDMASS_TYPE _CONTINENTS A few large landmasses separated by ocean.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@LANDMASS_TYPE_COAST Mostly land with a small ocean creating a long coastline.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@LANDMASS_TYPE_ISLANDS A large number of islands spread throughout the map.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@LANDMASS_TYPE_LAND A full land map.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@LAVA Set the frequency of the Lava terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@MAGIC_VICTORY Enable/Disable Magic Victory[br/]Magic Victory is achieved by researching tomes, building Affinity province improvements, and channeling a game-ending spell over a certain number of turns.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@MOUNTAINS Set the frequency of the Mountains terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@MUSHROOM_FOREST Set the frequency of the Mushroom Forest terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@OBSERVE_COMBAT Select when to observe a human player's Manual Combat encounter.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@OBSERVE_COMBAT_ALWAYS Always observe combat.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@OBSERVE_COMBAT_NEVER Never observe combat.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@OBSERVE_COMBAT_VISIBLE Only observe combat when it happens in a visible location.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@OCEAN Set the frequency of the Ocean clime relative to the other climes
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@PLAYERS Select the number of players for this game.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@PLAYER_DISTANCE The desired distance between each player's capital. The further the distance and the higher the number of players, the bigger the map size will be.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@RESTART_COMBAT_AI_ONLY Allowed only against AI
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@RESTART_COMBAT_ALWAYS Always allowed
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@RESTART_COMBAT_NEVER Never allowed
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@RIVER Set the frequency of Rivers
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@ROCKY Set the frequency of the Rocky terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@SAND Set the frequency of the Sand terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@SCORE_VICTORY Enable/Disable Score Victory[br/]Score Victory is achieved by having the highest accumulated score at the end of the set turn limit. The score depends on how well you perform in various areas, which can be reviewed in-game.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@SCORE_VICTORY_COMBO Select the turn limit for Score Victory.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@SCORE_VICTORY_OPTION {INT_DURATION}[turn/] turn limit.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@SNOW Set the frequency of the Snow terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@STARTING_RESOURCES Select the amount of resources each player receives at the start of the game as well as the size of their starting army.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@STARTING_UNITS_NORMAL The regular starting composition.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@STARTING_UNITS_STRONG More units than the regular starting composition.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@STARTING_UNITS_WEAK Fewer units than the regular starting composition.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@SUB_TROPICAL Set the frequency of the Sub-Tropical clime relative to the other climes
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TACTICAL_TIMER_COMBO Select the speed at which turns should be played in tactical combat.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TACTICAL_TIMER_SPEED You get {INT_BASE} seconds per turn and an additional {INT_PERUNIT} seconds per unit you control.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TEAMS Enable/Disable Teams[br/]Enabling teams will allow you to set a team for each player. Players in a team are in a permanent alliance with players of the same team, while being permanently at war with players of other teams.[br/][br/][warningRed]Enabling teams will disable many diplomatic systems, such as <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink}>> and changing Diplomatic States.[/warningRed]
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TEMPERATE Set the frequency of the Temperate clime relative to the other climes
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TURN_SYSTEM Select the Turn System used for this Game:[bulletlist][bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.ClassicTurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>: Everyone plays their turn in order, one after the other.[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.SimultaneousTurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>: Everyone plays their turn at the same time.[/bulletList]
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TURN_SYSTEM_CLASSIC In classic turns, everyone plays their turn in the order of the Rulers list. Once the last Ruler has ended their turn, the next round will start with the first Ruler.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TURN_SYSTEM_SIM In simultaneous turns, everyone plays their turn at the same time. Once each Ruler has ended their turn, the next round will start.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TURN_TIMER Enable/Disable the Strategic Turn Timer[br/]The turn timer determines how much time a player has each turn before it automatically ends.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TURN_TIMER_LONG Enable/Disable the Long Turn Timer[br/]This timer keeps ticking, even when you're not playing. Other players can choose to forfeit your turn after the time has run out.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TURN_TIMER_OFF The turn timer is disabled.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@TURN_TIMER_SPEED The total time per turn is calculated based on:[br/]A base of +{INT_BASE} seconds.[br/]+{INT_PERSTACK} seconds for every 6 units beyond your first 6 units.[br/]+{INT_PERCOLONY} seconds for every city beyond your first.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@UNDERGROUND Set the frequency of the Underground clime relative to the other climes (Underground is unique and does not work this way!)
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@USE_COMBAT_RESTART Enables the option to restart Manual Combat.[br/]This makes it possible to restart during a battle and try a different strategy if desired.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@USE_COMBAT_RETRY Enables the option to retry a combat from the results screen.[br/]This makes it possible to manually retry a combat once it has been completed, if the combat didn't end with a favorable result.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@WATER Set the frequency of the Water terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@WETLANDS Set the frequency of the Wetland terrain type relative to the other terrain types
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@WORLD_SIZE Select the size of the randomly generated world. This determines a range for the number of provinces the world will have.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@WORLD_THREAT Determines the general strength of independent armies, how fast they upgrade their strength and the frequency with which they send attacking armies.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@WORLD_THREAT_DANGEROUS Enemy armies are increased in strength, and increase in strength over time at a faster rate.[br/][br/]Free cities and infestations will send frequent attacking armies.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@WORLD_THREAT_LOW Enemy armies are reduced in strength, and increase in strength over time at a slow rate.[br/][br/]Free cities and infestations will send fewer attacking armies.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@WORLD_THREAT_MODERATE Enemy armies are of normal strength, and increase in strength over time at a balanced rate.[br/][br/]Free cities and infestations will send regular attacking armies.
INTERFACE@MAP_SETUP_TOOLTIP@WORLD_THREAT_PASSIVE Enemy armies are reduced in strength, and increase in strength over time at a slow rate.[br/][br/]Free cities and infestations will not send attacking armies.
INTERFACE@MEET_PLAYER_EVENT@MEET_PLAYER You met a Ruler
INTERFACE@MESSAGE_PANEL@ABANDON_SESSION_DESCRIPTION You are about to abandon the session! Your turn will be taken over by an AI player, and you cannot continue playing. [br/][br/]Do you want to continue?

INTERFACE@MESSAGE_PANEL@FLEE_UNIT_DESCRIPTION Moving a unit to a retreat zone will cause it to become routed and leave the battle![br/][bulletlist][bullet/]Nearby units will [fireCol]lose morale [morale/][/fireCol].[bullet/]The unit will [fireCol]lose health [hp/] and Move Points [movementwalk/][/fireCol] after battle.[bullet/]If you lose the battle, the [fireCol]unit will either die, or scatter and reappear at one of your cities after a few turns[/fireCol].[/bulletlist]

INTERFACE@MESSAGE_PANEL@SURRENDER_DESCRIPTION Are you sure you want to surrender? Surrendering will cause all of your units to rout and attempt to run off of the battlefield.

You are not currently at war with {STR_targetPlayer}, and they will gain {CasusBelliValue}[casusBelli/] if you attack them. Are you sure you want to attack this army?

INTERFACE@MODAL_HOSTILE_ACTION@DESCRIPTION_DEFENSIVE You are about to break your {GLOBAL.DefensivePactConcept.Hyperlink} with {STR_targetPlayer}. This will incur a relations penalty and any treaties depending on it will be broken! Are you sure you want to break the defensive pact?
INTERFACE@MODAL_HOSTILE_ACTION@DESCRIPTION_FIXED You currently share fixed relations with {STR_targetPlayer} and can therefore not declare war to attack them.
INTERFACE@MODAL_HOSTILE_ACTION@DESCRIPTION_INDEPENDENT You are about to declare {GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept.Hyperlink} on {STR_targetPlayer}. This counts as an [evilact/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept]evil[/hyperlink] act! Are you sure you want to declare war?
INTERFACE@MODAL_HOSTILE_ACTION@DESCRIPTION_NEUTRAL You are about to declare war on {STR_targetPlayer}. Are you sure?
INTERFACE@MODAL_HOSTILE_ACTION@DESCRIPTION_VASSALAGE {HouseBLord.Name} is your overlord, and you cannot attack or declare war on them while they are your overlord. You may still try and [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TradeConcept]Negotiate[/hyperlink] your freedom with {HouseBLord.FirstName}.
INTERFACE@MODAL_HOSTILE_ACTION@DESCRIPTION_VASSALAGEOVERLORD {HouseBLord.Name} is your vassal, and you cannot attack or declare war on them while they are your vassal. You may still grant them freedom through <<m:{GLOBAL.TradeConcept.Hyperlink}>>.

INTERFACE@MODAL_HOSTILE_ACTION@HEADER_VASSALAGEOVERLORD Encountering your Vassal, {HouseBLord.FirstName}
INTERFACE@MODAL_HOSTILE_ACTION@SPECOPS You are about to cast a spell on a Ruler or city you are not at war with. You must declare war on them before being able to target them with this spell.
INTERFACE@MODAL_HOSTILE_ACTION@SPECOPS_FIXED You can only cast this spell on Rulers you are at war with. You currently share a fixed diplomatic state with the other Ruler and cannot break that relationship.

INTERFACE@PROVINCE_CLAIM@DESCRIPTION Province Claims indicate the intention of owning a {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]They appear on <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>> adjacent to:[bulletlist][bullet/]A {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.OutpostConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]Explored <<m:{GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}>>[/bulletlist][br/][br/]If other <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> build on claimed provinces, the Rulers will meet and have a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} against them. Building on a sector claimed by a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} will incur a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityRelationConcept.Hyperlink} penalty.[br/][br/]Rulers also have distant claims on provinces up to a distance of 3 away from their owned domain. Distant claims yield less severe penalties and are only violated by building an outpost or exploring an Ancient Wonder.

Locked skills remain when Redraw is used.[br/]Locking a skill costs {STR_Cost}. The cost of Locking a skill increases with the number of Tomes that have been unlocked.

INTERFACE@RESOURCES@BUILDING_PRODUCTION [structureprod/] Production
INTERFACE@RESOURCES@BUILDING_PRODUCTION_DESCRIPTION [structureprod/] Production is used for building <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]Every {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}, Production is spent on the first structure in the City's {GLOBAL.ProductionQueueConcept.Hyperlink}. Leftover Production becomes {GLOBAL.SurplusConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Gain [structureprod/] Production by:[bulletlist][bullet/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceAnnexationConcept]Annexing[/hyperlink] Iron Deposits.[bullet/]Building Foresters and Quarries in <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Building certain <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Collecting <<m:{GLOBAL.PickupConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@RESOURCES@BUILDING_PRODUCTION_DESCRIPTION_SHORT Production is used to build <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.

INTERFACE@RESOURCES@RECRUITMENTPOINTS_CURRENT Current [recruitmentPoints/] Recruitment Points:
INTERFACE@RESOURCES@RECRUITMENTPOINTS_DESCRIPTION Recruitment points are used in the {GLOBAL.RequestMilitaryAidConcept.Hyperlink} to draft <<m: {GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> into your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} or to send them to aid in the defense of vassal houses. Recruitment points are primarily gained from {GLOBAL.IndependentCityRelationConcept.Hyperlink} with <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.

INTERFACE@RESOURCES@UNIT_PRODUCTION [unitprod/] Draft
INTERFACE@RESOURCES@UNIT_PRODUCTION_DESCRIPTION [unitprod/] Draft is used for recruiting <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> in <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]Spent on the first Unit in the City's Unit {GLOBAL.ProductionQueueConcept.Hyperlink} every {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}. Leftover Draft becomes {GLOBAL.SurplusConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Gain [unitprod/] Draft by:[bulletlist][bullet/]Building certain <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@RESOURCES@UNIT_PRODUCTION_DESCRIPTION_SHORT Used for recruiting <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> in <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INTERFACE@RESOURCES@UNIT_PRODUCTION_HYPERLINK [unitprod/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.UnitProductionConcept]Draft[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@DIPLOMATIC_TOKEN_DESCRIPTION [whisperingStone/]Whispering Stones are given to a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} to begin <<m:{GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept.Hyperlink}>>, which can lead to it becoming your [rs_vassalage/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageConcept]Vassal[/hyperlink]. Having more allows you to befriend multiple <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>> at once.[br/][br/]Unused [whisperingStone/]Whispering Stones can be given to your <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> to gain {GLOBAL.CityStabilityConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Gain more [whisperingStone/]Whispering Stones via {GLOBAL.EmpireDevelopmentConcept.Hyperlink}
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@DIPLOMATIC_TOKEN_DESCRIPTION_SHORT Used to [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]Negotiate[/hyperlink] with <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@DIPLOMATIC_TOKEN_HYPERLINK [whisperingStone/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept]Whispering Stone[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@ENERGY_HYPERLINK [gold/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.GoldConcept]Gold[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@FOOD [food/] Food
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@FOOD_DESCRIPTION [food/] Food is used to gain new {GLOBAL.PopulationConcept.Hyperlink} in your <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> and pay {GLOBAL.PopulationUpkeepConcept.Hyperlink}. Greater [food/] Food income will cause Cities to grow faster.[br/][br/]Gain [food/] Food by:[bulletlist][bullet/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceAnnexationConcept]Annexing[/hyperlink] Pastures.[bullet/]Building Farms and Foresters in <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Building certain <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Collecting <<m:{GLOBAL.PickupConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist][br/]A city with insufficient [food/] food income will suffer from {GLOBAL.StarvationConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@GOLD [gold/] Gold
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@GOLD_DESCRIPTION [gold/] Gold is your material wealth and riches. Used for:[bulletlist][bullet/]Recruiting new <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Paying {GLOBAL.UnitUpkeepConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Building <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist][br/][br/]Gain [gold/] Gold by:[bulletlist][bullet/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceAnnexationConcept]Annexing[/hyperlink] Gold Veins.[bullet/]Building Mines in <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Building certain <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Collecting <<m:{GLOBAL.PickupConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@GOLD_DESCRIPTION_SHORT Used for <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> and building <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@GOLD_HYPERLINK [gold/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.GoldConcept]Gold[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@IMPERIUM [influence/] Imperium
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@IMPERIUM_DESCRIPTION [imperium/] Imperium represents your authority and reputation in the mortal realm.[br/][br/]Used for:[bulletlist][bullet/]Founding <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> from <<m:{GLOBAL.OutpostConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Taking over conquered <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Buying Empire Skills.[/bulletlist][br/]Gain [imperium/] Imperium by developing the {GLOBAL.WizardTowerConcept.Hyperlink} in your {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink} and by [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceAnnexationConcept]annexing[/hyperlink] <<m:{GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@IMPERIUM_HYPERLINK [influence/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept]Imperium[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@INFLUENCE [allegiance/] Whispering Stone Strength
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@INFLUENCE_DESCRIPTION [whisperingStone/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept]Whispering Stones[/hyperlink] have a certain [allegiance/] strength that determines how effective they are at manipulating [minorcity/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept]Free Cities[/hyperlink]. During [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]Negotiations[/hyperlink], [whisperingStone/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept]Whispering Stones[/hyperlink] generate allegiance based on their strength. The higher the strength, the sooner the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.NegotiationConcept]Negotiations[/hyperlink] will succeed.
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@INFLUENCE_HYPERLINK [allegiance/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.InfluenceConcept]Whispering Stone Strength[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@KNOWLEDGE [knowledge/] Knowledge
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@KNOWLEDGE_DESCRIPTION [knowledge/] Knowledge is the collective arcane wisdom of your sages and wisemen, as they explore the secrets of the magical <<m:{GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]Used for researching <<m:{GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}>> and other skills from <<m:{GLOBAL.TomeConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]If there is no active research, then leftover [knowledge/] Knowledge will be kept as {GLOBAL.SurplusConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Gain [knowledge/]Knowledge by:[bulletlist][bullet/]Building Research Posts in <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Building certain <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Collecting <<m:{GLOBAL.PickupConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@KNOWLEDGE_HYPERLINK [knowledge/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.KnowledgeConcept]Knowledge[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@MANA [mana/] Mana
INTERFACE@RESOURCE_ITEM@MANA_DESCRIPTION [mana/] Mana is the raw source of magic. Used for:[bulletlist][bullet/]Casting <<m:{GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Summoning magical <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Paying {GLOBAL.UnitUpkeepConcept.Hyperlink}.[/bulletlist][br/]Gain [mana/] Mana by:[bulletlist][bullet/][hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceAnnexationConcept]Annexing[/hyperlink] Mana Nodes.[bullet/]Building Conduits in <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Building certain <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Collecting <<m:{GLOBAL.PickupConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist]

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_AUDIO@EVENTS_TOOLTIP Adjust the sound level of the event notification effects, such as when a new round starts.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_AUDIO@INTERFACE_TOOLTIP Adjust the sound level of the interface events, such as when a button is clicked.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_AUDIO@MASTER_VOLUME_TOOLTIP Adjust the Master Volume. This controls the overall volume of in-game audio.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_AUDIO@MUSIC_TOOLTIP Adjust the sound level of the music that plays on the World Map and during Combat.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_AUDIO@MUTE_BACKGROUND_TOOLTIP Set whether game audio should be muted when the game window is out of focus. Certain notification sounds will remain active.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@COMBAT_ANIMATION_SPEED_TOOLTIP When enabled, all combat actions are played at maximum playback speed for all players and the speed control panel will be hidden.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@COMBAT_INTRO_TOOLTIP When enabled, the camera pans across the battlefield at the start of combat to show the location of the battle and the units participating.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@EDGE_SCROLLING Edge Scrolling
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@EDGE_SCROLLING_TOOLTIP When enabled, pan across the map when moving your mouse to the edge of the screen.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@INVERT_X_AXIS_TOOLTIP When enabled, the Camera will move left when the given input is right.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@INVERT_Y_AXIS_TOOLTIP When enabled, the Camera will move up when the given input is down.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@LANGUAGE_TOOLTIP Set your preferred language. This changes the language of Text and Subtitles.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@LOCK_MOUSE_TOOLTIP When enabled, the mouse will be locked to the game window.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@MAP_SCROLL_SPEED_TOOLTIP Adjust the speed at which the camera pans across the map.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@OBSERVE_MODE_TOOLTIP When enabled, the camera will focus on automated movement and unit movement occurring within your Vision.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@RECORD_VIDEO_TOOLTIP When enabled the game will record the most recent gameplay actions to include in Automated Crash & Bug Reports.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@REFLECTIONS_TOOLTIP When enabled, reflections of objects are rendered on the surface of the water.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@TUTORIAL_SETTING Help Message Settings
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GAMEPLAY@TUTORIAL_SETTING_TOOLTIP Set the amount of advice messages the game will provide you:

Full Tutorial and Advice - All help messages will appear to help you learn how to play Age of Wonders 4. The tutorial explains the basics and will include beginner's advice messages.

Advice Only - Important advice will appear as you play, to help you play more effectively.

Off - No advice messages will appear.

INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@RENDER_SCALE_TOOLTIP Adjust the resolution the game world will be rendered at. Select a lower render scale for better performance, but blurrier visuals.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@SHADOW_QUALITY Shadow Quality
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@SHADOW_QUALITY_TOOLTIP Set the quality level of shadow detail and smoothness of shadows cast by models.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@SOFT_PARTICLES Soft Particles
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@SOFT_PARTICLES_TOOLTIP When enabled, particles fade out when they intersect with other models so that there is no hard intersection.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@SOIL_COVER Soil Cover Quality
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@SOIL_COVER_TOOLTIP Set the quality level at which vegetation and other small details in Combat are rendered. This adjusts the distance and density.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@SSAO_QUALITY SSAO Quality
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@SSAO_QUALITY_TOOLTIP Set the quality level of object self shadowing details.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@TERRAIN Terrain Quality
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@TERRAIN_TOOLTIP Set the quality level of terrain geometry.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@TEXTURE_QUALITY Texture Quality
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@TEXTURE_QUALITY_TOOLTIP Set the quality level of texture detail on surfaces.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@VOLUMETRICS Volumetric Lighting
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@VOLUMETRICS_TOOLTIP When enabled, light shafts can appear in certain areas to improve scene ambiance.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@VSYNC VSync
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_GRAPHICS@VSYNC_TOOLTIP Set the level of VSync. This locks the game's framerate to your monitor's refresh rate and prevents screen tearing. Use this if you experience frame stutter or system instability at full refresh rate.

OFF - Disables VSync
OFF (NO TEARING) - Disables framerate locking but prevents screen tearing
FULL - Set the game framerate at 100% of your monitor's refresh rate
HALF - Set the game framerate at 50% of your monitor's refresh rate
THIRD - Set the game framerate at 33% of your monitor's refresh rate
QUARTER - Set the game framerate at 25% of your monitor's refresh rate

Off: Only players on the same platform can join multiplayer games.
Full: Players on all platforms can join multiplayer games.
INTERFACE@SETTINGS_ONLINE@CROSSPLAY_TOOLTIP_XBOX When enabled multiplayer games can be hosted for and joined by players on different platforms.

Off: Only players on the same platform can join multiplayer games.
Limited: Only players using Xbox network can join multiplayer games.
Full: Players on all platforms can join multiplayer games.

INTERFACE@SIEGE@ATTACKER_INSTRUCTIONS We must first [abilityblue]Breach the Wall[/abilityblue] before our armies can move and attack the {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}! Use {GLOBAL.SiegeProjectConcept.Hyperlink}s to speed up the siege or grant advantages in battle.[br/]Each slot holds 1 siege project and cannot be changed after the first turn of sieging.

INTERFACE@SIEGE@COMBAT_READY_EVENT Breach is made in the siege of {Structure.Name}!
INTERFACE@SIEGE@DEFENDER_INSTRUCTIONS The enemy must first [abilityblue]Breach the Wall[/abilityblue] before they can attack the {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}! They will use <<m:{GLOBAL.SiegeProjectConcept.Hyperlink}>> listed above to speed up the siege, disable <<m:{GLOBAL.CityDefenseStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>> or grant advantages during combat.[br/]While besieged, the {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} suffers economically, but can still recruit units!
INTERFACE@SIEGE@EST_BREACH Estimated breach
INTERFACE@SIEGE@LEAVE_SIEGE Leaving Siege Area

INTERFACE@SIEGE@SIEGE_DEFENDER Siege Defender

INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@ANCIENT_WONDER Ancient Wonder
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@ANCIENT_WONDER_DESCRIPTION An Ancient Wonder is a {GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink} that contains adventure and rewards. It can only be explored by a single {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} led by a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]When cleared, it can be annexed by a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}. When annexed it will provide {GLOBAL.CityIncomeConcept.Hyperlink} and special <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> in the {GLOBAL.RequestMilitaryAidConcept.Hyperlink}. An annexed Ancient Wonder counts as a type of {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Ancient Wonders can be [siteBronze/]Bronze, [siteSilver/]Silver, or [siteGold/]Gold, depending on rarity, difficulty and value.
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@ANCIENT_WONDER_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept]Ancient Wonder[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@BASE_IMPROVEMENT_DESCRIPTION [bullet/]Meeting the {GLOBAL.BoostConcept.Hyperlink} requirement for <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Adjacency bonuses of <<m:{GLOBAL.SpecialImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Bonuses that scale over specific province improvement types in the {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@CITY_CENTER City Center
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@CITY_CENTER_DESCRIPTION The {GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink} on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink} which lies at the origin of the {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} Domain.

INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@HUT_HYPERLINK [hut/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.HutConcept]Hut[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@INFESTATION Infestation
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@INFESTATION_DESCRIPTION Areas under the control of <<m:{GLOBAL.MarauderConcept.Hyperlink}>>, who increase in numbers and over time take over adjacent <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>. They will periodically send forth raiding parties that can potentially start a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink} on a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} without needing a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Destroying the {GLOBAL.InfestationSpawnerConcept.Hyperlink} will clear the infestation and grant the destroyer great rewards based on tier and size of the Infestation.[br/][br/]When an Infestation grows into one of your <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>, it will continuously [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PillagingConcept]pillage[/hyperlink] its {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink} until the {GLOBAL.InfestationSpawnerConcept.Hyperlink} is destroyed.[br/][br/]Infestations have several states, its {GLOBAL.InfestationSpawnerConcept.Hyperlink} will indicate its current state, and each state will take several <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> to activate:[bulletlist][bullet/][infestationDormant/] Deep Sleep/Sleeping/Awakening. The infestation will become active.[bullet/][infestationPatrolling/] Patrolling. The infestation will patrol its domain.[bullet/][infestationInvasion/] Invasion. A raiding party will emerge.[bullet/][infestationRecovering/] Recovering. The infestation will reinforce its patrolling armies.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@INFESTATION_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.InfestationConcept]Infestation[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@INFESTATION_SPAWNER Infestation Spawner
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@INFESTATION_SPAWNER_DESCRIPTION An Infestation Spawner is a {GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink} that causes an {GLOBAL.InfestationConcept.Hyperlink} to take place.
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@INFESTATION_SPAWNER_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.InfestationSpawnerConcept]Infestation Spawner[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@LOCATION Location
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@LOCATION_DESCRIPTION A special building or site on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}, such as a watchtower, gold vein or bandit lair.[br/][bulletlist][bullet/]Guarded locations can be conquered to earn rewards.[bullet/]Take ownership of a location by moving <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> onto to it.[bullet/]Many locations give <<m:{GLOBAL.ResourceConcept.Hyperlink}>> when within a city's domain.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@LOCATION_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.LocationConcept]Location[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@MAGIC_MATERIAL_DESCRIPTION Magic Materials are <<m:{GLOBAL.NodeConcept.Hyperlink}>> that provide bonus effects to your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}, as well as provide {GLOBAL.CityIncomeConcept.Hyperlink}. These bonus effects can be traded to other <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]If all Magic Materials of the type are collected, they will provide an additional powerful bonus. The following bonuses are available:[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.TOKENSETBONUS.IMPERIAL_ESSENCE.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.TOKENSETBONUS.COSMICFLUX_ELIXIR.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.TOKENSETBONUS.RINGS_OF_BINDING.Hyperlink}[/bulletlist]

INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@PICKUP Pickup
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@PICKUP_DESCRIPTION One-time {GLOBAL.ResourceConcept.Hyperlink} packs on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}. Their rewards can be acquired by moving an {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} onto them.[br/][br/]A Pickup is removed once its rewards are collected.

INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@PROVINCE_ANNEX_DESCRIPTION Province Annexation is the process of expanding your {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink} by building a {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@PROVINCE_DESCRIPTION An area on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink} marked by borders.[br/][br/]Provinces:[bulletlist][bullet/]Have <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceFeatureConcept.Hyperlink}>>, which determine the <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> that can be built there.[bullet/]Can be [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceAnnexationConcept]annexed[/hyperlink] to a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} by building a {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink} within.[bullet/]May contain <<m:{GLOBAL.NodeConcept.Hyperlink}>>, <<m:{GLOBAL.PickupConcept.Hyperlink}>>, or an {GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@PROVINCE_FEATURE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceFeatureConcept]Province Feature[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@PROVINCE_IMPROVEMENT Province Improvement
INTERFACE@STRATEGIC_MAP@PROVINCE_IMPROVEMENT_DESCRIPTION Structures that a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} builds in a {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink} to add that province to its {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Different improvements are available in a province depending on what <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceFeatureConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink}>> are within it.[br/][br/]A city can support one improvement for each {GLOBAL.PopulationConcept.Hyperlink} it has after the first one.

INTERFACE@TEXT@AFFINITY_DESCRIPTION The Affinity of an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} is an indication of its strengths, specializations, and available <<m:{GLOBAL.TomeConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]The Affinity types are:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.OrderConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.ChaosConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.NatureConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.MateriumConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.AstralConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.ShadowConcept.Hyperlink}[/bulletlist][br/][br/]Starting Affinity points are determined by faction creation choices. Affinity points are obtained by selecting the respective <<m:{GLOBAL.TomeConcept.Hyperlink}>> during {GLOBAL.ResearchConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Having more Affinity points will increase the rate at which you unlock new <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireSkillConcept.Hyperlink}>> in {GLOBAL.EmpireDevelopmentConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]{req} Affinity points of one type are required for the Affinity's respective Tier {tier} <<m:{GLOBAL.TomeConcept.Hyperlink}>> and {req2} Affinity points of one type are required for the Affinity's Tier {tier2} Tome. They are required for reaching the {GLOBAL.MagicVictoryConcept.Hyperlink}.

INTERFACE@TEXT@CHAOS_DESCRIPTION {LOC.INTERFACE@TEXT@CHAOS_SHARED}[br/][br/]As {GLOBAL.GovernorConcept.Hyperlink}: Modifies the {GLOBAL.UnitProductionConcept.Hyperlink} income of their city by {GovernorValue} per point.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CHAOS_EMPIRE_DESCRIPTION {LOC.INTERFACE@TEXT@CHAOS_SHARED}[br/][br/]Chaos Affinity is opposed by {GLOBAL.OrderConcept.Hyperlink}. {LOC.INTERFACE@TEXT@SHARED_OPPOSING_AFFINITY}

INTERFACE@TEXT@CITIES Cities
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY City
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_AWAITS_FATE_EVENT A city awaits its fate
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_BATTLEMENT_STRUCTURE Battlement Structure
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_BATTLEMENT_STRUCTURE_DESCRIPTION Battlement Structures are a type of {GLOBAL.CityDefenseStructureConcept.Hyperlink} which spawns Battlement obstacles directly behind the walls in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} during a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Battlement obstacles provide buffs for units standing inside them.[br/][br/]When multiple Battlement Structures are built, only the most powerful Battlement obstacles will be present in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_BATTLEMENT_STRUCTURE_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityBattlementStructureConcept]Battlement Structure[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_CAP City Cap
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_CAP_DESCRIPTION The number of <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} can control.[br/][br/]Exceeding your City Cap results in {incomepercentage} {GLOBAL.CityIncomeConcept.Hyperlink} to all your <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> for each {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} above City Cap.[br/][br/]Your City Cap can be increased through {GLOBAL.EmpireDevelopmentConcept.Hyperlink}
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_CAP_DESCRIPTION_SHORT The number of <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> you can control without suffering economic penalties.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_CAP_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityCapConcept]City Cap[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_DEFENSE_STRUCTURE City Defense Structure
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_DEFENSE_STRUCTURE_DESCRIPTION City Defense Structures are <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>> that typically grant {GLOBAL.FortificationHealthConcept.Hyperlink} and provide defensive benefits in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} during a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]There are different types of Defense Structures:[bulletlist][bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.CityWallStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.CityTowerStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.CitySupportStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.CityBattlementStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_DEFENSE_STRUCTURE_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityDefenseStructureConcept]City Defense Structure[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_DESCRIPTION Cities are located on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}. Cities are built by upgrading an {GLOBAL.OutpostConcept.Hyperlink} or conquered through {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]A city may either belong to an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} or be a{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]The {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink} of a city expands according to its {GLOBAL.PopulationConcept.Hyperlink}. Cities provide {GLOBAL.CityIncomeConcept.Hyperlink}, which can be improved by adding <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_DETAILS City Information
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_FOUND_COST Cost of founding a new city:
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityConcept]City[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_HYPERLINK_PLURAL <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_INCOME City Income
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_INCOME_DESCRIPTION City Income is the amount of <<m:{GLOBAL.ResourceConcept.Hyperlink}>> a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} generates each {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_INCOME_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityIncomeConcept]City Income[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_MORALE [happiness/] City Stability
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_MORALE_DESCRIPTION [happiness/] City Stability represents your overall control over a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][bulletlist][bullet/]High Stability boosts {GLOBAL.FoodConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink} income.[bullet/]Low Stability reduces all {GLOBAL.CityIncomeConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Very Low Stability can lead to the city losing <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist][br/]It drops as the city's {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink} grows, and can be regained by building certain <<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][bulletlist][bullet/]{harmonymin} to {harmonymax}: {GLOBAL.CityStabilityHarmony.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]{ordermin} to {ordermax}: {GLOBAL.CityStabilityOrderly.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]{stablemin} to {stablemax}: {GLOBAL.CityStabilityStable.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]{neutralmin} to {neutralmax}: Neutral.[bullet/]{unstablemin} to {unstablemax}: {GLOBAL.CityStabilityUnstable.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]{unrestmin} to {unrestmax}: {GLOBAL.CityStabilityUnrest.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]{riotmin} to {riotmax}: {GLOBAL.CityStabilityRioting.Hyperlink}.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_MORALE_DESCRIPTION_HARMONY {harmonyvalue} {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.UnitProductionConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.FoodConcept.Hyperlink} income.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_MORALE_DESCRIPTION_ORDERLY {ordervalue} {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.UnitProductionConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.FoodConcept.Hyperlink} income.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_MORALE_DESCRIPTION_RIOTING {riotingvalue} {GLOBAL.CityIncomeConcept.Hyperlink}. There is a chance that the provinces might defect from the city.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_MORALE_DESCRIPTION_STABLE {stablemin} to {stablemax}: Stable. {stablevalue} {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.UnitProductionConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.FoodConcept.Hyperlink} income.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_MORALE_DESCRIPTION_UNREST {unrestvalue} {GLOBAL.CityIncomeConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_MORALE_DESCRIPTION_UNSTABLE {unstablevalue} {GLOBAL.CityIncomeConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_NAME_ALLREADY_EXISTS A city with this name already exists!
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_RUINS City Ruins
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_RUINS_DESCRIPTION Remnants of a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}. Can be rebuilt into a city for a cost.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_RUINS_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityRuinConcept]City Ruin[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_SPELL [caststrategic/] City Spell
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_SPELL@DESCRIPTION [bulletlist][bullet/]Can affect the targeted city and its domain.[bullet/]Costs {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink} and <<m:{GLOBAL.WorldMapCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_SPELL@HYPERLINK [caststrategic/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CitySpellConcept]City Spell[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_STABILITY_HARMONY_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityStabilityHarmony]Harmony[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_STABILITY_HYPERLINK [happiness/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityStabilityConcept]City Stability[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_STABILITY_ORDERLY_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityStabilityOrderly]Orderly[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_STABILITY_RIOTING_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityStabilityRioting]Rioting[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_STABILITY_STABLE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityStabilityStable]Stable[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_STABILITY_UNREST_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityStabilityUnrest]Unrest[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_STABILITY_UNSTABLE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityStabilityUnstable]Unstable[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_STRUCTURE City Structure
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_STRUCTURE_DESCRIPTION City Structures provide economic bonuses for the {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} they are built in.[br/][br/]They usually cost {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.GoldConcept.Hyperlink}, and are built using the {GLOBAL.StructureQueueConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_STRUCTURE_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept]City Structure[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_SUPPORT_STRUCTURE Support Structure
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_SUPPORT_STRUCTURE_DESCRIPTION Support Structures are a type of {GLOBAL.CityDefenseStructureConcept.Hyperlink} which adds <<m:{GLOBAL.CombatEnchantmentConcept.Hyperlink}>> to the {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} in a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]These <<m:{GLOBAL.CombatEnchantmentConcept.Hyperlink}>> add tactical benefits to the Defender in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Multiple Support Structures can be built and active in one {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_SUPPORT_STRUCTURE_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CitySupportStructureConcept]Support Structure[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_TOWER_STRUCTURE Tower Structure
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_TOWER_STRUCTURE_DESCRIPTION Tower Structures are a type of {GLOBAL.CityDefenseStructureConcept.Hyperlink} which spawns Tower units in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} during a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/]Tower units are typically long range units that cannot move and act automatically.[br/][br/]When multiple Tower Structures are built, only the most powerful Tower units will be present in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_TOWER_STRUCTURE_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityTowerStructureConcept]Tower Structure[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_UNDER_SIEGE_EVENT {CityUnderSiege.Name} is under siege!
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_WALL_STRUCTURE Wall Structure
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_WALL_STRUCTURE_DESCRIPTION Wall Structures are a type of {GLOBAL.CityDefenseStructureConcept.Hyperlink} which adds the requirement to {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink} the {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} before hostile armies can attack.[br/][br/]They also define the Wall obstacles present in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} during a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]When multiple Wall Structures are present, only the strongest Wall obstacle is present in combat.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CITY_WALL_STRUCTURE_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityWallStructureConcept]Wall Structure[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CLOSE Close

INTERFACE@TEXT@COMBAT Combat
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMBAT_ENCHANTMENT [casttactical/] Combat Enchantment
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMBAT_ENCHANTMENT@DESCRIPTION A type of {GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink} that affects the entire battlefield.[br/][br/]While active, the spell triggers an effect at the start of the caster's {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}.
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMBAT_ENCHANTMENT@HYPERLINK [casttactical/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CombatEnchantmentConcept]Combat Enchantment[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMBAT_MAP_SPELLS_DESCRIPTION These are <<m:{GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}>> that are cast during {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}, using <<m:{GLOBAL.CombatCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]Types of Combat Spells are:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.BuffSpellConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.CombatEnchantmentConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.CombatSummonSpellConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.DamageSpellConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.DebuffSpellConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.HealingSpellConcept.Hyperlink}[/bulletlist]
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMBAT_MAP_SPELLS_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CombatSpellConcept]Combat Spell[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMBAT_SPELLS Combat Spell
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMBAT_SUMMON_SPELL [casttactical/] Combat Summon Spell
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMBAT_SUMMON_SPELL@DESCRIPTION A type of {GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink} that summons a {GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink} with {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.MAGIC_ORIGIN.Hyperlink} onto any hex during {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Units summoned in this way die when combat ends.
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMBAT_SUMMON_SPELL@HYPERLINK [casttactical/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CombatSummonSpellConcept]Combat Summon Spell[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMPARE Compare
INTERFACE@TEXT@COMPARE_HERO_ITEMS Hold alt to compare
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_DESTINY_TRAIT@DESCRIPTION When a race adapts to its surroundings and the actions of their [hyperlink,GLOBAL.KeeperConcept]race keeper[/hyperlink], the race council may decide to proclaim a new era for their people. When they do, they approach the race keeper in an event, where it is decided if this change will manifest into a destiny trait.[br/][br/]Destiny traits change a race's {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} or {GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept.Hyperlink} and need to be accepted with care, since they come with an inherent up- and downside.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_DESTINY_TRAIT@NAME Racial Destiny Traits
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_DESTINY_TRAIT_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DestinyTraitConcept]Destiny Traits[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_EMPIRE_DEVELOPMENT Empire Development
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_EMPIRE_DEVELOPMENT_DESCRIPTION Contains <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireSkillConcept.Hyperlink}>> that can improve your empire's economy and unlock important abilities such as Seafaring and Tunneling.[br/][br/]<<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireSkillConcept.Hyperlink}>> become available when enough Affinity Progress has been attained towards that particular {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink}. Available <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireSkillConcept.Hyperlink}>> can be unlocked at any time by paying their {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink} cost.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_EMPIRE_DEVELOPMENT_DISABLED {GLOBAL.EmpireDevelopmentConcept.Hyperlink} is unavailable for {turnDelay} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_EMPIRE_DEVELOPMENT_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireDevelopmentConcept]Empire Development[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_EMPIRE_SKILL Empire Skill
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_EMPIRE_SKILL_DESCRIPTION Unlocks Empire-wide bonuses or grants powerful one-off rewards. Acquired via {GLOBAL.EmpireDevelopmentConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Empire Skills require certain levels of {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} to unlock.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_EMPIRE_SKILL_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireSkillConcept]Empire Skill[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_SPEED_MARCH Forced March
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_SPEED_MARCH_DESCRIPTION Forced March can be used to force your units to move further on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept} than they would normally be able to in a single {GLOBAL.TurnConcept}.[br/][br/]When Forced March is activated units gain {Movepointgain}% of their <<m:{GLOBAL.MovePointConcept}>> but lose {Healthloss}% of their current <<m:{GLOBAL.HitPointConcept}>>. They also become {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.EXHAUSTED.Hyperlink} for {ExhaustedTurns} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept}>>. Forced March costs {Manacost} {GLOBAL.ManaConcept} per unit in the army.[br/][br/]The ability to use Forced March can be unlocked through {GLOBAL.EmpireDevelopmentConcept.Hyperlink} .
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONCEPT_SPEED_MARCH_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SpeedMarchConcept]Forced March[/hyperlink]

INTERFACE@TEXT@CONTACT_INFO_DESCRIPTION Receive direct contact information for another {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} of the {Race.Name} race and establish a relationship. Their location in the realm will not be revealed, but diplomatic interactions and effects will be enabled.
INTERFACE@TEXT@CONTACT_INFO_DESCRIPTION_COLONIES Receive direct contact information for another {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} of the {Race.Name} race and establish a relationship. Making contact will reveal {NumCities} <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> belonging to the target Ruler and diplomatic interactions and effects will be enabled.

INTERFACE@TEXT@EQUIPMENT@DESCRIPTION Equipment is items such as weapons and armor that <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}>> can equip to gain bonuses and abilities in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} or in the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Equipment can typically be gained from <<m:{GLOBAL.PickupConcept.Hyperlink}>>, <<m:{GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}>>, and Quests.[br/][br/]Equipment that is not equipped is shared between the Ruler and all Heroes of the same Empire.[br/][br/]Rulers and Heroes have a number of equipment slots where 1 equipment item can be assigned of the corresponding type.[br/][br/]Types of equipment slots are:[bulletlist][bullet/]Primary [bullet/]Secondary [bullet/]Head [bullet/]Torso [bullet/]Legs [bullet/]Mount [bullet/]Ring [bullet/]Miscellaneous [/bulletlist]

INTERFACE@TEXT@EXCAVATION_DESCRIPTION Excavation is a {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept} ability available to <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> which allows them to dig through tunnels and clear out <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>> in the {GLOBAL.UndergroundConcept.Hyperlink} that lies underneath [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ProvinceFeatureConcept]Earthen[/hyperlink] terrain.[br/][br/]Excavation can open up new paths, uncover buried [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PickupConcept]Treasure[/hyperlink], or even discover hidden <<m:{GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink}>>.

INTERFACE@TEXT@FOG_OF_WAR Fog of War
INTERFACE@TEXT@FOG_OF_WAR_DESCRIPTION Hexes on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink} that have been previously revealed but you currently have no vision of through <<m:{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}>> or <<m:{GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink}>> owned by you are covered by Fog of War.[br/][br/]Hexes within Fog of War appear darker than when revealed by vision, but will still reveal terrain types, roads and <<m:{GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink}>>. Neutral and Hostile <<m:{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}>> are not visible within Fog of War unless sensed by {GLOBAL.SensorRangeConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Through <<m:{GLOBAL.TreatyConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.PvEDiplStateConcept.Hyperlink}>> you may reveal other <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>. But they will still be covered by Fog of War.

This cost increases the more <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} contains.

INTERFACE@TEXT@KEEPER Keeper
INTERFACE@TEXT@KEEPER_DESCRIPTION The Race Keeper is the {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} whose {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} has the biggest presence of a race, through owned <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.PvEVassalConcept.Hyperlink}>>. You are always the Keeper of the race you start with.[br/][br/]To become the Keeper of a Race you need to have {GLOBAL.MISC.RACE_POPULATION_THRESHOLD}% of the race's {GLOBAL.PopulationConcept.Hyperlink} in your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}. If the race already has a Race Keeper you need {GLOBAL.MISC.RACE_POPULATION_OVERTAKE_THRESHOLD}{GLOBAL.PopulationConcept.Hyperlink} more than them to take it from them.[br/][br/]To become the Keeper of another player's starting race the player would have to be defeated first.[br/][br/]The Race Keeper is the only {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} who can apply <<m:{GLOBAL.MajorRaceTransformationConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.MinorRaceTransformationConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INTERFACE@TEXT@KEEPER_HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.KeeperConcept]Keeper[/hyperlink]

INTERFACE@TEXT@MEET_PLAYER Meet Ruler
INTERFACE@TEXT@MET_PLAYER_WHILE_CONCEALED Diplomatic interactions have not been triggered and the other Ruler is unaware of our presence. We can choose to engage with and meet the Ruler or to remain concealed.[br/][br/]This message will be shown only once. Remaining concealed means you will need to meet the Ruler through other means or by standing adjacent to them.
INTERFACE@TEXT@MILITARYAID Rally of the Lieges
INTERFACE@TEXT@MILITARYAID_AVAILABLE Cities that are loyal to you have put forward a list of draftable units.
INTERFACE@TEXT@MILITARYAID_BOOST Muster the Lieges {CostString}
INTERFACE@TEXT@MILITARYAID_BOOST_TOOLTIP [tooltipHeader]Muster the Lieges[/tooltipHeader][br/]Costs: {CostString}[br/][br/]This reduces the time until the next [hyperlink,GLOBAL.RequestMilitaryAidConcept]Rally[/hyperlink] starts by {Reduction}[turn/], which costs {CostString}. The cost is determined by the number of [recruitmentPoints/] you have and the duration until the next Rally. After the boost, the remaining duration will be {RemainingTurns}[turn/].
INTERFACE@TEXT@MILITARYAID_BOOST_WARNING_ALREADYBOOSTED [fireCol]Cannot Boost: Already boosted! You can boost again when the next Rally starts[/fireCol]

INTERFACE@TEXT@PANTHEON_INTRO_DESC {GLOBAL.MagehavenLoreConcept.Hyperlink} is a sanctuary between worlds. From here, powerful Rulers called [hyperlink,GLOBAL.GodirLoreConcept]Godir[/hyperlink] venture to realms within the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AstralSeaLoreConcept]Astral Sea[/hyperlink].

As you conquer realms, other Godir will gather in Magehaven and join your Pantheon.
You will also gather Pantheon Experience, which unlocks new options for creating your Godir and their followers. Your Pantheon will tell your story of the Fourth Age of Wonders.

Step through the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.WorldGateLoreConcept]World Gate[/hyperlink]. Your first adventure awaits!

INTERFACE@TEXT@RULER_VOID Ruler in the Void
INTERFACE@TEXT@RULER_VOID_DESCRIPTION When a {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} perishes during battle or otherwise, they will be cast into the {GLOBAL.AstralVoidLoreConcept.Hyperlink}. If that Ruler still holds their {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink}, they will materialize there in 3 <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>>. If that Ruler has lost their {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink}, their {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} is defeated. While in the Void, the Ruler's empire is in chaos and subject to the following penalties:[bulletlist][bullet/]-20 {GLOBAL.CityStabilityConcept.Hyperlink} in each city.[bullet/]Governor bonuses are not applied.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.ResearchConcept.Hyperlink} is paused.[bullet/]No <<m:{GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}>> can be cast.[bullet/]Active {GLOBAL.MagicVictoryConcept.Hyperlink} spells are canceled and their progress reset.[/bulletlist]

INTERFACE@TEXT@SCOUT_PROSPECTING@DESCRIPTION When Industrious <<m:{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.SCOUT_UNIT.Hyperlink}>> stand within a friendly or neutral {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink} that contains a Cliff, Mountain or Stalagmite, the player that owns the {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.SCOUT_UNIT.Hyperlink} can prospect the {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink} for {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink} or {GLOBAL.GoldConcept.Hyperlink} rewards.[br/][br/]Each {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink} can only be prospected once.

INTERFACE@TEXT@SIDE Realm Quests
INTERFACE@TEXT@SIEGE@DESCRIPTION If a {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} has a {GLOBAL.CityWallStructureConcept.Hyperlink} and you wish to conquer it, you first need to besiege it and breach its defenses.[br/][br/]A Siege can be initiated by attacking any of the 7 {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} hexes with at least 1 {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} led by a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink} which must remain adjacent to the city until the siege is completed or else the Siege is lifted.[br/][br/]While sieging the City's {GLOBAL.FortificationHealthConcept.Hyperlink} is lowered by the besieger's {GLOBAL.FortificationDamageConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/] <<m:{GLOBAL.SiegeProjectConcept.Hyperlink}>> can be used to speed up the siege by dealing more {GLOBAL.FortificationDamageConcept.Hyperlink}. They can also remove defenses and give the besieger an advantage.[br/][br/]Once {GLOBAL.FortificationHealthConcept.Hyperlink} reaches 0, the attacker can move into the {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} for a decisive battle.
INTERFACE@TEXT@SIEGE@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SiegeConcept]Siege[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@SIEGE@NAME Siege
INTERFACE@TEXT@SIEGE_PROJECT@DESCRIPTION Siege Projects can be used during a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink} to speed up the siege by adding more {GLOBAL.FortificationDamageConcept.Hyperlink}. They can also remove defenses and give the besieger an advantage.[br/][br/]Siege Projects can only be added and removed in the {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink} the {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink} was initiated.[br/][br/]You can only have as many siege projects added as you can have slots. More slots can be gained through <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireSkillConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
INTERFACE@TEXT@SIEGE_PROJECT@HYPERLINK [hyperlink,GLOBAL.SiegeProjectConcept]Siege Project[/hyperlink]
INTERFACE@TEXT@SIEGE_PROJECT@NAME Siege Project

INTERFACE@TEXT@SPECIAL_PROVINCE_IMPROVEMENT_DESCRIPTION Special {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink} are built from the {GLOBAL.ProductionQueueConcept.Hyperlink} and replace an existing {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]Effects can include:[bulletlist][bullet/]Improved income based on adjacent <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} effects in and around the Special Province Improvement.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} spawn points.[bullet/]{GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} visit bonuses.[/bulletlist][br/][br/]Special Province Improvements are unlocked with <<m:{GLOBAL.TomeConcept}>> and cultures.

INTERFACE@TEXT@SPEED_MARCH Activate {GLOBAL.SpeedMarchConcept.Hyperlink}: Units gain {movepoints} of their <<m:{GLOBAL.MovePointConcept}>> but lose {hitpoints} of their current <<m:{GLOBAL.HitPointConcept}>>. They also become {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.EXHAUSTED.Hyperlink} for {turns} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept}>>. Forced March costs {cost} {GLOBAL.ManaConcept} in total.

INTERFACE@TEXT@SURPLUS Surplus
INTERFACE@TEXT@SURPLUS_DESCRIPTION {GLOBAL.KnowledgeConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink} or {GLOBAL.UnitProductionConcept.Hyperlink} that is left over once research, construction or recruitment is completed.[br/][br/]This surplus will automatically be spent on the next item that you choose to research, build or recruit.[br/][br/]Surplus can only be kept for a single {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}

INTERFACE@TEXT@SWITCH_TURN_MODE_SIMULTANIOUS_NEXT_ROUND The turn mode will be changed to Simultaneous Turns in the next round. Do you want to cancel and go back to Classic Turns?

INTERFACE@TEXT@TACTICAL_COMBAT_DESCRIPTION Combat occurs when an {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} encounters an enemy {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}, or while exploring <<m:{GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]Combat occurs on a separate map and is {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}-based.[br/][br/]With the {GLOBAL.ReinforcementRuleConcept.Hyperlink}, up to 6 armies can participate in the battle.[br/][br/]The battle is won by the last combatant that has <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> left.

INTERFACE@TEXT@TOME_DESCRIPTION A Tome is a collection of <<m:{GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}>>, <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> and other skills that you can {GLOBAL.ResearchConcept.Hyperlink}. Tomes also have a {GLOBAL.TomePassiveConcept.Hyperlink} you get for free.[br/][br/]Tier 1 tomes are always available, to unlock higher tier tomes:[bulletlist][bullet/]You must have 2 tomes from the previous tier.[bullet/]Tier 4 tomes require you to have {req} points of a single {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink}.[bullet/]Tier 5 Tomes require you to have {req2} points of a single {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink}.[/bulletlist][br/]Tomes can contain:[bulletlist][bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.SpecialImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept.Hyperlink}>>[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.SiegeProjectConcept.Hyperlink}>>[/bulletlist]

INTERFACE@TEXT@UNIT_ENCHANTMENT@DESCRIPTION A type of {GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink} that grants a bonus to a specific group of your <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> while it is active.[br/][br/]These spells:[bulletlist][bullet/]Affect both existing and newly created units.[bullet/]Increase the [hyperlink,GLOBAL.UnitUpkeepConcept]Upkeep[/hyperlink] of affected units.[bullet/]Can be canceled at any time by the caster.[/bulletlist]

INTERFACE@TEXT@UNIT_UPKEEP_DESCRIPTION Each {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink} on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}, you must pay {GLOBAL.GoldConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink} to maintain your <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>>. If you cannot afford this, your units will lose {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink}![br/][br/]A unit's upkeep depends on: [bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.UnitTierConcept.Hyperlink}[bullet/]<<m:{GLOBAL.UnitEnchantmentConcept.Hyperlink}>>[/bulletlist][br/]Some Empire Skills and Hero Skills can reduce the {GLOBAL.GoldConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink} upkeep, but never below 50% of its value.

INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@DECLARE_WAR_ON_VASSAL_HOUSE The {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} is in a state of [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PvEVassalConcept]Vassalage[/hyperlink], so {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} must be declared on their overlord instead.

INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_ABORTCONVERTBUTTONTOOLTIP This will abort converting this hero to your side. The process will have to begin anew afterwards.
INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_ANIMATETOOLTIP Recruit a hero from your crypt as an undead.
INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_CONVERTBUTTONTOOLTIP Will convert this hero to your side, allows the hero to be recruited upon completion.
INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_EXECUTIONTOOLTIP The hero will be moved to the crypt. Any equipment the hero has goes to your arsenal.
INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_GOVERNINGCITYBUTTONTOOLTIP Show the city this hero governs.
INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_GRANTFREEDOMBUTTONTOOLTIP Send the hero home. Any equipment the hero has goes to your arsenal.
INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_RANSOMREMAINSTOOLTIP Removes this hero from the crypt. Any equipment the hero has goes to your arsenal.
INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_RECRUITBUTTONTOOLTIP Recruit a new hero to your side.
INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_RESURRECTTOOLTIP Resurrect one of your fallen heroes from within your crypt.
INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_SHOWHOMEBUTTONTOOLTIP Show the city this hero calls home.
INTERFACE@TOOLTIP@HEROESOVERVIEW_UNITPANELBUTTONTOOLTIP See more details about this hero.

MAGICMATERIALS@ARCANIUM_ORE@DESCRIPTION Unique global effect: [bulletlist][bullet/]Hurry Recruitment for <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> is {discount} cheaper.[/bulletlist]
MAGICMATERIALS@ARCANIUM_ORE@LORE "When the ancient Titans shaped the world, their sweat would drip onto the primal materials of the earth, fusing the two together into raw Arcanium. Now, whenever a vein is exposed above ground, a strange, ethereal vapor sees prospectors from all over rushing to its location. Its unique composition makes for magical and malleable metal, meaning far quicker production times!"[br/][br/]— Fangir Rockborne, Journals from the Second Age: Part II
MAGICMATERIALS@ARCANIUM_ORE@NAME Arcanium Ore
MAGICMATERIALS@ARCHON_BLOOD@DESCRIPTION Unique global effect: [bulletlist][bullet/]+{CombatCPbonus} <<m:{GLOBAL.CombatCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist]
MAGICMATERIALS@ARCHON_BLOOD@LORE "When the mighty and enigmatic Archons fell in ages past, their blood infused and changed the land in certain places. Now, travelers often report feeling strangely invigorated when crossing this hallowed ground. The mysterious substance found therein can be carefully cultivated and gathered as raw magical power."[br/][br/]— Uncredited Scholar, Remnants of the Archon: Part II
MAGICMATERIALS@ARCHON_BLOOD@NAME Archon Blood
MAGICMATERIALS@ASTRAL_DEW@DESCRIPTION Unique global effect: [bulletlist][bullet/]+{WMapCPbonus} <<m:{GLOBAL.WorldMapCastingPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[/bulletlist]
MAGICMATERIALS@ASTRAL_DEW@LORE "In places where the natural realms and the Astral Sea converge, certain types of flora become infused with arcane properties as they are naturally more susceptible. The dew from this flora is highly sought after by practitioners of magic, as it can act as a catalyst for both spells and research into many kinds of arcana."[br/][br/]— Edward Portsmith, Advanced Reports on Mana Infusion
MAGICMATERIALS@ASTRAL_DEW@NAME Astral Dew

MAGIC_VICTORY@EVENT@DEFEAT_OPPONENT To cancel the impending victory of {Player.Name}, you need to capture one of their provinces that contains one of the three [hyperlink,GLOBAL.RootNodeConcept]Root Nodes[/hyperlink].
MAGIC_VICTORY@EVENT@INITIAL_EVENT_TEXT [hyperlink,GLOBAL.RootNodeConcept]Root Nodes[/hyperlink] have appeared around the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}! Capture and convert these to your main {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} in order to compete for a {GLOBAL.MagicVictoryConcept.Hyperlink}.
MAGIC_VICTORY@EVENT@NODES_CONVERTED_TEXT All Root Nodes have been converted and the Ultimate Spell can now be cast.
MAGIC_VICTORY@EVENT@NODE_CAPTURED_TEXT A Root Node has been captured and your spell was interrupted. Reclaim the Root Node and recast the spell.
MAGIC_VICTORY@MATERIUMRESULT@VICTORY Age of Materium
MAGIC_VICTORY@NATURERESULT@VICTORY Age of Nature
MAGIC_VICTORY@ORDERRESULT@VICTORY Age of Order

MAGIC_VICTORY@SHADOWRESULT@VICTORY Age of Shadow
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@ATTACKERS_SPAWNED Invaders spawned
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@AWAIT_COUNTDOWN Defend your Affinity Province Improvements: {INT_Count}/{INT_Total}
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@BUILD_UPGRADES Build the Affinity Province Improvements: {INT_Value}/{INT_Required}
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@DESCRIPTION To achieve the Magic Victory, an {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} needs to build a Seed, Root and Heart <<m:{GLOBAL.AffinityProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>>, unlocked when you choose Tier III, Tier IV and Tier V <<m:{GLOBAL.TomeConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]If all three improvements of the same affinity are built, the Magic Victory Spell is unlocked. Channeling the spell takes {turn} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}>> until victory is achieved, during which hostile armies are spawned next to the improvements in an attempt to destroy them. Losing any of the three improvements cancels the spell.
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@FINISHER_UNLOCKED_SELF {Finisher.Name} unlocked
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@INCREASE_TOME_TIER Research a Tier {INT_Required} Tome
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@INITIAL_EVENT Root Nodes discovered!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@INITIAL_EVENT_EVENT Root Nodes have appeared around the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}! Capture and convert these to your main {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} in order to compete for the {VictoryConditionName}.
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@LAUNCH_FINISHER Launch the {STR_Operation} spell
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@LOSING Destroy {STR_WinningPlayer}'s Affinity Province Improvements {INT_Turns} [turn/]
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NODES_CONVERTED {Player.Name} has converted enough root nodes!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NODES_CONVERTED_EVENT {Player.Name} has converted the required amount of Root Nodes to cast their {Finisher.Name} spell!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NODES_CONVERTED_SELF You have converted enough root nodes!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NODES_CONVERTED_SELF_EVENT {Player.Name} has converted enough Root Nodes!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NODE_CAPTURED A Root Node is occupied!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NODE_CAPTURED_EVENT A Root Node or its province has been occupied by a hostile {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink}. The casting of the {Finisher.Name} spell has been paused until control over the Root Node is restored.
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NODE_LOST {Player.Name} has lost a Root Node!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NODE_LOST_EVENT {Player.Name} has lost a Root Node, and the casting of their {Finisher.Name} spell has been canceled!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NODE_LOST_SELF Root Node Lost!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@NODE_LOST_SELF_EVENT You have lost control over a Root Node, and the casting of the {Finisher.Name} spell has been canceled!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@REGAIN_CONTROL Regain control of the Affinity Province Improvements
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@SPELL_CANCELLED_OTHER {Player.Name}'s {Finisher.Name} has been canceled
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@SPELL_CANCELLED_SELF {Finisher.Name} has been canceled
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@SPELL_CAST {Player.Name} has cast the final spell for {VictoryConditionName}!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@SPELL_CAST_EVENT {Player.Name} has started casting the {Finisher.Name} spell and is on their way to win the game through {VictoryConditionName}![br/][br/]The {Finisher.Name} spell can be paused by occupying one of the <<m:{GLOBAL.AffinityProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[br/][br/]To cancel the casting of the {Finisher.Name} spell, you need to [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PillagingConcept]Pillage[/hyperlink] it.
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@SPELL_CAST_SELF You have cast the final spell for {VictoryConditionName}!
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@SPELL_CAST_SELF_EVENT You have cast the {Finisher.Name} spell and are approaching the {VictoryConditionName}![br/][br/]Maintain control over all three {GLOBAL.AffinityProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink} until the spell has finished casting to achieve victory!

MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@UPGRADE_BUILT_SELF You have built a {Upgrade.Name}
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@UPGRADE_LOST_OTHER {Player.Name}'s {Upgrade.Name} was lost
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@UPGRADE_LOST_SELF {Upgrade.Name} lost
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@UPGRADE_OCCUPIED_SELF Your {Upgrade.Name} has been occupied
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@UPGRADE_UNLOCKED_SELF Unlocked {Upgrade.Name} Affinity Province Improvement
MAGIC_VICTORY@VICTORY_CONDITION@VICTORY_IMMINENT_OTHER {Player.Name} will achieve Magic Victory in 5 turns

META_EMPIRE@PROGRESSION_ITEM@CULTURE_TRAIT_WIZARD@EFFECT2_DESCRIPTION <<m:{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BATTLE_MAGE.Hyperlink}>> have {rank} Rank
META_EMPIRE@PROGRESSION_ITEM@CULTURE_TRAIT_WIZARD@LORE They have embraced magic to a degree few can match, gaining more than most from its prowess... but becoming dependent on its marvel in return.

META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_DEMON_PRINCE@RACE_BIO Karavar the Willbreaker earned his name through many conquests. Where his brethren might prefer manipulation or subterfuge, Karavar prefers violent domination. War is in his nature, and he engages in it like a bird engages in flight.[br/][br/]The [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ObbadothLoreConcept]Obbadothan[/hyperlink] Orcs are an unusual people, demons of warfare, standing taller than their rivals through fell magic that enhance their strength. They are brutal, if simple people, perfect tools for their Demon Prince’s conquests.
