META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PEACEFUL_LANDS@NAME Peaceful Lands
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@DESCRIPTION The kingdom that once dominated this realm has fallen, and 3 successors lay claim to the throne of this once prosperous kingdom.[bulletlist][bullet/]The Pretender Kings {PRETENDER_KINGS_FEUDAL_LEADER_1.Hyperlink}, {PRETENDER_KINGS_FEUDAL_LEADER_2.Hyperlink} and {PRETENDER_KINGS_DARK_LEADER_1.Hyperlink} start with {AdditionalCities} additional <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.[bullet/]Each Pretender King starts at {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} with the other Pretender Kings.[bullet/]Whoever forms an alliance with or defeats each Pretender King is [abilityblue]Victorious[abilityblue/].[/bulletlist]
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_1@CUSTOM_TITLE_1 Rightful King of Vossin
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_1@CUSTOM_TITLE_1@GENDER ^m
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_1@CUSTOM_TITLE_2 Warrior King of Vossin
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_1@CUSTOM_TITLE_2@GENDER ^m
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_1@CUSTOM_TITLE_3 Inheritor King of Vossin
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_1@CUSTOM_TITLE_3@GENDER ^m
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_1@FIRST_NAME Darman^M
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_1@LAST_NAME Voss^z
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_1@RACE_BIO Darman Voss is the rightful heir according to many, a weakling not worth following according to others. He refused to act when his brother Skogan split from the Kingdom, further fracturing the kingdom as Jarlan went to extreme measures to reunite it. He is a diplomat at heart, seeking peace at any cost, many would think him weak for this, yet the lives of his subjects are prosperous and stable in spite of the kingdom's fracturing.[br/][br/]His Loyalists are a people of principles, lawful to a fault and eager to serve.
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_2@FIRST_NAME Jarlan^M
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_2@RACE_BIO Jarlan Voss, second son of the late king, had no aspiration to rule, but as the kingdom split and his brother refused to take up arms, he took action instead. He was exiled, and now he leads a people seeking the rebirth of Vossin against both his brothers. Jarlan is a warrior through and through, and he vows to not rest until Vossin is whole once more.[br/][br/]Jarlan's Secessionists consist of much of the warrior class of old Vossin. Hardy and dedicated to the cause, they believe in might over diplomatic prattle.
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_3@FIRST_NAME Skogan^M
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@LEADER_3@RACE_BIO Skogan Voss, bastard son of the late king, was shunned by many, but made a name for himself as a powerful healer. He came to lead a faction of devoted healers, but unknown to many he had bigger plans. He would seize his father's kingdom and turn it toward a singular purpose: Ascension. When the time came however, his influence was not as effective as he'd hoped. The secession of the provinces where he held the most sway plunged the kingdom into chaos, now he seeks to reunite the kingdom under his own rule and complete his plan.[br/][br/]Skogan's Fanatics consist of his devout followers, healers, covert agents and ambitious warriors. Each of the Fanatics sees themselves as eventually usurping the position above them, yet direct violence is prohibited, thus schemes and plots are plentiful in their domain.
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@NAME Pretender Kings
META_EMPIRE@TRAIT_PRETENDER_KINGS@OBJECTIVE_1 Defeat or form an Alliance with Darman Voss

NET@ONLINE@AI_BUSY The AI turn is not finished yet. If you exit now, the next player will not be able to play their turn yet. Are you sure?
NET@ONLINE@BUILD_OUTDATED Your game version is out of date. Please update to the latest version in order to continue.
NET@ONLINE@BUILD_PREDATED The game's servers are being updated. Please try again later.
NET@ONLINE@CANNOT_OVERWRITE_RETAIL Overwriting retail sessions is disabled.
NET@ONLINE@CONTENT_CRC_MISMATCH There is a content CRC mismatch.
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@DISALLOWED Cross-platform multiplayer is turned off because there are mods enabled.
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@DISALLOWED_SYSTEM Cross-platform multiplayer has been disabled by the system.
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@REQUEST_DESCRIPTION This game supports cross-platform multiplayer. Do you want to enable playing with others across different platforms?
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@REQUEST_DESCRIPTION_PSN This game supports cross-platform multiplayer. Do you want to enable playing with others outside of PlayStation™Network?
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@REQUEST_DESCRIPTION_XBOX This game supports cross-platform play. Do you want to enable playing with others outside the Xbox network?
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@REQUEST_DISABLE Disable
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@REQUEST_ENABLE Enable
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@REQUEST_TITLE Cross-platform Multiplayer
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@REQUEST_TITLE_XBOX Cross Play
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@REQUEST_XBOX_LIVE_ONLY Xbox network Only
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@WARNING Cross-network play is enabled. Achievements are disabled in this mode.
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@WARNING_PS5 Cross-network play is enabled. Trophies are disabled in this mode.
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@XR-007 Cross-network play is enabled. This means you may interact with players outside the Xbox network. Achievements are disabled in this mode.
NET@ONLINE@CROSSPLAY@XR-007_TITLE Cross-network Play
NET@ONLINE@DEV_CROSSPLAY Crossplay outside of retail, open beta or sandbox builds can be problematic.
NET@ONLINE@DEV_SESSION This is a developer session.
NET@ONLINE@DEV_TYPE_MISMATCH The session will be changed to a different development build type. This may be nonreversible.
NET@ONLINE@DISCONNECTED_FROM_SERVER Lost connection to server!
NET@ONLINE@EMAIL@ASIS Leave as is

NET@ONLINE@EMAIL@REQUEST_TITLE Email turn notifications
NET@ONLINE@EMAIL@UNSPECIFIED Ask on login

NET@ONLINE@MAJOR_VERSION_MISMATCH Major version mismatch detected
NET@ONLINE@MINOR_VERSION_OUTDATED Your game is not up to date
NET@ONLINE@NOT_A_BETA_SESSION The session will be changed to a non-beta session. This may be nonreversible.
NET@ONLINE@NOT_A_BETA_SESSION_BUT_RETAIL The session will be changed to a retail session.
NET@ONLINE@NOT_A_RETAIL_SESSION The session will be changed to a non-retail session. This may be nonreversible.
NET@ONLINE@NOT_A_RETAIL_SESSION_BUT_BETA The session will be changed to a beta session.

NET@ONLINE@PLAYER_LEFT_LOBBY {STR_PlayerName} left

NET@ONLINE@POST_SLOT_FAILED Failed to post multiplayer slot
NET@ONLINE@SESSION_OUTDATED This session is from an older game version. The session will be updated. Normally this cannot be reversed.
NET@ONLINE@TOO_MANY_SESSIONS You are already part of too many sessions
NET@PBEM@TEAM Team

NODES_STRATEGIC@ROOT_NODE@DESCRIPTION A Root Node is a {GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink} where the magical flows of the realm converge into a single source of power. [br/][br/]Root Nodes can be converted to an {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} through a {GLOBAL.WorldSpellConcept.Hyperlink}. Converted Root Nodes give additional resources and contribute to the Magic Victory. {LOC.AFFINITYCONTENT@NODE_CONVERSION@CASUSBELLIWARNING}
NODES_STRATEGIC@ROOT_NODE@LORE As a Godir's might grows, they begin to gain an almost innate understanding and attunement to places of powerful resonance. Root Nodes are physically manifest confluences of ambient magic present throughout the land. The mightiest of Godir can sense these locations and even manipulate and alter the latent magics therein to reflect their own affinities.
NODES_STRATEGIC@ROOT_NODE@NAME Root Node
NODES_STRATEGIC@SHADOW_ROOT_NODE@DESCRIPTION This Root Node has been converted to the {GLOBAL.ShadowConcept.Hyperlink} and is overflowing with power. It will contribute to Magic Victory.
NODES_STRATEGIC@SHADOW_ROOT_NODE@NAME Shadow Root Node
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@ANNEX_EXPLORATION_SITE@DESCRIPTION Now that you have claimed this {GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}, you can add it to your domain by annexing it to a City or an {GLOBAL.OutpostConcept.Hyperlink}. Ancient Wonders provide unique units to the {GLOBAL.RequestMilitaryAidConcept.Hyperlink} as well as large amounts of resource income, including valuable {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink}, when they are added to your empire.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@ANNEX_EXPLORATION_SITE@FINISHER@DESCRIPTION You have annexed an {GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink} which will now provide you with a powerful yield in one of your <<m: {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@ANNEX_EXPLORATION_SITE@NAME Ancient Wonder Annexation
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@ANNEX_EXPLORATION_SITE@OBJECTIVE Annex an Ancient Wonder
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@ANNEX_WATER@DESCRIPTION The domain of one of your cities has expanded to a coastline. Provinces in the water can be annexed like any other province, and the first Province Improvement built in the water will automatically become that city's harbor. The harbor of a city is the location where any new ships that are built in that city will appear. Expanding your city onto the water will unlock further city structures.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@ANNEX_WATER@NAME Rule the Seas
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@ANNEX_WATER@OBJECTIVE Annex a Water Province
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@DIPLOMACY_FIRST_CITY@DESCRIPTION You have found a friendly free city! Now that you have established contact, you may provide them with a {GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept.Hyperlink}. This artifact will sway their relation with you over time, until they are ready to become your vassal.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@DIPLOMACY_FIRST_CITY@NAME Starting Negotiations
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@DIPLOMACY_FIRST_CITY@OBJECTIVE Assign a Whispering Stone
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@EXPAND_ARMY@DESCRIPTION Now that you have a second scout, you will need more powerful armies to claim the valuable locations you may come across in the realm. You can gain access to new kinds of units through research and upgrading your cities. [br/]Bear in mind, Scouts are not meant for combat, so build your {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} wisely.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@EXPAND_ARMY@FINISHER@DESCRIPTION Now that you have a sufficient army, you are ready to expand and conquer. Armies are expensive, so put them to good use. Send them out with a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink} to gain {GLOBAL.ExperienceConcept.Hyperlink} and discover new <<m:{GLOBAL.NodeConcept.Hyperlink}>> or potential {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} locations.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@EXPAND_ARMY@NAME Making a Full Army
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@EXPAND_ARMY@OBJECTIVE Make an army of six units.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@EXPLORATION@DESCRIPTION You are about to begin exploring your surroundings. While the wide world holds plenty of things to find, two of the most valuable places you can come across are <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@EXPLORATION@NAME Exploration
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@EXPLORE_EXPLORATION_SITE@DESCRIPTION You have discovered an {GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}! It now needs to be explored before it can be claimed. Only armies led by a {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink} can explore Ancient Wonders. While exploring, you can encounter obstacles which can be overcome in various ways, though they can always be cleared through {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@EXPLORE_EXPLORATION_SITE@NAME Ancient Wonder Exploration
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@EXPLORE_EXPLORATION_SITE@OBJECTIVE Explore an Ancient Wonder
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@FIND_EXPLORATION_SITE@DESCRIPTION Ancient Wonders are some of the most valuable locations that can be found in a realm. There are three different tiers of Ancient Wonders; bronze, silver and gold. The higher the tier of an Ancient Wonder, the more challenging it will be to claim for your own.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@FIND_EXPLORATION_SITE@NAME The Ancient Wonders
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@FIND_EXPLORATION_SITE@OBJECTIVE Discover an Ancient Wonder
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@FOOD_CITY@DESCRIPTION In order for your cities to grow large and prosperous, it is key that they have enough food income for healthy population growth. To expand on a city's food income, you can build farms in surrounding provinces and build city structures that provide food income.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@FOOD_CITY@NAME A Healthy City
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@FOOD_CITY@OBJECTIVE Improve your Food Income
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@FOUND_CITY@DESCRIPTION Your new Outpost is finished! You can turn it into another city by spending {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink}. Cities develop over time and are the main source of income for your empire. Be mindful of your {GLOBAL.CityCapConcept.Hyperlink} however, as going over this cap will reduce the income of all your cities.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@FOUND_CITY@FINISHER@DESCRIPTION Congratulations, O {PlayerLeader.Title}! Your new city is finished and can start growing. Be aware that {GLOBAL.FoodConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink}, and {GLOBAL.UnitProductionConcept.Hyperlink} are not shared across cities, so each city is responsible for its own growth and construction.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@FOUND_CITY@NAME A New City
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@FOUND_CITY@OBJECTIVE Found a City
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@INFESTATION@DESCRIPTION Infestations are dangerous locations which will continue to send armies your way, burning and pillaging your realm... unless you strike first, of course.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@INFESTATION@NAME The First Infestation
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@INFESTATION@OBJECTIVE Destroy an Infestation
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@INTEGRATE_FREE_CITY@DESCRIPTION You have established your first contact! Once enough {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} is gained with a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} and they have become your {GLOBAL.PvEVassalConcept.Hyperlink}, they can be integrated. [br/][br/] Integrating a free city will turn them into a fully functional city under your direct control. Be mindful of your {GLOBAL.CityCapConcept.Hyperlink} to evaluate whether you want to integrate a free city or keep them as a vassal!
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@INTEGRATE_FREE_CITY@FINISHER@DESCRIPTION A {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} has successfully merged with your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}, granting you a new {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} and a new {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}. If they were of a different origin from you, you will now have access to their units and abilities. You can also migrate your own people, replacing the city's current citizens. This is an [evilact/]evil act, however.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@INTEGRATE_FREE_CITY@NAME Vassal Integration
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@INTEGRATE_FREE_CITY@OBJECTIVE Integrate a Free City
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@LEVEL_HERO@DESCRIPTION Heroes are powerful units just like your Ruler. An army can contain multiple heroes, but be mindful that support hero skills which affect the whole army will only be given to the units of that army by the hero that is the army leader. The highest level of hero will always be the army leader.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@LEVEL_HERO@NAME Worthy Hero
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@LEVEL_HERO@OBJECTIVE Reach Level 5 with a Hero
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@LEVEL_RULER@DESCRIPTION Once your Ruler gains enough experience, they will level up. Each time they level up, you may pick a single hero skill in either Warfare, Battle Magic or Support. Every five levels your hero may choose a signature hero skill. These are powerful abilities unique to heroes that can turn the tide in combat and will permanently alter the affinity of that hero.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@LEVEL_RULER@NAME Lead by Example
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@LEVEL_RULER@OBJECTIVE Reach Level 5 with a Ruler
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@MEET_FREE_CITY@DESCRIPTION Not all <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> you may come across will belong to your opponents. <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>> are small neutral factions that can be vassalized, integrated, or conquered. Speed is of the essence, as once a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} swears an {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink}, it becomes impossible to convince them to join you instead. A vassalized city will provide units for your {GLOBAL.RequestMilitaryAidConcept.Hyperlink}.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@MEET_FREE_CITY@NAME The First Free City
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@MEET_FREE_CITY@OBJECTIVE Discover a Friendly Free City
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@OUTPOST@DESCRIPTION You have managed to defeat your first infestation! Infestations are often found in valuable settlement locations. The next step in the expansion of your Empire could be to construct an {GLOBAL.OutpostConcept.Hyperlink} here.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@OUTPOST@NAME Expansion through Outposts
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@OUTPOST@OBJECTIVE Build an Outpost
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@RESEARCH@DESCRIPTION The arcane research of your empire is struggling. If we wish to unlock more tomes of power and the spells they contain, we should invest in building structures in our cities that yield knowledge income.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@RESEARCH@NAME More Knowledge Required
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@RESEARCH@OBJECTIVE Build a Research Structure
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@SCOUTING@DESCRIPTION As is often the case, knowledge is power. To gather information on your surroundings, scouts are of utmost importance due to their speed and vision range. Without them your rivals might find and claim valuable locations before you do!
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@SCOUTING@NAME Preparing to Scout
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@SCOUTING@OBJECTIVE Recruit a {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.SCOUT_UNIT}
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@TO_BATTLE@DESCRIPTION Your armies need purpose to pay for their upkeep. The common usage for armies during peace times is clearing of Marauder Guards and Infestations around your Empire.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@TO_BATTLE@TITLE To Battle
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@TRANSFORM_RACE@DESCRIPTION One of your tomes of magic contains a powerful new spell capable of transforming your people. These spells will add powerful bonuses to your people as well as alter how they look. There are both minor and major transformations. A race can have multiple minor transformations, though some cannot be combined with others. A race can only ever have one major transformation.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@TRANSFORM_RACE@NAME Transformative
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@TRANSFORM_RACE@OBJECTIVE Transform your Race
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@VASSAL_FREE_CITY@DESCRIPTION The speed of turning a free city into your vassal can be boosted by spending Imperium. This can be useful should another empire compete with you in gaining their allegiance. Be aware, if a free city is vassalized, they will return all Whispering Stones assigned to them, other than those of their overlord.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@VASSAL_FREE_CITY@NAME Free City Vassalization
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@VASSAL_FREE_CITY@OBJECTIVE Vassalize a Free City
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@VICTORY@DESCRIPTION There are many paths to victory in this realm, but they all need the right strategy. You can [expansionvictory/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ExpansionVictoryConcept]expand[/hyperlink] your empire far and wide to become the dominant power within the realm, use [magicvictory/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.MagicVictoryConcept]magic[/hyperlink] to bend the very land to your will, or use [conquestvictory/] [hyperlink,GLOBAL.DefaultVictoryConcept]force[/hyperlink] and military prowess to crush all those who stand in your way.[br/][br/]Evaluate your progress to victory by tracking a victory condition through the [scorevictory/] quest panel on the top-left.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@VICTORY@FINISHER@DESCRIPTION Great choice, {PlayerLeader.Title}! You have chosen a victory condition which will guide you towards success! [br/] You can always change strategies when necessary.
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@VICTORY@NAME Path to Victory
ONBOARDING_OBJECTIVES@VICTORY@OBJECTIVE Track a Victory Condition

As your vassal, it is allied to you and will generate income for your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} every {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}. However, their {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.IndependentCityRelationConcept.Hyperlink} with you will suffer from the hostile takeover.

OPERATIONDEFINITIONS_STRATEGIC@CITY_OPERATION_VASSALIZE_OWNED@DESCRIPTION Turns the {GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink} into a [hyperlink,GLOBAL.PactOfVassalageConcept]vassal city[/hyperlink]. As your vassal, it is allied to you and will generate income for your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} every {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}. You will receive {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink} for releasing the City as well as a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityRelationConcept.Hyperlink} bonus and {GLOBAL.HouseInfluenceConcept.Hyperlink} based on the city's [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityStabilityConcept]stability[/hyperlink].

PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_DEFEATEDPLAYER@NEUTRAL "Your annihilation of {Player.Name} will not be without consequences."
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_DEFEATEDPLAYER@POSITIVE "Well done! {Player.Name}'s empire is defeated. This brings us both a step closer to claiming victory."
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_HIGHESTCAPABILITY@NEGATIVE "Hah, you may be the rising star now, but it won't last. Sooner or later, my empire will rise above all!"
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_HIGHESTCAPABILITY@NEUTRAL "You are at the top now, but can you maintain your current stature?"
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_HIGHESTCAPABILITY@POSITIVE "You are doing great—keep it up!"
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_IDLE@NEGATIVE "We have heard nothing of importance about you for some time. I have a feeling that you're staying quiet to further your nefarious plans."
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_IDLE@NEUTRAL "The rest of the world has not heard of your actions for a while. This silence can either be good or bad."
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_IDLE@POSITIVE "I haven't heard anything about your accomplishments in a while. Hopefully you are doing well in your efforts to grow your empire so we may rise from the ruins together."
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_IMPROVEDRELATIONWITHFACTION@NEGATIVE "You think befriending {House.Name} will help secure your path to victory? It will be my empire that rises above all."
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_IMPROVEDRELATIONWITHFACTION@NEUTRAL "Improving your relations with {House.Name} may lead to short term gains. Sustaining those relations, however... Can you trust them?"
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_IMPROVEDRELATIONWITHFACTION@POSITIVE "Good, a diplomatic approach will assure victory. I hope that we may both profit from your relation with {House.Name}."
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_LOWESTCAPABILITY@NEGATIVE "We've been keeping track of your capability rankings; you are the most pathetic Ruler, and that is how it should be."
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_LOWESTCAPABILITY@NEUTRAL "You are at the bottom of the capability rankings now. It's your choice to live with that or rise above it."
PLAYER_INTERACTION@EVENT_LOWESTCAPABILITY@POSITIVE "Don't give up yet! This isn't over—you could still rise in the ranks of this world."

PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@HEADER_BASE_MAGIC Base {GLOBAL.MagicConcept.Hyperlink} attacks inflict:

PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@HEADER_MAGIC_AND_DEBUFF Debuff abilities and {GLOBAL.MagicConcept.Hyperlink} attacks inflict:
PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@HEADER_MAGIC_AND_RANGED {GLOBAL.MagicConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.RangedConcept.Hyperlink} attacks inflict:
PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@HEADER_MAGIC_AND_SUPPORT {GLOBAL.MagicConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.SupportConcept.Hyperlink} attacks gain:
PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@HEADER_MAGIC_BASE Base {GLOBAL.MagicConcept.Hyperlink} attacks inflict:
PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@HEADER_MELEE {GLOBAL.MeleeConcept.Hyperlink} attacks inflict:
PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@HEADER_MELEE_AND_RANGED {GLOBAL.MeleeConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.RangedConcept.Hyperlink} attacks inflict:
PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@HEADER_RANGED {GLOBAL.RangedConcept.Hyperlink} attacks inflict:
PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@HEADER_SENTINEL {GLOBAL.RetaliationConcept.Hyperlink} and {GLOBAL.OpportunityAttackConcept.Hyperlink} attacks inflict:
PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@HEADER_SUPPORT {GLOBAL.SupportConcept.Hyperlink} abilities inflict:
PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@RESTORE_ACTION_POINT Restores {Value} <<m:{GLOBAL.ActionPointConcept}>>.
PROPERTY@UNIT_ABILITY_MODIFIER@TARGET_FILTER_LOW_MORALE Toward targets with Low {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink}:
PROPERTY@UNIT_ADJACENT@HEADER_UNDEAD Adjacent Undead <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitConcept.Hyperlink}>> have:

PROPERTY@UNIT_STATUS_EFFECT@GAIN_ONE_PROPERTY {Value.Sign} {Property}
PROPERTY@UNIT_SUMMON_EFFECT@ASTRAL_WISP Summons an {LOC.UNITS_WILDLIFE@ASTRAL_01@NAME}.
PROPERTY@UNIT_SUMMON_EFFECT@IRON_GOLEM Summons a Tier I Fighter version of an {LOC.TOME_ARTIFICING@UNIT1@NAME}.
PROPERTY@UNIT_TRANSFORM_EFFECT@SPAWN_FIEND If target dies:[bulletlist][bullet/]Summons a Tier I Fiend.[bullet/]Small chance of summoning a Tier II Fiend instead.[/bulletlist]
PROPERTY@UNIT_TRANSFORM_EFFECT@TRANSFORM_FIEND [bulletlist][bullet/]Transforms into a Tier I Fiend.[bullet/]Small chance of transforming into a Tier II Fiend instead.[/bulletlist]

QUEST@HERO_QUEST@CONQUER_HOUSE_01@MATERIUM_HEADER Make a copy of {EventItem}:
QUEST@HERO_QUEST@CONQUER_HOUSE_01@MATERIUM_SUCCESS {EventHero} appraises the replicated {EventItem} and rejoices!
QUEST@HERO_QUEST@STACK_ENCOUNTER_02@CHAOS_FAILURE {TriggeringStackLeader} failed to bridge the distance, allowing the Knight to strike {TriggeringStackLeader.FirstName} before rejoining <<o:EventStackLeader>> company.
QUEST@HERO_QUEST@STACK_ENCOUNTER_02@CHAOS_HEADER {TriggeringStackLeader} steps forward to get in closer range:
QUEST@HERO_QUEST@STACK_ENCOUNTER_02@CHAOS_SUCCESS {TriggeringStackLeader} crushes the Knight's windpipe with <<o:TriggeringStackLeader>> pommel!
QUEST@HERO_QUEST@STACK_ENCOUNTER_02@ORDER_FAILURE {TriggeringStackLeader} misses the Knight, who rejoins <<o:EventStackLeader>> company after landing a blow on {TriggeringStackLeader.FirstName}.
QUEST@HERO_QUEST@STACK_ENCOUNTER_02@ORDER_HEADER {TriggeringStackLeader} attempts a technical counterattack:
QUEST@HERO_QUEST@STACK_ENCOUNTER_02@ORDER_SUCCESS {TriggeringStackLeader} thrusts <<o:TriggeringStackLeader>> blade deep into the Knight's helmet!
QUEST@HERO_QUEST@STACK_ENCOUNTER_02@SHADOW_FAILURE {TriggeringStackLeader} drops the dagger! Before rejoining <<o:EventStackLeader>> company, the Knight deftly gashes <<G:shoulder^n,TriggeringStackLeader.FirstName>>
QUEST@HERO_QUEST@STACK_ENCOUNTER_02@SHADOW_HEADER {TriggeringStackLeader} attempts to draw <<o:TriggeringStackLeader>> dagger:
QUEST@HERO_QUEST@STACK_ENCOUNTER_02@SHADOW_SUCCESS {TriggeringStackLeader} stabs the Knight beneath <<o:EventStackLeader>> armpit with <<o:TriggeringStackLeader>> dagger!

RACETRAITS_COUNCIL@MARK_OF_THE_SWORD@EFFECT_01 <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> of this race generate [xpCol]{IntDraftBuff} {GLOBAL.UnitProductionConcept.Hyperlink}[/xpCol] for each {GLOBAL.WarConcept.Hyperlink} their {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} is engaged in.
RACETRAITS_COUNCIL@MARK_OF_THE_SWORD@EFFECT_02 <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> of this race lose [fireCol]{IntStabilityDebuff} {GLOBAL.CityStabilityConcept.Hyperlink}[/fireCol] for each {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink} or {GLOBAL.FreeCityLordConcept.Hyperlink} that has a diplomatic state better than neutral with their {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink} ([hyperlink,GLOBAL.PvEVassalConcept]vassalage[/hyperlink] excluded).

RACETRAITS_WORLD@TRAIT8@BIO They are experienced seafarers, sharing many stories of adventurous sailors and sea monsters.
RACETRAITS_WORLD@TRAIT8@EFFECT_01@DESCRIPTION Fisheries yield +{amount1} {GLOBAL.GoldConcept}, +{amount2} {GLOBAL.FoodConcept}, and +{amount3} {GLOBAL.UnitProductionConcept}.
RACETRAITS_WORLD@TRAIT8@EFFECT_02@DESCRIPTION <<m:{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.NAVAL_UNIT.Hyperlink}>> have {rank} Rank.
RACETRAITS_WORLD@TRAIT8@EFFECT_03@DESCRIPTION <<m:{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.NAVAL_UNIT.Hyperlink}>> cost {goldCost}% resources to recruit and maintain.

RACETRAITS_WORLD@TRAIT9@NAME Great Builders

REALM_TRAIT@CATEGORY@CLIME_DESC Clime traits modify the overlay and theme composition of the realm.
REALM_TRAIT@CATEGORY@GEOGRAPHY Geography Trait
REALM_TRAIT@CATEGORY@GEOGRAPHY_DESC Geography traits determine the general layout of landmasses of the realm.
REALM_TRAIT@CATEGORY@INHABITANTS Inhabitants Trait
REALM_TRAIT@CATEGORY@INHABITANTS_DESC Inhabitants traits modify the composition of independent armies and infestations on the realm.
REALM_TRAIT@CATEGORY@MISC Misc Trait
REALM_TRAIT@CATEGORY@MISC_DESC Misc traits apply a variety of effects that adjust the game rules or otherwise provide twists to the realm.
REALM_TRAIT@CATEGORY@PRESENCE Presence Trait
REALM_TRAIT@CATEGORY@PRESENCE_DESC Presence traits add unique leaders and empires to the realm.

SIGNATURE_HS@N03@DESCRIPTION Gains the {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.SUMMON_ANIMAL.Hyperlink} ability.
SIGNATURE_HS@N03@NAME Summon Animal
SIGNATURE_HS@O01@DESCRIPTION Gains the {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.HOLY_RETRIBUTION.Hyperlink} ability.
SIGNATURE_HS@O01@NAME Holy Retribution
SIGNATURE_HS@O01@PROP_DESCRIPTION Attacks that hit this unit from within {HOLY_RETRIBUTION>MaxAttackerDistance} hexes deal {HOLY_RETRIBUTION_DMG>DAMAGE>Spirit} {GLOBAL.SpiritDamageConcept.Hyperlink} to the attacker.
SIGNATURE_HS@O02@ABILITY_DESCRIPTION Friendly units in a {RALLYING_BLESSING_TARGETER>AREA>Radius} hex radius gain:[bulletlist][bullet/]{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.RALLYING.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERED_DEFENSE.Hyperlink}[bullet/]{GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.BOLSTERED_RESISTANCE.Hyperlink}
SIGNATURE_HS@O02@DESCRIPTION Gains the {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.RALLYING_BLESSING.Hyperlink} ability.
SIGNATURE_HS@O02@NAME Rallying Blessing
SIGNATURE_HS@O03@ABILITY_DESCRIPTION Heals target friendly unit +{RESTORATION_HEAL>NumHitpointsToRestore} <<m:{GLOBAL.TemporaryHitPointConcept.Hyperlink}>> and dispels its negative status effects.[br/]A target friendly unit that is dead can be revived with {RESTORATION_RESS>ResolvedHitPoints}% of its total <<m:{GLOBAL.HitPointConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
SIGNATURE_HS@O03@DESCRIPTION Gains the {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.RESTORATION.Hyperlink} ability.
SIGNATURE_HS@O03@NAME Restoration
SIGNATURE_HS@S01@ABILITY_DESCRIPTION Deals damage to target enemy and heals you the same amount as the damage dealt.
SIGNATURE_HS@S01@DESCRIPTION Gains the {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.DRAINING_BLADE.Hyperlink} ability.
SIGNATURE_HS@S01@NAME Draining Blade
SIGNATURE_HS@S02@ABILITY_DESCRIPTION Enemies in a {DARK_RITUAL_TARGETER>AREA>Radius}-hex radius sustain damage. All corpses in a {DARK_RITUAL_POS_TARGETER>AREA>Radius}-hex radius turn into Zombie units.
SIGNATURE_HS@S02@DESCRIPTION Gains the {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.DARK_RITUAL.Hyperlink} ability.
SIGNATURE_HS@S02@NAME Dark Ritual
SIGNATURE_HS@S03@ABILITY_DESCRIPTION Summons {amount} random Tier I Undead units.
SIGNATURE_HS@S03@DESCRIPTION Gains the {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.SUMMON_UNDEAD.Hyperlink} ability.
SIGNATURE_HS@S03@NAME Summon Undead
SIGNATURE_HS@VISIONS_OF_WOE@ABILITY_DESCRIPTION Enemy units in a {VISIONS_OF_WOE_TARGETER>AREA>Radius}-hex radius {GLOBAL.FumbleConcept.Hyperlink} their attacks for {VISIONS_OF_WOE_DESCRIPTION>NumTurns} <<m:{GLOBAL.TurnConcept}>>.
SIGNATURE_HS@VISIONS_OF_WOE@DESCRIPTION Gains the {GLOBAL.PROPERTIES.VISIONS_OF_WOE.Hyperlink} ability.
SIGNATURE_HS@VISIONS_OF_WOE@NAME Visions of Woe
SIGNATURE_HS@VISIONS_OF_WOE@PROP_DESCRIPTION There is a 100% chance that this unit will {GLOBAL.FumbleConcept.Hyperlink} its attacks.

SPAWNERS@ASTRALRIFT_SPAWNER@DESCRIPTION A gathering of eldritch creatures from the Astral Sea has claimed this region.[br/]If left unchecked, they will grow in strength, expand their territory, and send out invasion armies.
SPAWNERS@ASTRALRIFT_SPAWNER@LORE Hosts of otherworldly foes have managed to break through in places where the veil between our world and the Astral Sea is weak or has been ruptured. Eerie battle cries and strange magics fill the air as this tide of danger washes onto the shores of our reality. Should such rifts be left unchecked, these foes may sweep through our lands without mercy.
SPAWNERS@ASTRALRIFT_SPAWNER@NAME Astral Rift
SPAWNERS@BANDIT_SPAWNER@DESCRIPTION A band of bloodthirsty brigands has claimed this region.[br/]If left unchecked, they will grow in strength, expand their territory, and send out invasion armies.
SPAWNERS@BANDIT_SPAWNER@LORE Few know what drives the hearts of mortals. Oft it is greed, valor, or simply hunger. When the common cause grows large enough, men and women of like minds will find each other in secret places. Smoke from campfires and makeshift forges drifts among shoddy tents and huts of these haphazard armies. It is from here that they assault the surrounding lands with relentless impunity.
SPAWNERS@BANDIT_SPAWNER@NAME Brigand Camp
SPAWNERS@BIRD_SPAWNER@DESCRIPTION A flock of dangerous birds has claimed this region.[br/]If left unchecked, they will grow in strength, expand their territory, and send out invasion armies.
SPAWNERS@BIRD_SPAWNER@LORE Feathers, bones, and baubles litter the nesting grounds of these gigantic kings and queens of the sky. The sound of hungrily consumed flesh and bone, interspersed with loud chirping and monstrous squawks, carries over the nests of these avian behemoths. Oftentimes their presence is so potent that lesser beings will join their flock, raiding the surrounding areas for gifts, food, and other forms of tribute.
SPAWNERS@BIRD_SPAWNER@NAME Great Bird Nest
SPAWNERS@CULTIST_SPAWNER@DESCRIPTION A cabal of crazed cultists has claimed this region.[br/]If left unchecked, they will grow in strength, expand their territory, and send out invasion armies.
SPAWNERS@CULTIST_SPAWNER@LORE Eerie otherworldly shrieks mingle with the terrified whimpers of sacrificial victims-to-be. A cloud of oily smoke from hundreds of ritual candles blankets the area. Here, dark summoners invoke creatures from distant worlds and send them out to wreak havoc on the lands beyond.
SPAWNERS@CULTIST_SPAWNER@NAME Ritual Circle
SPAWNERS@DRAGON_SPAWNER@DESCRIPTION A flight of mighty dragons has claimed this region.[br/]If left unchecked, they will grow in strength, expand their territory, and send out invasion armies.
SPAWNERS@DRAGON_SPAWNER@LORE A dragon's nest is a sight that instills terror, awe... and many similar feelings one might have when in the presence of something deep and primal. Whether the inhabitant of the nest is an ancient dragon, born in the age of giants, or a younger wyvern, denizens of the surrounding lands should beware. Or better yet, flee...
SPAWNERS@DRAGON_SPAWNER@NAME Dragon's Lair
SPAWNERS@FORSAKEN_COVE_SPAWNER@DESCRIPTION Nautical horrors have claimed this region.[br/]If left unchecked, they will grow in strength, expand their territory, and send out invasion parties.
SPAWNERS@FORSAKEN_COVE_SPAWNER@LORE Shanties warn of the Forsaken Cove, where monsters lurk beneath the waves and sunken ships rise from the depths. It was once a notorious den of pirates, cursed by a sailor's widow after they murdered her husband. Now the cove marks the edge of the world, a border even the bravest sailors should not cross. Beware! Here be monsters.
SPAWNERS@FORSAKEN_COVE_SPAWNER@NAME Forsaken Cove

SPAWNERS@INFESTATION@TYPE@GOLD Gold [infestationGold/] {GLOBAL.InfestationSpawnerConcept.Hyperlink}
SPAWNERS@INFESTATION@TYPE@SILVER Silver [infestationSilver/] {GLOBAL.InfestationSpawnerConcept.Hyperlink}
SPAWNERS@MONSTER_SPAWNER@DESCRIPTION A throng of vile monsters has claimed this region.[br/]If left unchecked, they will grow in strength, expand their territory, and send out invasion armies.
SPAWNERS@MONSTER_SPAWNER@LORE Nature is seldom good or evil. It is hungry, territorial, and protective of its young. Nests and dens such as these are home to various beasts of the wild, whose natural ferocity and power of tooth, claw, or beak may prove more than a match for the sharpest steel.
SPAWNERS@MONSTER_SPAWNER@NAME Small Monster Den
SPAWNERS@MONSTER_SPAWNER_LARGE@DESCRIPTION A horde of vile monsters has claimed this region.[br/]If left unchecked, they will grow in strength, expand their territory, and send out invasion armies.
SPAWNERS@MONSTER_SPAWNER_LARGE@LORE The crunch of half-chewed bones underfoot and the overwhelming scent of past victims drifting through the air mark this den a home of monsters. From ancient giants, shapers of the world, to vicious trolls, still incensed at the loss of their deep domains, one might expect any type of powerful creature and their minions to emerge.
SPAWNERS@MONSTER_SPAWNER_LARGE@NAME Large Monster Den
SPAWNERS@PIRATE_SPAWNER@DESCRIPTION A roving band of pirates has claimed this region.[br/]If left unchecked, they will grow in strength, expand their territory, and send out invasion parties.
SPAWNERS@PIRATE_SPAWNER@LORE Freebooters laugh as they smuggle goods along the waves and pirates raze the villages by the sea and riverside, plundering all they desire. The call of the sea resonates with these men and women who congregate in hidden coves and bays. Raucous singing can be heard in these places, accompanied by the smell of stale, stolen ale wafting through the humid air.
SPAWNERS@PIRATE_SPAWNER@NAME Pirate Cove
SPAWNERS@UNDEAD_SPAWNER@DESCRIPTION A mass of haunted undead has claimed this region.[br/]If left unchecked, they will grow in strength, expand their territory, and send out invasion armies.
SPAWNERS@UNDEAD_SPAWNER@LORE The dead often grow restless in troubled times. In places like graveyards, where they are all conveniently amassed in a single, sometimes less than final, resting place, this can be fatal for others. Whether driven by dark magic, a confluence of ambient spiritual energy, or some other source of ire from beyond the veil, hordes of the Undead rise with one need... to feast upon the flesh of the living.
SPAWNERS@UNDEAD_SPAWNER@NAME Haunted Graveyard

STORY_EVENT@1013_1019@BODY_FOOTER The <<m:EnemyUnit>> beckon to {EventHero.FirstName} to join them in the waters. As <<p:EventHero>> approaches, their smiles darken. "Come on in! Do not resist."
STORY_EVENT@1013_1019@BODY_FOOTER@HERO_IS_PLAYERLE The <<m:EnemyUnit>> beckon to you to join them in the waters. As your troops approach, their smiles darken. "Come on in! Do not resist."
STORY_EVENT@1013_1019@BODY_HEADER After arduous travels, the bubbling waters of a refreshing {EventStructure.Name} seem very inviting to {EventHero.Name} and <<o:EventHero>> army. The peaceful murmur of the stream is punctuated by playful laughter.
STORY_EVENT@1013_1019@BODY_HEADER@HERO_IS_PLAYERLE After arduous travels, the bubbling waters of a refreshing {EventStructure.Name} seem very inviting to you and your army. The peaceful murmur of the stream is punctuated by playful laughter.
STORY_EVENT@1013_1019@BODY_LORE "Don't just stand there!" calls a welcoming, seductive voice, joined by a chorus of laughter. Fair <<m:EnemyUnit>> are frolicking in the waters of the spring. They beckon invitingly with their bare arms, blocking out the humanoid shapes floating lifelessly under the surface. The <<m:EnemyUnit>> call out, almost imploring with eager requests. "Join us! Come bathe with us..."
STORY_EVENT@1013_1019@BUTTON_0 "It's a trap! Attack!"
STORY_EVENT@1013_1019@BUTTON_1 Order your troops to avert their eyes before attacking the <<m:EnemyUnit>>.
STORY_EVENT@1013_1019@BUTTON_3 "Do not give in to temptation! Our faith will guide us through this!"
STORY_EVENT@1013_1019@BUTTON_4 Back away from these temptresses.
STORY_EVENT@1013_1019@TITLE Bait and Bathe
STORY_EVENT@1013_1020@BODY_FOOTER The {EventUnit.Name} smiles. "I don't have much I can offer you except my gratitude, brave <<EventHero{hero/heroine}>>. This {EventStructure.Name} is yours."
STORY_EVENT@1013_1020@BODY_FOOTER@HERO_IS_PLAYERLE The {EventUnit.Name} smiles. "I don't have much I can offer you except my gratitude, o {PlayerLeader.Title}. This {EventStructure.Name} is yours."
STORY_EVENT@1013_1020@BODY_HEADER {EventHero.Name} emerges victorious from the {EventStructure.Name}. One final {EventUnit} approaches, arms raised. "Did I miss all the fun?" She asks playfully.
STORY_EVENT@1013_1020@BODY_HEADER@HERO_IS_PLAYERLE You emerge victorious from the {EventStructure.Name}. One final {EventUnit} approaches, arms raised. "Did I miss all the fun?" She asks playfully.
STORY_EVENT@1013_1020@BODY_LORE She continues: "Those hags tricked people only to drown them for sport. They even tried it on me, once, before chasing me away. I'm glad they're..." she pauses to choose her words carefully, "... gone." I'm not like them, I've always wanted to leave this {EventStructure.Name} and learn about the world, rather than drown everyone."

STORY_EVENT@1013_682@BODY_LORE A {EventStackLeader} and <<o:EventStackLeader>> frost-ridden followers are slowly turning the area around them to ice. They freeze the earth, beast and man alike, leaving behind a desolate lifeless wasteland. All will to live, movement and impulse is quenched as if the entire region had become frozen in time.

STORY_EVENT@1013_682@BUTTON_1 "Change comes and goes. Their ice won't last for long."
STORY_EVENT@1013_682@BUTTON_2 "Stop them? I will support [mana/] this experiment in freezing!"

STORY_EVENT@1013_683@BODY_LORE Icicles shatter and water drips as the cold fades away, revealing various objects that had been locked in the ice. You see weapons, gold, and a stack of books. But, as the ice melts, chaos and decay make up for lost time, for you can see the objects deteriorate in front of your very eyes. You have to choose fast.

STORY_EVENT@1038_309@TITLE Two Dragons
STORY_EVENT@1038_310@BODY_FOOTER The dragons' hoard is yours to take. Which item catches <<g:eye^n,EventHero>>?
STORY_EVENT@1038_310@BODY_HEADER With the threat of the {GLOBAL.DragonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} removed, {EventHero} has gained access to the {EventStructure}.
STORY_EVENT@1038_310@BODY_HEADER@HERO_IS_PLAYERLE With the threat of the {GLOBAL.DragonsLoreConcept.Hyperlink} removed, you have gained access to the {EventStructure}.

Combining channeled ray observations throughout our entire domain, slightly delayed to compensate for the discrepancy, forms a stronger and clearer signal.

TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@BROKEN_TOWER_02@AFFINITY_CHOICE_ASTRAL@SUCCESS Your troops find themselves light on their feet.
TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@CHECK_FAILURE {Percentage}% Failure:
TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@CHECK_NOTHING_HAPPENS Nothing happens.
TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@CHECK_STRENGTH [hyperlink,GLOBAL.AffinityCheckConcept]{Strength} Strength[/hyperlink] {Affinity.Name} Check:
TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@CHECK_SUCCESS {Percentage}% Success:
TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@CHECK_TEXT Do a {Affinity.Name} roll check.

TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@PERILOUS_DANCE@AFFINITY_CHECK_ORDER@FAILURE Somehow you failed to learn the proper steps.
TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@PERILOUS_DANCE@AFFINITY_CHECK_ORDER@HEADER Use your knowledge of the fine arts to dance.
TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@PERILOUS_DANCE@AFFINITY_CHECK_ORDER@SUCCESS Everyone is impressed by your flawless rendition!

TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@PLAYER_INCOME_CHANGE_GAIN {Player.Name} gains {Value} {Resource.Name} per turn. ({Player.Name} generates {INT_IncomePerTurn} {Resource.Name} per [turn/].)
TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@PLAYER_INCOME_CHANGE_LOSS {Player.Name} loses {Value} {Resource.Name} per turn. ({Player.Name} generates {INT_IncomePerTurn} {Resource.Name} per [turn/].)
TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@PLAYER_INCOME_GAIN {Player.Name} gains {Value} {Resource.Name} per turn.
TRIGGER@TOOLTIP@PLAYER_INCOME_LOSS {Player.Name} loses {Value} {Resource.Name} per turn.

TUTORIAL@AFFINITY@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on affinity levels
TUTORIAL@AFFINITY@PAGE1@DESCRIPTION Choosing a {GLOBAL.TomeConcept.Hyperlink} will alter your {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink}, which represents your attunement to specific cosmic forces. It can also be altered by picking a signature skill for your {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}. You will require a large amount of specific affinity to unlock higher tiers of Tomes.
TUTORIAL@AFFINITY@TITLE Affinity Levels
TUTORIAL@ALIGNMENT@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on your alignment
TUTORIAL@ALIGNMENT@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION Your {GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept.Hyperlink} represents how others see you. This can be changed by various actions you take. {GLOBAL.AlignmentConcept.Hyperlink} also determines the base relations value between you and other Rulers and <<m:{GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
TUTORIAL@ALIGNMENT@PAGE01@INSTRUCTIONS Alignment ranges from Pure Good to Pure Evil. You can see your current alignment in the bottom right corner, underneath the turn counter. Many alignment changes are temporary and over time will disappear.
TUTORIAL@ALIGNMENT@PAGE01@TITLE Alignment
TUTORIAL@ALIGNMENT@TITLE Alignment
TUTORIAL@ANCIENTWONDERS@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on Ancient Wonders found in the world
TUTORIAL@ANCIENTWONDERS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION This location is called an Ancient Wonder. These structures hold great treasure and bring prosperity to any city that annexes them. But they are often inhabited by powerful creatures.
TUTORIAL@ANCIENTWONDERS@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION An Ancient Wonder can only be explored by a single army led by a Hero.
TUTORIAL@ANCIENTWONDERS@PAGE01@TITLE Ancient Wonders
TUTORIAL@ANCIENTWONDERS@TITLE Ancient Wonders
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@DESCRIPTION Tutorial about your armies on the world map
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@PAGE00@INSTRUCTION Select one of the armies on the map to learn more about them.
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@PAGE00@OBJECTIVE Select an army
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have selected an army. Armies are the core of your military strength. They can explore the world, attack your foes, and defend your lands.
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION The banners above each army shows what faction they belong to. The panel at the bottom of your screen gives more information about that army.
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@PAGE01@TITLE Armies
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@PAGE02@DESCRIPTION An army is made up of individual units. You can see a unit's tier, unit role and movement points in the army panel.
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION To learn more about an individual unit's capabilities, [rightmousebutton/] right-click their portrait in the army panel at the bottom of your screen.
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER To learn more about an individual unit's capabilities, press [ci_dpaddown/] to go into the army panel, then press [ci_buttony/] on any unit.
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@PAGE02@OBJECTIVE Inspect a unit
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@PAGE02@TITLE Army Stack Panel
TUTORIAL@ARMIES@TITLE Units & Armies
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on moving your armies over the world map.
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@FINISHER@DESCRIPTION A glorious victory, O {PlayerLeader.Title}! You have beaten an {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}, rewarding you with loot and your surviving units with {GLOBAL.ExperienceConcept.Hyperlink}. The more experience they get, the stronger your armies become.
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@FINISHER@OBJECTIVE You have beaten an {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}. You have gained some loot and your units and heroes gain {GLOBAL.ExperienceConcept.Hyperlink}. As units survive combat they get stronger and learn new abilities. The higher the {GLOBAL.UnitTierConcept.Hyperlink}, the more they benefit from {GLOBAL.ExperienceConcept.Hyperlink} so upgrade your units regularly.
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION Your armies can move a limited distance every turn. The distance they can move depends on the terrain they traverse.
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION You can move your army by [rightmousebutton/] right-clicking on a hex on the world map.[br/][br/]You can control which units in the army move by [leftmousebutton/] left-clicking on their portrait.
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER While having your army selected, you can move it by pressing [ci_buttona/] on a hex on the world map.[br/][br/]
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@PAGE01@OBJECTIVE Moved one of your armies
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@PAGE01@TITLE Army Movement
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION Whenever an {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept} moves onto a hex occupied by enemy army, it initiates {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}. Nearby armies on both sides can [hyperlink,GLOBAL.ReinforcementRuleConcept]reinforce[/hyperlink] the battle.
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@PAGE02@OBJECTIVE Attack an enemy army
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT@TITLE Army Movement
TUTORIAL@ARMYMOVEMENT_FINISHER@TITLE Deserved Victory
TUTORIAL@ARMYUPKEEP@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on Army Upkeep.
TUTORIAL@ARMYUPKEEP@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION Beware, O {PlayerLeader.Title}! Your units do not fight for free. They require a certain amount of {GLOBAL.GoldConcept} and {GLOBAL.ManaConcept} each {GLOBAL.TurnConcept.Hyperlink}. If you cannot provide these resources, they lose {GLOBAL.UnitMoraleConcept.Hyperlink} and eventually desert your army.
TUTORIAL@ARMYUPKEEP@TITLE Army Upkeep
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on camera controls on the world map.
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION Take some time to look around and familiarize yourself with your new surroundings.
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION To move the camera around, use the W, A, S, D keys or hold [leftmousebutton/] and drag your mouse.
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER To move your cursor and the camera around, use [ci_leftstick/]
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE01@OBJECTIVE Move Camera
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE01@TITLE Camera Controls
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION To rotate the camera, hold the [middlemousebutton/] middle mouse button and drag your mouse.[br/][br/]Press R to reset your rotation.
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER To rotate the camera, use [ci_rightstick/].[br/][br/]Press [ci_rightstickpress/] to reset your rotation.
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE02@OBJECTIVE Reset Camera
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE03@DESCRIPTION You can take a closer look at the land by zooming in. Or get a better overview of the world by zooming out. Zoom out far enough to reach the overview map.
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE03@INSTRUCTION Zoom in and out by scrolling the [middlemousebutton/] middle mouse button.
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE03@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER Zoom in and out using [ci_rightstickupdown/].
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@PAGE03@OBJECTIVE Reach the overview map
TUTORIAL@CAMERA@TITLE Camera Controls
TUTORIAL@CITIES@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on how to manage your cities.
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE00@INSTRUCTION To learn more about city management, select your city: {VarThroneCity.Name} on the map.
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have selected one of your cities. Cities are central to your economy, and allow you to build more units for your armies.
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION {GLOBAL.FoodConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.UnitProductionConcept.Hyperlink}, and {GLOBAL.StructureProductionConcept.Hyperlink} are resources used to develop your cities.[br/][br/]{GLOBAL.GoldConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.ManaConcept.Hyperlink}, {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink}, and {GLOBAL.KnowledgeConcept.Hyperlink} are resources that can be spend on any city, unit or spell.
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE01@OBJECTIVE Select your city
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE01@TITLE Managing your cities
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE02@DESCRIPTION <<m:{GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink}>> and <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> located in a city's domain will provide you with income. [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityStructureConcept]Structures[/hyperlink] can be built to improve your city.
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION Select the hammer button located in the right side of the city panel and choose a structure to build.[br/](Suggestion): Build a [food/] Storehouse or [structureprod/] Workshop.
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE02@OBJECTIVE Start building a structure
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE03@DESCRIPTION Cities also recruit your units. Units cost [hyperlink,GLOBAL.UnitUpkeepConcept.Hyperlink]Upkeep[/hyperlink] every turn, so keep an eye on your income to ensure you can pay for your units.
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE03@INSTRUCTION Select the [unit/] helmet button located under the production queue and choose a unit to recruit.
TUTORIAL@CITIES@PAGE03@OBJECTIVE Start recruiting a unit
TUTORIAL@CITIES@TITLE City Management
TUTORIAL@CITYCAP@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on City Cap
TUTORIAL@CITYCAP@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You are close to reaching your maximum number of cities. Acquiring more cities than your maximum will result in major economic penalties.
TUTORIAL@CITYCAP@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION You can increase your {GLOBAL.CityCapConcept.Hyperlink} via the Empire Development Tree or you can continue to grow your empire by making newly acquired cities your <<m:{GLOBAL.PvEVassalConcept.Hyperlink}>> instead.
TUTORIAL@CITYCAP@PAGE01@TITLE City Cap
TUTORIAL@CITYCAP@TITLE City Cap
TUTORIAL@CITYEXPANSION@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on annexing new provinces to your cities
TUTORIAL@CITYEXPANSION@PAGE00@INSTRUCTION Select a city that has increased its population.
TUTORIAL@CITYEXPANSION@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION This city has grown and gained a new {GLOBAL.PopulationConcept.Hyperlink}. Each additional population enables you to expand the city's domain by placing a {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}.
TUTORIAL@CITYEXPANSION@PAGE01@TITLE City Expansion
TUTORIAL@CITYEXPANSION@PAGE02@DESCRIPTION Every {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink} has different features which determine what type of improvement can be built in it.
TUTORIAL@CITYEXPANSION@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION Click [leftmousebutton/] on the pin button [province/] to add the province to your city's domain.
TUTORIAL@CITYEXPANSION@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER Select the pin button [province/] in the city panel to start selecting a province and improvement to build there.
TUTORIAL@CITYEXPANSION@PAGE02@OBJECTIVE Place a province improvement
TUTORIAL@CITYEXPANSION@TITLE City Expansion
TUTORIAL@CITYPRODUCTION@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on city production.
TUTORIAL@CITYPRODUCTION@TITLE City Production
TUTORIAL@COMBATEENGAGEMENT@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on starting combat with hostile armies
TUTORIAL@COMBATEENGAGEMENT@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You are about to enter combat. Inspect all participants and their combined strength before deciding if you want to fight manually or have your army automatically fight the battle.
TUTORIAL@COMBATEENGAGEMENT@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION If you use Auto Combat, the fight will be simulated and you will be able to replay the battle yourself if you don't like the results.
TUTORIAL@COMBATEENGAGEMENT@PAGE01@TITLE Combat Preview
TUTORIAL@COMBATEENGAGEMENT@TITLE Starting Combat
TUTORIAL@DEFENDINGYOURCITY@DESCRIPTION Without [hyperlink,GLOBAL.CityWallStructureConcept]Walls[/hyperlink] and garrisons your <<m:{GLOBAL.CityConcept.Hyperlink}>> are vulnerable. Be sure to maintain your defenses and keep an {GLOBAL.ArmyConcept.Hyperlink} ready to guard the walls, lest the enemy take your beloved cities!
TUTORIAL@DEFENDINGYOURCITY@INSTRUCTIONS A city with no defenses can be taken without a fight.
TUTORIAL@DEFENDINGYOURCITY@TITLE Defending Your City
TUTORIAL@DIPLOMACY@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on diplomatic interactions with other Rulers
TUTORIAL@DIPLOMACY@PAGE00@OBJECTIVE Open the Diplomacy screen with another player.
TUTORIAL@DIPLOMACY@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have encountered another {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept}. They will be your biggest roadblock to victory. But they may also prove to be powerful allies.
TUTORIAL@DIPLOMACY@PAGE01@TITLE Diplomacy
TUTORIAL@DIPLOMACY@PAGE02@DESCRIPTION This overview will show you in-depth information about another Ruler: their personality, <<m:{GLOBAL.TreatyConcept.Hyperlink}>> and current [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]Relations[/hyperlink] with you.
TUTORIAL@DIPLOMACY@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION Inspect the other Ruler and decide if this is someone you wish to forge an alliance with, to defeat... Or anything in between.
TUTORIAL@DIPLOMACY@TITLE Diplomacy
TUTORIAL@EMPIREDEVELOPMENT@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on gaining empire skills
TUTORIAL@EMPIREDEVELOPMENT@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION This is the empire development tree. Here you will specialize your empire towards certain play styles. Increase your empire's {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} to open more options.
TUTORIAL@EMPIREDEVELOPMENT@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Learn about each empire skill by hovering over it.
TUTORIAL@EMPIREDEVELOPMENT@PAGE01@TITLE Empire Development
TUTORIAL@EMPIREDEVELOPMENT@PAGE02@DESCRIPTION You will progress toward unlocking your next empire skill every turn, depending on your {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink} values. Once unlocked you can spend {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink} to obtain the empire skill. Unlike {GLOBAL.ResearchConcept.Hyperlink}, the Empire Skills provide more passive bonuses and activate immediately upon selection.
TUTORIAL@EMPIREDEVELOPMENT@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION (Optional): Select an empire skill.
TUTORIAL@EMPIREDEVELOPMENT@TITLE Empire Skills
TUTORIAL@ENCHANTMENTS@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on enchanting units
TUTORIAL@ENCHANTMENTS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION <<m:{GLOBAL.UnitEnchantmentConcept.Hyperlink}>> are spells which allow you to empower your armies. They apply to all units with a specific role and cost upkeep for each unit affected. These enchantments often synergize with units or spells from the same tome.
TUTORIAL@ENCHANTMENTS@PAGE01@TITLE Unit Enchantments
TUTORIAL@ENCHANTMENTS@PAGE02@DESCRIPTION Race transformations will cost a lot in terms of resources. The changes they make are more drastic and powerful and cannot be reversed. Your entire race will evolve into something... more.
TUTORIAL@ENCHANTMENTS@PAGE02@TITLE Transformations
TUTORIAL@ENCHANTMENTS@TITLE Enchantments
TUTORIAL@FREECITIES@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on interacting with Free Cities
TUTORIAL@FREECITIES@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have encountered a free city. They are independents that can be vassalized, integrated or conquered.
TUTORIAL@FREECITIES@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Inspect the Free City and give them a {GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept.Hyperlink} to start building a relationship with them.
TUTORIAL@FREECITIES@PAGE01@TITLE Free Cities
TUTORIAL@FREECITIES@TITLE Free Cities
TUTORIAL@GOVERNORS@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on city governors
TUTORIAL@GOVERNORS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have opened the governor assignment menu. Here you can see all available <<m:{GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}>> that can become the governor of this city, along with the bonuses they would provide.

TUTORIAL@GOVERNORS@TITLE Governors
TUTORIAL@GRIEVANCES@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on declaring wars and the grievances required to justify them
TUTORIAL@GRIEVANCES@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have just gained or caused a {GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept.Hyperlink} against another Ruler. These are used to justify wars. You could also forgive them to improve your [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]Relations[/hyperlink].
TUTORIAL@GRIEVANCES@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Your wars need to be justified, otherwise they are considered [evilact/] evil. Your {GLOBAL.WarJustificationConcept.Hyperlink} is determined by your <<m:{GLOBAL.CasusBelliConcept}>> and can be inspected by hovering over the [casusBelli/] icon in the diplomacy overview.
TUTORIAL@GRIEVANCES@PAGE01@TITLE War Declaration & Grievances
TUTORIAL@GRIEVANCES@TITLE Declaring War & Grievances
TUTORIAL@HEROES@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on what you can do with heroes and how to get additional ones.
TUTORIAL@HEROES@PAGE00@INSTRUCTION Select an army with a hero and [rightmousebutton/] right-click the hero portrait to inspect that hero. A silver army banner signifies an army led by a hero. A golden army banner signifies an army led by a special hero: your Ruler.
TUTORIAL@HEROES@PAGE00@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER Select an army with a hero, press [ci_dpaddown/] to go into the army panel, then press [ci_buttony/] to inspect that hero. A silver army banner signifies an army led by a hero. A golden army banner signifies an army led by a special hero: your Ruler.
TUTORIAL@HEROES@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have selected a hero. Heroes lead your armies around the world. Only they have the authority to explore <<m:{GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}>>, construct <<m:{GLOBAL.OutpostConcept.Hyperlink}>>, or start <<m:{GLOBAL.SiegeConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
TUTORIAL@HEROES@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Level up heroes by using them in {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink} and equip them with items you find as loot.
TUTORIAL@HEROES@PAGE01@OBJECTIVE Open the Hero Panel
TUTORIAL@HEROES@PAGE01@TITLE Rulers & Heroes
TUTORIAL@HEROES@TITLE Rulers & Heroes
TUTORIAL@HEROLEVELING@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on selecting skills when a hero levels up
TUTORIAL@HEROLEVELING@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION A {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink} can choose a new hero skill every time they reach a new level. You can choose how to specialize your heroes.
TUTORIAL@HEROLEVELING@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Choose a hero skill from the Warfare, Battle Magic or Support categories. Doing so will unlock more powerful hero skills of that category.
TUTORIAL@HEROLEVELING@PAGE01@TITLE Hero Level Up
TUTORIAL@HEROLEVELING@TITLE Hero Level Up
TUTORIAL@HERORECRUITMENT@DESCRIPTION Here you can recruit a new {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink}. Your hero cap increases with each city you own.

Local Heroes originate from your own realm. Once you have developed your pact with a {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}, their experienced Heroes will become available to you, too.
TUTORIAL@HERORECRUITMENT@INSTRUCTION {GLOBAL.HeroConcept.Hyperlink} who originate from other {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink} have their own culture and abilities.
TUTORIAL@HERORECRUITMENT@TITLE Hero Recruitment
TUTORIAL@HOSTILECITY@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on hostile Free Cities
TUTORIAL@HOSTILECITY@PAGE1@DESCRIPTION You have encountered a hostile {GLOBAL.IndependentCityConcept.Hyperlink}. They are independents that can be vassalized, integrated or conquered.
TUTORIAL@HOSTILECITY@PAGE1@INSTRUCTION This city is at {GLOBAL.IndependentCityWarConcept.Hyperlink} with you. You can defeat them through conquest, or negotiate a peace, after which you can give them a {GLOBAL.DiplomaticTokenConcept.Hyperlink} to start building a relationship with them.
TUTORIAL@HOSTILECITY@TITLE Hostile Free City
TUTORIAL@IMPERIUM@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on Imperium
TUTORIAL@IMPERIUM@INSTRUCTIONS Imperium is mainly gained by building parts of your Wizard Tower in your {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink} or by annexing <<m:{GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
TUTORIAL@IMPERIUM@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have gathered a large amount of {GLOBAL.ImperiumConcept.Hyperlink}. This represents the influence you have over the world. You can use it to acquire new cities, unlock new <<m:{GLOBAL.EmpireSkillConcept.Hyperlink}>> or speed up city growth.
TUTORIAL@IMPERIUM@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Imperium is mainly gained by building parts of your {GLOBAL.WizardTowerConcept.Hyperlink} in your {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink} or by annexing <<m:{GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}>>.
TUTORIAL@IMPERIUM@PAGE01@TITLE Imperium
TUTORIAL@IMPERIUM@TITLE Imperium
TUTORIAL@INFESTATIONS@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on infestations
TUTORIAL@INFESTATIONS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION An infestation is close by. Invading armies will be sent from its spawner location to your lands if left unchecked for too long. Destroying them, however, might prove challenging.
TUTORIAL@INFESTATIONS@PAGE01@TITLE Infestations
TUTORIAL@INFESTATIONS@TITLE Infestations
TUTORIAL@LOCATIONS@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on the various locations found on the world map
TUTORIAL@LOCATIONS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have encountered a {GLOBAL.NodeConcept.Hyperlink}, they provide additional yield to the {GLOBAL.ProvinceConcept.Hyperlink} they are located in.
TUTORIAL@LOCATIONS@PAGE01@TITLE World Map Locations
TUTORIAL@LOCATIONS@PAGE02@DESCRIPTION Nodes are often occupied by <<m:{GLOBAL.MarauderConcept.Hyperlink}>>. To claim the node and its benefits, these guards will need to be removed first.
TUTORIAL@LOCATIONS@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION Not all neutral armies are the same. An army bearing the tower banner represents a Free City. A black banner with a skull signifies a Marauder Guard. The Red banner with a skull signifies an army belonging to an Infestation.
TUTORIAL@LOCATIONS@PAGE02@TITLE Marauder Guard
TUTORIAL@LOCATIONS@TITLE Locations
TUTORIAL@MAGICMATERIALS@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on magic materials
TUTORIAL@MAGICMATERIALS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have selected a magic material. These have various unique effects if acquired via annexation or through trade. Gathering all materials from a category will yield a powerful empire-wide bonus.
TUTORIAL@MAGICMATERIALS@PAGE01@TITLE Magic Materials
TUTORIAL@MAGICMATERIALS@TITLE Magic Materials
TUTORIAL@NEGOTIATION@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on negotiations between Rulers.
TUTORIAL@NEGOTIATION@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION Negotiations are mutually beneficial agreements with fellow <<m:{GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}>>. You can propose <<m:{GLOBAL.TreatyConcept.Hyperlink}>> to strengthen the bond between your empires, you can [hyperlink,GLOBAL.TradeConcept]Trade[/hyperlink] assets to make a profit, or you can send gifts to improve [hyperlink,GLOBAL.EmpireRelationConcept]Relations[/hyperlink].
TUTORIAL@NEGOTIATION@PAGE01@TITLE Negotiation
TUTORIAL@NEGOTIATION@TITLE Negotiation
TUTORIAL@NOTIFICATIONS@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on notifications and ending the turn
TUTORIAL@NOTIFICATIONS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION Deal with all notifications to ensure no important tasks remain unattended. Then, you can safely end your turn.
TUTORIAL@NOTIFICATIONS@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION [leftmousebutton/] Click the notifications on the right to go through them or skip them with [rightmousebutton/] to come back to them later.
TUTORIAL@NOTIFICATIONS@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER Use [ci_righttrigger/] to go through the notifications in order. The list can be opened using [ci_dpadright/], allowing you to skip notifications with [ci_buttonx/].
TUTORIAL@NOTIFICATIONS@PAGE01@TITLE Notifications & Ending the Turn
TUTORIAL@NOTIFICATIONS@TITLE Notifications & Ending Turns
TUTORIAL@OUTPOST@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on settling new outposts
TUTORIAL@OUTPOST@TITLE Outposts
TUTORIAL@OUTPOSTS@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on the importance of outposts
TUTORIAL@OUTPOSTS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION Outposts solidify your control over a region. You can use them as a safe place to recuperate, to lay claim to the surrounding lands, and they can also be turned into cities.
TUTORIAL@OUTPOSTS@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Outposts can only be built by heroes standing on the center of a province.[br/][br/]Outposts can collect resources of the <<m:{GLOBAL.LocationConcept.Hyperlink}>> within its {GLOBAL.DomainConcept.Hyperlink} similar to cities. Its defenses can be upgraded to help protect your claimed land.
TUTORIAL@OUTPOSTS@PAGE01@TITLE Outposts
TUTORIAL@OUTPOSTS@TITLE Outposts
TUTORIAL@OVERVIEWMAP@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on using the Overview Map
TUTORIAL@OVERVIEWMAP@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have reached the overview map. As you explore the world, you will have many threats and opportunities to consider. Use this to inform your strategies.
TUTORIAL@OVERVIEWMAP@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Zooming back in will get you back to the regular view.
TUTORIAL@OVERVIEWMAP@PAGE01@TITLE Overview Map
TUTORIAL@OVERVIEWMAP@TITLE Overview Map
TUTORIAL@PILLAGING@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on pillaging provinces and the ruins that remain
TUTORIAL@PILLAGING@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION When you are inside of the domain belonging to your enemy, you can pillage their <<m:{GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink}>> to gain resources.
TUTORIAL@PILLAGING@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Move an army onto a {GLOBAL.ProvinceImprovementConcept.Hyperlink} and select the "Pillage Province Improvement" button.

TUTORIAL@PILLAGING@TITLE Pillaging & Ruins
TUTORIAL@PRISONCRYPT@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on the prison and crypt in your Throne City
TUTORIAL@PRISONCRYPT@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION A defeated hero has been put in your prison or crypt. You can either hand them over to their rightful owners and get their equipment in the process, or you can keep them here for now.
TUTORIAL@PRISONCRYPT@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Upgrading your Wizard Tower in the Throne City will unlock additional benefits for the prison and crypt.
TUTORIAL@PRISONCRYPT@PAGE01@TITLE Prison & Crypt
TUTORIAL@PRISONCRYPT@TITLE Prison & Crypt
TUTORIAL@RALLYOFLIEGES@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on the Rally of the Lieges
TUTORIAL@RALLYOFLIEGES@PAGE00@DESCRIPTION Something is available in your {GLOBAL.RequestMilitaryAidConcept.Hyperlink}. To access your Rally of the Lieges, select the button with the trumpet symbol from the top bar.
TUTORIAL@RALLYOFLIEGES@PAGE00@OBJECTIVE Open Rally of the Lieges
TUTORIAL@RALLYOFLIEGES@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have opened the Rally of the Lieges overview. Here you can rally armies from your <<m:{GLOBAL.PvEVassalConcept.Hyperlink}>> and conquered <<m:{GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}>>. The amount of units you can rally is determined by how many vassals and Ancient Wonders you own.
TUTORIAL@RALLYOFLIEGES@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION A rally happens regularly. This can be sped up by spending {GLOBAL.GoldConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/]You can come back to the Rally of Lieges at any time before the next rally starts to recruit more units.
TUTORIAL@RALLYOFLIEGES@PAGE01@TITLE Rally of the Lieges
TUTORIAL@RALLYOFLIEGES@TITLE Rally of the Lieges
TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on selecting tomes and researching their skills
TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@PAGE00@INSTRUCTION Open the Arcane Research screen with the button on the top left of the screen.
TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@PAGE00@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER Open the Arcane Research screen by opening the radial menu using [ci_buttony/] and selecting the tome icon.
TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@PAGE00@OBJECTIVE Open Arcane Research
TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION Arcane research enables you to learn new <<m:{GLOBAL.SpellConcept.Hyperlink}>> and acquire new units. The culture and {GLOBAL.TomeConcept.Hyperlink} you have chosen for your faction determine the initial skills you can unlock through arcane research.
TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Choose one of the skills that seems the most useful to you.
TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@PAGE01@OBJECTIVE Choose a skill
TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@PAGE01@TITLE Arcane Research
TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@PAGE02@DESCRIPTION Your empire will research the skill over time using your {GLOBAL.KnowledgeConcept.Hyperlink} income. Once the research is completed, you will choose between three new skills.
TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@TITLE Research
TUTORIAL@SIEGING@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on laying siege to cities
TUTORIAL@SIEGING@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have started a {GLOBAL.SiegeConcept} on this city. It takes a number of turns to breach the city's walls, depending on its {GLOBAL.FortificationHealthConcept}.[br/]The following assault may be bloody, but a city is a valuable prize when captured.
TUTORIAL@SIEGING@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION To influence the duration of a siege, you can pick <<m:{GLOBAL.SiegeProjectConcept.Hyperlink}>> on the bottom left of the siege screen. These can speed up the siege or destroy enemy defenses to make the upcoming battle easier.
TUTORIAL@SIEGING@PAGE01@TITLE Laying Siege
TUTORIAL@SIEGING@TITLE Sieges
TUTORIAL@SPECIALIMPROVEMENTS@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on special improvements
TUTORIAL@SPECIALIMPROVEMENTS@PAGE00@INSTRUCTION Special Improvements can be built in your cities. Go to the production list of one of your cities.
TUTORIAL@SPECIALIMPROVEMENTS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You are about to build a special province improvement. These must be built on top of existing improvements. They provide better economic bonuses and are often affected by the provinces around them.
TUTORIAL@SPECIALIMPROVEMENTS@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Select a province you want to build this special province improvement on.
TUTORIAL@SPECIALIMPROVEMENTS@PAGE01@TITLE Special Improvements
TUTORIAL@SPECIALIMPROVEMENTS@TITLE Special Improvements
TUTORIAL@SPELLCASTING@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on priming and casting spells
TUTORIAL@SPELLCASTING@PAGE00@INSTRUCTION To access your spells, select the blue button next to your Ruler in the bottom right.
TUTORIAL@SPELLCASTING@PAGE00@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER To access your spells, open the radial menu with [ci_buttony/] and select the star icon.
TUTORIAL@SPELLCASTING@PAGE00@OBJECTIVE Open spell list
TUTORIAL@SPELLCASTING@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION This is your spell list. You can cast various spells from here to bolster your units and cities, or to smite your enemies.
TUTORIAL@SPELLCASTING@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION There are two kinds of spells. Strategic spells can only be cast on the {GLOBAL.WorldMapConcept.Hyperlink}, while tactical spells may only be cast during {GLOBAL.CombatConcept.Hyperlink}. Some spells, such as summons or enchantments, are sustained, in which case they cost {GLOBAL.SpellUpkeepConcept.Hyperlink}.[br/][br/] To cancel an active spell, go to the "Active" tab. You can see all your ongoing spells here.
TUTORIAL@SPELLCASTING@PAGE01@TITLE Spells
TUTORIAL@SPELLCASTING@TITLE Spellcasting
TUTORIAL@STABILITY@DESCRIPTION Stability measures how happy the people in your cities are. Outside of Dark Cultures which do not suffer from low stability penalties, you generally want to keep your stability high.
TUTORIAL@STABILITY@INSTRUCTIONS You can find the stability of your cities by hovering over the [happiness/] mask symbol next to the city name in the city interface.
TUTORIAL@STABILITY@TITLE City Stability
TUTORIAL@THRONECITY@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on the Throne City
TUTORIAL@THRONECITY@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have selected your {GLOBAL.ThroneCityConcept.Hyperlink}. Your Throne City is the most important city in your {GLOBAL.EmpireConcept.Hyperlink}.
TUTORIAL@THRONECITY@PAGE01@INSTRUCTIONS Your current Throne City is {VarThroneCity}. This is where you can build your {GLOBAL.WizardTowerConcept.Hyperlink} and where your Ruler will reappear when <<p:PlayerLeader>> [hyperlink,GLOBAL.RulerVoidConcept]perishes[/hyperlink]. If you lose both your Throne City and your {GLOBAL.LeaderConcept.Hyperlink}, you are defeated. You can relocate your throne to any other city through the City Information screen.
TUTORIAL@THRONECITY@TITLE Throne City
TUTORIAL@TOMEOFWONDERS@DESCRIPTION You can open the Encyclopedia to find information about various units, mechanics, or spells.
TUTORIAL@TOMEOFWONDERS@INSTRUCTIONS The button is located in the top right corner of the screen, marked by [tow/].
TUTORIAL@TOMEOFWONDERS@INSTRUCTIONS_CONTROLLER To open the Encyclopedia screen, press [ci_buttony/] to open the radial menu and then choose the [tow/] button.
TUTORIAL@TOMEOFWONDERS@TITLE Encyclopedia
TUTORIAL@TOMESELECTION@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on selecting tomes and advancing in arcane research
TUTORIAL@TOMESELECTION@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have acquired enough arcane skills to choose a new tome to add to your research library. Additional tomes will expand the selection of arcane skills available to you.
TUTORIAL@TOMESELECTION@PAGE01@TITLE Tome Selection
TUTORIAL@TOMESELECTION@PAGE02@DESCRIPTION Selecting two <<m:{GLOBAL.TomeConcept.Hyperlink}>> from the current tier will unlock new more powerful Tomes. To unlock the highest tiers of Tomes you will also need a large amount of specific {GLOBAL.AffinityConcept.Hyperlink}.
TUTORIAL@TOMESELECTION@PAGE02@INSTRUCTION Every Tome grants a collection of spells, units and other upgrades to research. Read the summaries and pick a Tome that fits your play style.
TUTORIAL@TOMESELECTION@PAGE02@OBJECTIVE Choose a new tome
TUTORIAL@TOMESELECTION@TITLE Tome Selection
TUTORIAL@TOOLTIPS@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on the use of hyperlinks and tooltips.
TUTORIAL@TOOLTIPS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You can always find out more about a topic if you ever need more information to inform your decisions.
TUTORIAL@TOOLTIPS@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION You will often find a {GLOBAL.HyperlinkConcept.Hyperlink} in text. Hovering over one will show important information about a concept or system. Hover your mouse over the underscored word "Hyperlink" above to open a tooltip.
TUTORIAL@TOOLTIPS@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER You will often find a {GLOBAL.HyperlinkConcept.Hyperlink} in text. Hovering over one will show important information about a concept or system. Move your selection over the underscored word "Hyperlink" above and use [ci_options/] to go into the tooltip.
TUTORIAL@TOOLTIPS@PAGE01@TITLE Hyperlinks & Tooltips
TUTORIAL@TOOLTIPS@TITLE Hyperlinks & Tooltips
TUTORIAL@TRANSFORMATION@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on Race Transformations
TUTORIAL@TRANSFORMATION@TITLE Transformations
TUTORIAL@TRANSFORMATIONS@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION Race Transformations are costly but powerful spells. They alter a race of which you are a {GLOBAL.KeeperConcept.Hyperlink}, granting them powerful permanent bonuses.
TUTORIAL@TRANSFORMATIONS@PAGE01@INSTRUCTIONS Major Transformations are exclusive so each race may only have one. Minor Tranformations are weaker but they have no such limitation.
TUTORIAL@UNDERGROUND@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on the Underground layer
TUTORIAL@UNDERGROUND@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION This is the {GLOBAL.UndergroundConcept.Hyperlink}. It is rich in minerals and <<m:{GLOBAL.AncientWonderConcept.Hyperlink}>>. As long as you have access to a passage, you can freely move between the surface and the underground.
TUTORIAL@UNDERGROUND@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION The {GLOBAL.ExcavationConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.EmpireSkillConcept.Hyperlink} is useful for navigating the underground by removing diggable earth. This can sometimes hide treasures or marauder armies ready to attack and pillage your cities. Races with the Underground Adaptation trait fare better in the Underground. [br/] To leave the underground you can [leftmousebutton/] click on the layer button in the top right corner.
TUTORIAL@UNDERGROUND@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER The {GLOBAL.ExcavationConcept.Hyperlink} {GLOBAL.EmpireSkillConcept.Hyperlink} is useful for navigating the underground by removing diggable earth. This can sometimes hide treasures or marauder armies ready to attack and pillage your cities. Races with the Underground Adaptation trait fare better in the Underground. [br/] To leave the underground press [ci_lefttrigger/].
TUTORIAL@UNDERGROUND@PAGE01@TITLE The Underground
TUTORIAL@UNDERGROUND@TITLE Underground
TUTORIAL@UNITPANEL@DESCRIPTION Tutorial on how to use the Unit Panel to get information on each unit.
TUTORIAL@UNITPANEL@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION You have selected a unit and opened the unit panel. This panel shows the details on a unit and what the unit is capable of, as well as any weaknesses you could exploit.
TUTORIAL@UNITPANEL@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION You can hover over the icons to learn more about a unit's abilities, passives and unit types.
TUTORIAL@UNITPANEL@PAGE01@TITLE Unit Panel
TUTORIAL@UNITPANEL@TITLE Unit Information
TUTORIAL@UNITTIER@DESCRIPTION Beware! You are engaging combat with a high tier unit. {GLOBAL.UnitTierConcept.Hyperlink} are shown in the bottom left of their portraits in the army panel.
TUTORIAL@UNITTIER@INSTRUCTION The higher a unit's tier, the more dangerous they are. [rightmousebutton/] Right-click on their portrait to investigate them further, and prepare accordingly—or rethink this combat.
TUTORIAL@UNITTIER@TITLE Unit Tiers
TUTORIAL@VICOTRY@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Victory can be claimed through the Expansion Victory, Magic Victory, Score Victory or Military Victory.[br/][br/]You can click on each victory to see detail of its conditions and your progress.

TUTORIAL@WELCOME@DESCRIPTION An introduction message
TUTORIAL@WELCOME@PAGE01@DESCRIPTION A new Age of Wonders dawns.
TUTORIAL@WELCOME@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION Allow me to lend some aid, O {PlayerLeader.Title}. During play, messages like this will provide advice on how to achieve victory on this realm. Some of these will trigger objectives for your growing empire.[br/][br/]Click on the [questionmark/] button on the bottom right to open additional advice. If you want to re-read any Advice, you can open the Advice History in the same menu by pressing the [checkmark/] button. You can disable and reset these messages in the Settings menu.
TUTORIAL@WELCOME@PAGE01@INSTRUCTION_CONTROLLER Allow me to lend some aid, O {PlayerLeader.Title}. During play, messages like this will provide advice on how to achieve victory on this realm. Some of these will trigger objectives for your growing empire.[br/][br/]Check the Advisor list by opening the radial menu with [ci_buttony/] and selecting the ? Advice option. If you want to re-read any Advice, you can open the Advice History in the same menu by pressing the [ci_rightbumper/] button.

WILDLIFE_UNITPROPERTIES@TENTACLE_VORTEX@NAME Tentacle Vortex
